loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Las Adelinas del distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace más de diez años, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar diversos cultivos como arroz y maíz, debido a la abundancia de agua para regadíos en la zona, se suele sembrar estos cultivos hasta dos veces por año, a diferencia de otras zonas de la región en las cuales se siembra solo una vez. Este cereal es bastante consumido en el país por lo que su cultivo es bastante importante en la alimentación de las familias peruanas.

José Carlos depende de esta actividad para solventar los gastos de su familia por lo que siempre trata de entregar lo mejor de sí para sacar a su cultivo adelante. Actualmente desea instalar su cultivo de maíz por lo que desea preparar su terreno aplicando algunos nutrientes. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído necesario solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

José Carlos ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad el pudo sacar adelante un cultivo de arroz gracias a este préstamo y debido a ello pudo asegurarle a su familia el sustento. Por este motivo se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con él a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
José Carlos is a 46 year-old father who lives together with his wife and two children in Las Adelinas sector of Cayaltí district, an agricultural district with considerable commercial activity which is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José Carlos has worked in agriculture for more than ten years.  He owns a plot of farmland where he grows a number of crops including rice and corn.  Owing to the abundance of irrigation water in the area, these crops are usually planted up to twice a year, unlike in other areas of the region where they are sown only once.

This cereal is widely consumed in the country which means that its cultivation is quite important for feeding Peruvian families.  José Carlos depends on this business to cover his family's expenses which is why he always works his hardest in order to succeed in his production.  He would currently like to sow his corn crop and would therefore like to prepare his land, applying some nutrients.  In order to achieve his goal, he is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa and their 'Seed Capital' product.

José Carlos will be able to use this loan to get ahead with his rice crop and thereby support his family.  For this reason, he is grateful to those who are working with him through Kiva.

loans.use: To prepare his land, applying some nutrients

loans.name: Turakhon

texts.ru: Бобоев Турахон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Турахон занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин в селе Маргоб. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Turakhon B. lives in Hamadoni Region. 57 years of age. Married, with seven children. His wife is a homemaker. Turakhon is in retail business. He keeps a grocery store in the village of  Margob. He has been in this business for five years. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es: La Señora Maria tiene una tienda D. Barrio en una zona periurbana D. la ciudad, el mes D. noviembre perdió a su esposo quien trabaja en la ciudad D. La Paz por esta razón ella tuvo que viajar a esa ciudad para encargarse del tramite D. su difunto esposo, la perdida D. su difunto esposo fue un golpe para ella pero esta saliendo adelante, ella tiene una tienda en su domicilio con la cual genera ingresos para su la manutención D. su familia cuenta con dos hijos uno ya casado y otro soltero ambos viven con ella, el motivo D. la solicitud D. prestamos es por que existe alza D. precios en los productos que comercia por esta razón quiere abastecerse D. víveres específicamente para que a un mediano plazo cuente con mercadería para poder comercializar sin sufrir incremento en sus costos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maria has a neighborhood store in a peri-urban area of the city.  In November she lost her husband who worked in the city of La Paz.  For this reason, she had to travel to that city to take care of all the paperwork.  Her husband's death was a blow for her but she is managing to get ahead.  Maria has a store in her home in which she makes income to support her family.  She has two children, one is already married and the other is single.  They both live with her.  

Maria is requesting this loan because the prices of the products she sells have risen.  For this reason, she would like to stock her store with products so that, in the medium term, she has merchandise to sell without having to suffer an increase in costs.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and macaroni for her store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old. Marilou is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 16 years old, while the youngest is only six. To make a living, Marilou raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marilou also owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She sells noodles, canned goods and other kinds of products. Marilou is thankful for her family's sources of income.

Marilou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: A. Jameela

texts.en: A.Jameela N. has one child. She sells fresh fish and provisions at Takoradi, which she has been doing for 11 years. Her husband is a welder. She assists her husband with household expenses. A loan will help her supply her customers with the things they request. She would like to expand her business with the increase in capital.

loans.use: to supply her customers with the things they request.

loans.name: Toni

texts.en:
Toni is a 46-year-old married man living in Bekaa with his wife and two children. Since 1990, Toni has worked changing car oil and wheels. He is an expert in his field, and his customers like dealing with him because his work is very good, he is clean and his customer service is excellent. To earn a second income, Tony plants tobacco and he pays severA. workers to harvest the crops. 
Toni is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to improve his business by adding more products. He will also use the loan to pay his workers in his second business. Toni's garage is in a very good place and most passers-by visit him, which is a very good point. Toni hopes to improve and expand both businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in his repair shop.

loans.name: Las Solidarias I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SOLIDARIAS porque es un grupo de mujeres que siempre se han apoyado entre si, ayudandose en situaciones adversas y riendose juntas en momentos felices. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes, cada una siendo mujeres de trabajo arduo. La señora Zoila R. H. es la tesorera y lider del grupo, ella es casada y tiene  tres hijos de 18, 9 y 5  años, estudio hasta la secundaria y, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de comal, ella comenzo con un pequeño comal en el patio de su casa y ahora ya cuenta con un pequeñito local y una empleada. La señora Zoilita como la llaman de cariño, necesita el crédito para la compra de maiz, comenta que para ella lo más importante es su familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, le gustaria tener una grande tortilleria con varios empleados.
texts.en:
This group is called SOLIDARIAS because it’s a group of women who constantly support one another, helping one another during adverse situations and laughing together during happy moments.  This group is in the state of Mexico and is made up of nine hard working women.  Mrs. Zoila R. H. is the treasurer and group leader.  She is married and has three children, ages 18, 9, and 5.  She has a junior high school education.

Zoila makes and sells tortillas and started with a small hotplate on her patio.  Now she has a small point of sale and one employee.  Zoilita, as she is affectionately referred to, needs this loan to buy dried corn.  She tells us that there is nothing more important to her than helping her children to get ahead and helping her husband with the household expenses.  One day she would like to have a large tortilla factory with many employees.

loans.use: to buy dried corn.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan C. is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya. He is married with three children ages between 11 years and three months. Duncan has been in farming for 6 years producing milk and selling to the local market. He employs two farmhands. 

Duncan is requesting  a loan amounting to 81,000 KES  to purchase and insure a dairy cow through Juhudi Kilimo as well as to put up a dairy unit. He says the income will make him financially stable and better able to take care of his family. He is also focusing on owning better dairy breeds.

Duncan says getting reliable suppliers of quality dairy breeds is still a great challenge as often the breeders can not be trusted to be truthful about the breeds..

loans.use: Purchase and insure  a dairy cow and to build a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. He has 25 years of experience working in the food and beverage domain. And in 2008, after this extensive experience, he opened his own cafeteria. During those years, this older man was able to have an increasing number of clients who helped him achieve greater income. This will be his second Kiva loan. We note that he has a very good repayment history. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplementary materials and equipment needed for his cafeteria. He will also renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary materials and equipment.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Ditavan village, Tavush Marz. She is married and has four children: three daughters and a son.
 
Anzhela and her husband have been engaged in beekeeping for a long time. They say bee families need systematic and careful concern, and thanks to Anzhela's and her husband's treatment and diligence, they get high-quality honey. That honey they trade or sell on the market. With income from beekeeping they meet their family's needs and develop their farm. 

Anzhela breeds cows and calves on her farm as well. She needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy five beehives, some piglets and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: To buy five beehives, some piglets and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man and the father of four children. Three of the children are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced furniture carpenter and has owned a carpentry shop since 1995. He makes original furniture designs and modern ones. He works upon the request of his clients. He is the main income provider of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tools and supplies for his work. He estimates that the upcoming results will be prosperous and successful thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 61 años D. edad que resiD. en casa D. sus padres con sus hermanos y un sobrino en un sector del distrito D. Reque. Un distrito a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo situado en la provincia D. Lambayeque.

Ana se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desD. que era más joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ganado vacuno y ovino, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donD. resiD.. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos D. la venta D. leche.

Ella desea adquirir más animales menores y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ana es una persona muy alegre, bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 61 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her siblings and a nephew.  They resides in a section of the District of Reque, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Province.  

Ana has been engaged in farm work since she was a young girl.  In addition, she raises animals such as cows and sheep.  The animals are kept in corrals near her home and their diet consists of grains and natural grasses.  When the animals have reached the proper stage of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who frequently visit the area where she lives.  In addition, she earns income by selling milk.  

Ana wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed so that she can expand her business and generate more income.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can accomplish her goal.  

Ana is a cheerful, earnest, and hardworking person.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 26 años, conviviente con un hijo de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado 12 de Abril, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
Nancy vende ropa sólo para caballeros y le va bien, le gusta por la facilidad en los préstamos, la capacitación que reciben y se puede ahorrar. Está ahorrando para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank Despertar. She is 26 years old and lives with her son, who is 4. She sells clothing in the 12th of April market. She will invest the loan that she is applying for in the purchase of more merchandise.

Nancy sells only clothing for men, and it is going well. She likes (the communal bank) because of the ease of obtaining loans, the training that they receive, and because she can save. She is saving for the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men.

loans.name: Dimbalante Group

texts.fr:
Le Dimbalante est crée le 17 mai 2010 et regroupe 13 femmes qui sont toutes du même village; leurs activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche
Mime est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 49 ans et mariée mère de 6 enfants debout sur la photo couverte d'un châle vert. elle achète des légumes en ville et revend dans son village, elle fait aussi de l'embouche bovine.Elle fait ces activités depuis 10 ans.
texts.en: Dimbalante was set up on 17th May 2010 and is a grouping of 13 women who are all from the same village; they have small trading businesses and fatten up animals. Mime is in charge of the group and is 49 years old. She is married and mother to six children and she is standing up in the photo and wearing a green shawl. She buys vegetables and resells them in her village; she also has a beef fattening activity. She has been carrying out these activities for the past ten years.

loans.use: to buy and resell vegetables for consumption

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia 28 años de edad, ella es casada y cuenta con casa propia,  La cual está ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de Castilla, en el departamento Piura al norte del Perú.

Lidia se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades,el negocio lo a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, pero también deja mercadería en otros caseríos y cobra cada fin de mes, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

Al observar Lidia que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar prendas de vestir novedosas y en mayor cantidad para abastecer su tienda con productos de   innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Lidia es una persona responsable  y que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo,está saliendo adelante, cuenta con muy buenas referncias y con la estima de las personas que la conocen.
texts.en:
Lidia is 28 and married.  She lives in her own house, which is located in a rural area of the Castilla district in the department of Piura in the north of Peru.

Lidia sells clothes for all ages.  She has been conducting this business from her home for several years, but she also leaves merchandise in other villages and charges for it at the end of the month in order to stimulate more demand from her clients and thereby gain more income to help with the household expenses.

Lidia says that her business is more and more prosperous every day, and she is seeking a loan of $375 (1000 new soles) from microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa to buy a new and greater stock of clothing.  She will use this stock to fill her shop with innovative products so that her clientele keeps growing, thus allowing her to pay off the loan and raise her family's quality of life.

Lidia is a trustworthy person  and, with much effort and work, she is getting ahead. She comes well-recommended and with the esteem of those who know her.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con  todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, ganadera y agrícola.

Carlos se dedica a brindar servicio de carga en su camión, lleva todo tipo de productos para el consumo diario de las personas, también lleva a otros sitios aledaños al lugar de donde vive, tiene su propia clientela, con esta actividad tiene 9 años y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades diarias.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 3000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su camión y para comprar verduras para vender, con la finalidad de que con el dinero que gane pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Carlos con esfuerzo y trabajo trata de superarse en la vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old.  He owns the home he lives in with his family.  The house has all basic services and is located in the urban area of the Guadalupe district, which is part of the state of Libertad. This area is know for commercial activity, ranching, and agriculture. 

Carlos provides cargo transport services with his truck.  He transports all types of products for people's daily use.  He also transports items to other nearby towns.  He has his own customers and has had this business for 9 years.  The income he earns covers his expenses and daily needs.  He has requested a loan for Edpyma Alternativa for Seed Capital of 3000 new soles to perform maintenance on his truck and to purchase vegetables to sell.  The goal is to use the money he earns to pay off his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  With effort and hard work, Carlos is trying to improve his and his family's lives.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his truck and to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and motor vehicle repairs. 

For over one year, he has operated a motor vehicle transport business, his potential customers are passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in his business. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.fr:
Kayitesi est salariée. Elle est née au Rwanda et a 48 ans. Elle est veuve et elle a 1 enfant de 20 ans, elle est scolarisée. 

C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 4 tours des camions de sable, 15 sacs de ciments et payer la main d’œuvre pour la construction de sa maison.

Dans les prochaines années, Kayitesi voudrait bâtir d’autres maisons d'habitation à louer. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de développer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kayitesi is employed. She was born in Rwanda and is 48 years old. She is a widow and she has 1 20-year-old child She is educated. 

This is her fourth loan cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 4 truckloads of sand, 15 bags of cement and to pay for the labor for the construction of her house. 

In the coming years, Kayitesi would like to build other houses to rent. With the profits, she plans to extend the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 4 truckloads of sand, 15 bags of cement and to pay for the labor for the construction of her house

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Hesbone is the facilitator of the Muungano group. Hesbone and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hesbon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Hesbone joined One Acre Fund in order to garner additional maize profits from his farm. In the recent 2011 season, Hesbone had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Hesbone was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Hesbone will invest in a cow and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of the Muungano group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1.5 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for general maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married with one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Reham has a cosmetics store and she wants to purchase more cosmetics and accessories for sale, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Reham gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more accessories and cosmetics to her store and have more collections for sale. This will increase her income and enable her to offer better living conditions to her family. Reham is a conservative woman, so her husband Yasser is photographed instead in the store.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. Avelino is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Avelino owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. He earns 40,000 PHP quarterly and has had this work for 4 years.

In 2010, Avelino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Avelino requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His future plan is to expand his farmland and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a mother of five children between the ages of four and 12. She lives with her family in their home in Kitale. For the last six years, she has been a farmer and she produces milk and maize for the local market. Catherine laments the high costs of farm inputs and animal disease management. 

Catherine is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle to venture into the transport business. Catherine plans to begin this business because she sees potential for growth. She also hopes to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: El Diamante Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Diamante esta conformado por diez mujeres muy alegres y trabajadoras, la comunidad en la que viven se caracteriza por que su clima es calido ya que esta rodeado de arboleras de hule.

La señora Marcela es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 21 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor sergio  que trabaja como jornalero, ellos tienen una hija de cinco años que asiste al preescolar y esta embarazada.

Doña Marcela platica que desde muy pequeña su mama le enseño a trabajar y a cocinar ya que vendían antojitos mexicanos en la primaria de su comunidad, ahora que esta casada ella nos dice que continua haciendo sus ventas para ganer un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ella realiza sus ventas de lunes a viernes a las diez de la mañana en la primaria, ella lleva una mesa en la cual coloca sus antojitos y dulces para cuando los niños salgan al recreo le compren sus alimentos.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, crema, queso, maiz,col, lechuga, aguacate, platanos, papas y dulces para la elaboracion de sus ventas.

Ella dice que espera con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y a futuro quiere poner una pequeña fondita para vender sus antojitos mexicanos.
"gracias fundacion realidad por el apoyo que me estan dando"

los demas integrantes son: 

Matilde venta de carne
Maria venta de reposteria 
Juana venta de antojitos
Luisa venta de antojitos
Andres venta de antojitos
Patricia club de nutricion
Maria Isabel venta de ropa
Gloria venta de dulces 
Teresa cria de cerdos
texts.en:
The “El Diamante” (The Diamond) group has ten members who are very cheerful, hardworking woman. The community they live in is noted for its hot climate since it’s surrounded by rubber trees.

Marcela is one of the group members.  She’s 21 years old and completed 9th grade.  She’s married to Sergio who works as a day laborer.  They have a five-year-old daughter who goes to preschool.  Marcela is pregnant.

Marcela relates that when she was a little girl her mother taught her to work and to cook because they sold Mexican fast food snacks at the local elementary school.  Now that she’s married she tells us that she continues selling to earn a bit of extra money to help her husband with household expenses.  Her sales take place Monday through Friday at 10am at the elementary school.  She takes a table where she sets up her snacks and candies so that when the children come out for recess they’ll buy their snacks from her.

She needs this loan to buy chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, cream, cheese, corn, cabbage, lettuce, avocadoes, bananas, potatoes and candy to make her snacks to sell.

She says that she hopes the loan will lead to her business prospering because she wants to provide her daughter with a better quality of life and in future set up a small eatery to sell her Mexican fast food snacks.  “Thank you Fundación Realidad for the support you are giving me.”

The other group members are:

Matilde – meat sales
Maria – pastry sales 
Juana – fast food snack sales
Luisa – fast food snack sales
Andrea – fast food snack sales
Patricia – nutrition club
Maria Isabel – clothing sales
Gloria – candy sales
Teresa – pig raising

loans.use: to buy chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, oil and corn to make Mexican fast food snacks.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. Hong is a 32-year-old married man and the loving father of two school-aged kids. To earn a living, he cultivates rice crops, both in the rainy season and the dry season. He’s very hardworking and a responsible husband who always spends most of his time at the fields. From this business, he is able to generate an income of approximately $1.50 each day. His wife also helps him in earning income by working in a garment factory as a sewing worker in Kampong Chhnang Province. With this loan amount, Mr. Hong intends to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for growing his dry-season rice. His future goal is to build a construction team and own construction projects.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for growing his dry-season rice

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is taking another Kiva loan of KES 60,000 to boost her clothes-selling business, as she anticipates an increase in demand during the festive season. With the loans, she wants to purchase bales of Kikois for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Kikois for resale

loans.name: Panian

texts.en:
Panian is forty-three years old and married to Mpaire.  They are blessed with three children who are all in school.  He runs a transport service business in Kajiado town.  He has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of KES 5,000 per month.

Panian is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd with which he plans to add more money from his savings to purchase another motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to pay his children's school fees.

Panian hopes to build a rental house in his plot of land.  He says that he is very hard working.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 33 years old and a married man with 5 children. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business for 7 years. Ricardo is able to provide for his family's daily needs through his business. He hopes to have another source of income to sustain his children's education.

Ricardo has requested this loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes to improve his family's quality of life through his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en: Laurita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Laurita has a shop that makes and sells stick brooms. She uses her pedicab for the delivery of brooms to retailer stores. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy materials needed for making brooms to sell. Laurita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Laurita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making brooms to sell

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 53 years old. She has 6 children who are between the ages of of 13 and 30. Except the oldest others are enrolled in schools. Evaste sells potatoes and bananas for the period of three years. With the loan she will buy more potatoes and bananas for sale. She plans to use the profits for making her home clean as well as renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and bananas for sale

loans.name: Lucy Margarita

texts.en:
Luci Margarita U. D. and her husband, who is a farmer, have been dedicated to the culture of the Pitahaya and Havanan Chile for approximately 10 years in Kinchil, a small town located in Yucatan. The agriculture is the only way that they have to maintain their children.

They began this business because they love commerce and also out of economic necessity. In addition, Luci has been selling fresh chicken and vegetables for 4 years. She does not currently have enough capital, and for this reason she needs credit of US$925 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, tools and raw materials. This is important for their business because of the season and potential success in December with sales.

Luci is offering to repay the loan in 6 months, at least. All of this is done with the purpose of obtaining a better harvest to increase sales and Luci's family income.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Luci Margarita U. D. y su esposo que es agricultor, se dedican al cultivo de la Pitahaya y chile habanero desde hace aproximadamente 10 años en Kinchil, un poblado de Yucatán; la agricultura es el único medio que tienen ellos para el sustento de sus hijos, ellos empezaron este negocio por el gusto al comercio y la necesidad económica, además, vende pollo fresco y verduras desde hace 4 años. Por falta de capital Luci necesita un crédito de US$925 dólares americanos para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herramientas e insumos para su negocio en esta temporada que se avecina (Diciembre), ofreciendo pagarlo en por lo menos 6 meses. Todo esto con el fin de obtener una mejor cosecha, incrementar sus ventas y a su vez su ingreso familiar.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers,and tools

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo tiene su negocio de ebanistería. Desde joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en la madera, haciendo muebles para las casas, especialmente camas. El tiene una casa y tiene ubicado allí su negocio. Todos los del sector lo conocen por su trabajo y son ellos que les recomiendan más clientes. Arturo todos los días atiende el negocio.

Gracias a su trabajo él ha podido mantener su hogar y educar a sus hijos que ya son independientes. Él esta solicitando para un préstamo y desea comprar: madera ya que al llegar la temporada de lluvia, ésta escasea y es más cara.

Arturo nació en Manabí, tiene 68 años, con 7 hijos. Su esposa todavía lo acompaña. Ella ha sido su gran apoyo en el hogar. Arturo toda su vida ha trabajado y a pesar de su edad lo sigue haciendo. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron educar a sus hijos y actualmente ellos tienen sus propios negocios. Su trabajo es su único ingreso que tiene y no desea ser mantenido de sus hijos. Además el trabajo lo mantiene activo.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Arturo has a furniture-making workshop. Since he was young, Arturo has been working with wood making furniture, especially beds. He owns a house and that’s where his workshop is. All the people in his neighborhood know his work and they are the ones who recommend more clients to him. Arturo opens his workshop everyday.

Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to provide for his home and give education to his children, all of which are now independent. Arturo is applying for a loan to buy wood, because when the rain season comes, wood becomes scarce and more expensive.

Arturo was born in Manabí, he’s 68 and has 7 children. His wife still keeps him company and has been a great support for their home. Arturo has worked his whole life and despite his old age, he is still working. Thanks to both of their efforts, they were able to educate their children and nowadays they all have their own businesses. Arturo’s work is his only source of income and he doesn’t want to depend on his children. Also, work keeps him active.

loans.use: para comprar madera y arreglar un motor

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48 years of age. She has a 27-year-old son who lives with her. She was never able to count on her son’s father for support and has therefore worked hard to provide for her son’s needs. Although Alejandrina works as a driver in public transportation, for the past seven years she has been running her own jewelry business. She enjoys sales and has been able to earn the extra income she needs to improve her son's and mother's quality of life.

At this time, Alejandrina is in need of a loan of $475 to acquire the merchandise needed to offer a greater selection to her customers and thereby increase sales. She would like to see her business grow and is working hard to achieve this. You can help make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 27 años que vive con ella, nunca contó con el apoyo del padre de su hijo por lo que ha trabajado mucho para poder darle lo necesario. Aunque Alejandrina trabaja como chofer en un transporte público, hace siete años tiene su propio negocio de venta de joyería, a ella le gustan las ventas y de esta manera ha podido obtener un ingreso extra que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y de su madre.

En estos momentos Alejandrina necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía que le permita tener una mayor variedad que ofrecerle a sus clientes y así incrementar las ventas. Ella desea ver crecer su negocio y se esfuerza para lograrlo, tú puedes ayudarla, contribuye a la realización de este sueño, tú puedes hacerlo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Kenjong

texts.en:
Kenjong owns a small business selling natural juices. Throughout the year he will sell orange, grapefruit, pineapple, and watermelon juices to his customers, as he has done for the last 16 years. When Mr. P. moved from Manabi to Guayaquil, he was without work for quite some time.

Desperate and in need of a job, Kenjong’s business idea came to him while walking near one of the local universities. He noticed the large number of students buying things from the local vendors. The next day he bought a table, plastic cups, a juicer, and 100 oranges to begin selling fresh-squeezed orange juice to the college kids. Every day from 7am until 10pm for the past two years, Kenjong has been at this location, paying $112 a month in rent. Sometimes in the afternoon his wife will help him run the juice stand after she is done with work.

With two sources of income coming in, the Pins lead a modest but fulfilling life. Kenjong thanks God every day because his juice stand has changed his life and given him opportunities that he never had before. Kenjong is requesting this, his second loan, in order to continue investing in fruit so he may diversify his store and his offerings.

Kenjong is a 39 year old entrepreneur with two children and a loving, supportive wife. They own their own house, and thanks to the success he has had at the juice stand, Kenjong was able to reinforce the house with cement. They want people to know that they are a very hard-working family and that they use their money wisely to plan for future endeavors, such as expanding the business to new branch locations across Guayaquil.

loans.use: Invest in fruit and improvements to his store

loans.name: Maeva

texts.en: Maeva G. is one of the new ladies joining the  programme. This is her second loan of $1250 and this is a very busy time for Maeva especially the South Pacific Games on the way here  in Samoa. Instead of opening her shop in front of her own house, Maeva rents one of the stores at Fugalei Market which is more profitable because it offers more customers than in the village. She opens six days of the week from six in the morning to five o’clock in the evening. Maeva’s husband is in New Zealand and he sends about five hundred fortnightly to Maeva for the shop. They have no children and Maeva is focusing on improving her business so that she can get more in the weeks of the South Pacific Games.

loans.use: Buy two boxes of mutton flaps, chicken legs, mosquito coils, cartoon of cigarettes, and other stuff for the shop.”

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Saidi is a 38-year-old mother of four and a resident of Vituka, in the Dar Es Salaam region. She has been in the grocery business for 5 years and operates a store in the nearby trading center. She has recently started selling ladies used and new clothes as well as operating the grocery.  Saidi wants to transform her grocery into a larger wholesale shop and would like a loan of $500 to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Expand her grocery store into a larger wholesale shop, selling clothing and other goods

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza very much wishes to improve her current situation because she wants to give her two children the possibility to attend university so that they can have a better future. What she learned herself has helped her to improve her family's situation and to help her husband in his sales of firewood.

She decided to raise chickens in her home in order to commercialize their sales and has recently begun to implement a space to raise hogs as well, with the goal of being able to save money and in the future be able to practice her profession as a seamstress she learned while working in a tailor shop and to purchase the tools and equipment she would need for such a business. While she continues to raise chickens to sell in the local market, her current goal is to increase and improve her chicken coop and increase the investment capital in her husband's business, with the goal of contributing to the career goals of their children, as well as improving her family's standard of living. We ask on behalf of this selfless mother for your support to help her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Maritza tiene muchos deseos de superación porque quiere otorgarles a sus dos hijos la posibilidad de acceder a la universidad con el objetivo de forjarse un futuro mejor. Lo que aprendió le ha valido para sacar adelante a su familia y su esposo por su parte contribuye con la venta de leña. Decidió criar pollos en su casa para comercializarlos y hace poco ha empezado a implementar su criadero de cerdos, esto con el propósito de ahorrar y a futuro ejercer el noble oficio que aprendió durante su experiencia de trabajo en un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, aunque para ello falta mucho sigue proyectándose y planea poco a poco comprar lo necesario para implementar su taller. Mientras tanto seguirá dedicándose a la crianza de pollos para comercializarlos en el mercado local, su pronta necesidad es implementar y mejorar su granja de pollos e incrementar el capital de inversión del negocio de su esposo con el objetivo de seguir contribuyendo con el desarrollo de las metas que se han trazado sus hijos, además de incrementar su nivel de vida familiar. Hagamos que el noble propósito de esta abnegada madre pueda convertirse en realidad.

loans.use: To improve her space in which she raises chickens and an increase in investment capital for the small business her husband runs.

loans.name: Cristina Xiomara

texts.es:
Cristina Xiomara L. is a married woman with many hopes to expand her business to be able to support her family and at the same time increase their quality of life.

Cristina Xiomara has worked selling used clothing for the past two years and her sales have increased thanks to the variety of products that she offers. Her starting capital was $4,500.00 in savings.

Cristina Xiomara has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and she is very happy with the loans that she has received because they were granted to her at the right time, helping her to meet the needs of her business and serve her customers daily. She has a record of five loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Cristina Xiomara L. es una mujer Casada y con muchísimos deseos de desarrollar su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia y al mismo tiempo tener una vida con mejores condiciones.

Desde hace Dos años Cristina Xiomara se dedica a la venta de Ropa usada, sus ventas incrementaron, debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece. Su capital de inicio fue de U$4,500.00 (dólares) de ahorros.

Cristina Xiomara trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de Cinco créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 28 years old. He is married and has two children who are studying in school. His mother and his brother live with him in a rented house. His brother is disabled from birth.

He have a small carpentry shop and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase new wood and some raw material and expand his project by renovating the shop to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and some raw materials

loans.name: Kireka C2 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane N.. She is currently in the business of running a canteen and selling clothes and is requesting a loan to add to both businesses. Jane is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 8 children ranging from age 11 to 28 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for her children's education. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Hanifha M., Fatuma N., Milly N., and Florence S.. Hanifha M. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to increase her inventory. Fatuma N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to boost business. Milly N. operates a canteen business and wants to purchase more snacks and edibles. Florence S. is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to uplift business.

loans.use: To add stock to canteen

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
During a period of financial difficulty for her family, Clara discovered a timely exit. She decided to sell vegetables at her local market and she has continued to do so for the past five years. You will always see Clara with a warm smile attending to her customers with great care - a quality that has led to increased sales. Now, she plans to improve her business, which is why she is seeking a loan. With you valued support, Clara will continue with her noble work.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La salida más oportuna fue hallada por Clara en un momento difícil y de escasez económica para su familia. Decidió vender verduras en el mercado de su localidad y ya lleva 5 años dedicándose a este trabajo, siempre verán a Clara con una cálida sonrisa atendiendo con mucha gentileza a sus clientes y esta cualidad ha hecho que sus ventas vayan en aumento por lo que ahora tiene proyectado mejorar su negocio y ese es el motivo de su petición de un préstamo. Con tu valioso aporte Clara continuará con su noble labor.

loans.use: To increase the variety of vegetables she offers.

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru:
Naim works as a taxi driver. He has recently married and has been working day and night to be able to feed his new family. The taxi drivers are keeping a watch where there's the most clientele, like around the market or the airport. As Naim says, the life of a taxi driver is not so easy. It might seems as they have a flexible schedule, no employers or bosses. Their main problem are traffic cops. As the drivers confess, the cops have been stopping them for any type of small offense. Naim takes of the taxi sign off his car for this reason in order to pass by them on road blocks. He needs the loan to make repairs to his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Наим работает таксистом. Он женат недавно, поэтому ему пришлось работать день и ночь что бы прокормить свою молодую семью. Таксисты дежурят неподалеку от тех мест, где много клиентов , например возле рынка или в аэропорту. По словам Наима, жизнь таксиста не так уж легка. Казалось бы, свободный график работы, отсутствие какого бы то ни было начальства. Портят жизнь таксистам и работники ГАИ. Как рассказали водители, в последнее время инспекторы их останавливают за малейшее нарушение. Поэтому он иногда снимает свою шашечную доску с такси , что бы проехать мимо ГАИшников. Он получил кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.

loans.use: Taxi service

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is Jane S., who is married and has no children and one dependent. In 2006, Jane established her snacks and soft drinks business. Working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $110 every month. Jane has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional bulk stocks of soda, as well as ingredients to make a new range of snacks. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional bulk stocks of soft drinks, as well as ingredients to make a new range of snacks.

loans.name: Julio Malaulane

texts.pt:
Júlio was born in Namaacha, on the border with Swaziland. He studied through ninth grade, when conditions did not permit him to continue. He is single and the father of seven children: the oldest are 16-year-old twins, the second is 12, the third 9, the fourth 7, the fifth 5, and the youngest only 1 year old. Júlio is responsible for even more, sending food and money to his parents monthly, as he lives with their first two children.

Júlio began working in 1986 as a driver at the Hotel Pequenos Libombo, holding that position for eight years. The salary was low and did not manage to cover the household expenses. He therefore decided to quit working for his employer and to start his own business of selling fish in the informal market. He was able to buy a car which has helped him greatly, even today. Júlio moved out of his parents' house when he was able to do so. Now he has his own business at his house and an employee who makes 1500 meticals (mt) per month working from 7:00am to 3:00pm. Júlio earns 8400mt per month, making 420mt per sack and using up 20 sacks per month. He is not able to save anything because there are many expenses.

This is Júlio's second loan with Hluvuku [MFI Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. The first was for 10,000mt and was used to buy construction material to finish his work. He succeeded in paying off the loan before it was due. Júlio then returned and requested this loan of 20,000mt which he will use to buy brick-building material. Júlio believes that this loan will improve his business because it will allow him to meet the needs of his clients. For Júlio, his big dream is to increase his business and to send his children through school.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Júlio nasceu em Namaacha uma que faz fronteira com a Swazilandia, solteiro, estudou até 9ªClasse, teve que parar de continuar com os estudos pois as condições não permitiam para que ele continuasse. É pai de 7 filhos sendo os primeiros gémeos e tem 16 anos, segundo tem 12 anos, o terceiro 9 anos, o quarto 7 anos, o quinto 5 anos e o mais novo tem 1 ano apenas. Júlio responsabiliza-se mais ainda pelos seus pais enviando comida e dinheiro mensalmente pois este vivem com os seus dois primeiros filhos.

Júlio começou a trabalhar em 1986 como motorista no Hotel Pequenos Libombo tendo exercido a função durante 8 anos. O salário era pouco não chegava para cobrir com as despesas da casa dai decide deixar de trabalhar no patrão abrindo o seu próprio negocio de venda de peixe no mercado informal e conseguiu comprou um carro que lhe vem ajudando muito até hoje. Julio saiu da casa dos pais quando se juntou e hoje tem seu próprio estaleiro em sua casa e tem um trabalhador que aufere mensalmente um valor de 1500,00mt trabalhando das 7:00h as 15:00h. Tem lucrado mensalmente 8400,00mt sabendo que num saco ganha 420,00mt e gasta 20 sacos por mes, não consegue poupar nenhum valor pois tem muitas despesas.

Este é o segundo empréstimo do Júlio na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro foi de 10000,00mt e usou para comprar material de construção para concluir a sua obra. Ele conseguiu pagar o empréstimo antes do prazo determinado. Assim o Júlio volta a solicitar este empréstimo de 20000,00mt que usara o dinheiro para comprar material para fabrico de Blocos de cimento. Júlio acha que com este empréstimo vai melhorar o seu negocio porque vai conseguir satisfazer as necessidades da sua clientela. Para Júlio constitui grande sonho ter mais estaleiros e formar os seus filhos.

loans.use: Sale of construction material and production of cement bricks

loans.name: Isabelino

texts.es:
Mr. Isabelino Fereira is married, lives in his own house, and has grown children who help him in his business by waiting on customers. His business is in a very good location, being in a highly commercial district, and his notions store is one of the best-known companies in downtown Asunción.

Isabelino tells how he started his business with barely 3,000,000 Guaraní (about $700). The business grew quickly over the years to the point where he could rely on an expanded clientele, a result of his store’s location in a very busy shopping area that attracts tourists.

Among the items that Isabelino sells one can find glasses, sunglasses, bifocals and electronic articles such as calculators, flashlights, watches, and cd’s.

One of Isabelino’s aspirations is to expand his company soon, and in the future to open a business importing and distributing electronic equipment. Today he would like credit to buy a greater variety of goods in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Isabelino F., es casado, viven en su propia casa, ya tiene hijos mayores de edad, quienes también le ayudan en su negocio en la atención de sus clientes. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, pues está en una zona altamente comercial y su mercería es uno de los comercios más conocidos del microcentro de Asunción.

Isabelino cuenta que inicio su comercio con apenas G. 3.000.000 ($ 700 aproximadamente), el cual fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que rápidamente pudo contar con una amplia clientela, razón principal por la ubicación del negocio ya que es un lugar bastante concurrido inclusive por turistas.

Entre las mercaderías que Isabelino vende podemos encontrar lentes de sol, lentes para la vista, bifocales y artículos de electrónica como calculadoras, cd´s, linternas, relojes, entre otros.

Uno de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio, y abrir en el futuro una empresa de importaciones y distribuidora de equipos de electrónica. Hoy el desea el crédito para comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades y de mayor variedad.

loans.use: Purchase of glasses, sunglasses, calculators, cd’s, flashlights and watches.

loans.name: Silvia Helena

texts.es:
Ms. R. is a single mother with four children that depend on her, one of which attends college and the other three are in high school. She owns a brick kiln located at her home which she inherited from her father. She makes washer blocks, pvc pipes, she sells sand and cement bricks, with her business she has been able to raise her children, three of whom are from her marriage and one adopted. One of her greatest dreams is to ensure that her four children complete a college career and also to open another branch when demand is stronger, that way she can continue acquiring better technology.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. es madre soltera con cuatro hijos a su cargo uno en la universidad y los otros tres en secundaria , ella es dueña de una bloquera ubicada en su casa la cual es herencia de su padre , ella elabora bloques lavanderos tubos de pvc ,vende ladrillos arena y cemento , con su negocio a logrado formar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son de su matrimonio y uno adoptado uno de sus grandes sueños es poder lograr que los cuatro coronen una carrera universitaria y tambien poder abrir una sucursal en un punto donde la demanda es mas fuerte, asi mismo poder ir adquiriendo mejor tecnologia.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama LAS VEGAS estamos ubicados en el Barrio el Centro, municipio de Alauca, nosotros nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
este es el detalle de nuestro grupo
Luis C.: tengo 6 años de realizar esta actividad, me dedico a al compra de cerdos para el destazo, este negocio es la fuente principal en la generacion de ingresos que tengo, gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mi familia, 
Miguel Fortin26 años de dedicarse ala Sastreria, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion y es su unico ingreso monetario para cumplir con todas las necesidades que tiene de su hogar.
Oswaldo C.: su actividad principal es la venta de leña y la agricultura tiene mas de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 
gracias al credito que estamos solicitando podremos seguir mejorando con nuestros negocios y de esta manera contribuir al engrandecimiento de nuestra comunidad.
texts.en:
Hello. Our group’s name is LAS VEGAS. We are located in the Centro neighborhood in Alauca municipality. We know each other well and we have always worked together. Here are the details about our group. Luis C.: I have been doing this business for 6 years. I buy pigs for meat processing, this business is the main source of income that I have. Thanks to this business I have been able to help my family get ahead. Miguel F. is 26 years old and is a tailor, a trade he practices in his home and it is his only source of income to meet the needs that he has in his home. Oswaldo C.: His main activity is selling wood and farming. He has be doing this for more than 7 years, is married, and has 3 children. Thanks to the loan we are seeking we will be able to improve our businesses and in this way contribute to the growth of our community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de una niña llamada Araceli de 4 añitos de edad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria, actividad que realiza desde hace ya 5 años, el cual es un trabajo sacrificado y debe ponerle mucho empeño.  Usualmente Edith trabaja durante todo el día, para poder ganar lo suficiente para la manutención de su hija, ya que a medida que crece tiene muchas más necesidades. Lo que le gusta de trabajar con la venta de ropa, es que es un negocio rentable, siendo la única desventaja el traslado de la mercadería.  Edith quiere que su pequeña hija Araceli viva de manera diferente a la que le tocara vivir a ella, con mejores oportunidades para forjarse un futuro mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará más mercadería y aumentar su venta para que en el futuro pueda tener una pequeña tienda de ropa en alguna galería importante de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Edith is 32-years old and is a single mother of a 4-year old baby girl named Araceli. She is dedicated to the sales of outpatient garments. She has been at this trade for the past 5-years and it requires a lot of sacrifice and much effort. Usually, Edith works all day to earn enough to take care of her baby because as she grows she has more needs.

She enjoys this job of selling clothes as it is a profitable business, though the only drawback seems to be in the shipment of these goods. Edith desires a different life for her baby Araceli, where she’ll have the best opportunities to forge a better future. With the funding from this loan request, she will purchase more merchandise and try to increase her sales. In the future, she would like to have a small clothing store to showcase her collection in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase a clothing nventory for sales.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Profesora Maria Auxiliadora, casada, es docente del Instituto Nacional de Chontales, tiene 5 hijos; su esposo trabaja en una empresa propia y apoya con los gastos del hogar.  Esta solicitando su 9no credito, el que utilizara para construccion de una tapia de 5 mts de largo con el objetivo de dar mayor seguridad a su familia y la vivienda, pues cuando sale a su trabajo tiene que dejar solos a sus hijos, y con la tapia siente que dara mayor seguridad a ellos.    La profesora R. ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus creditos anteriores y manifiesta que a paesar que en la localidad existen bancos y otras financieras, ella acude a AFODENIC porque siempre ha sido bien atendida y lo mejor es que los intereses y las polícas son más blandas.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora R. is married and is a teacher at the Instituto Nacional de Chontales. She has 5 children and her husband runs his own business and together they support their family. Maria is requesting her ninth loan, which will be used to build a 15-foot wall to enclose her home. She wants to make her home more secure, since her children stay home by themselves when she and her husband go out to work. Mrs. R.'s credit history shows that she is responsible and reliable. She tells us that while banks and other financial institutions exist in her neighborhood, she comes to AFODENIC because she has always been treated well, and the interest and terms are easier to manage.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a wall

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo, a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank, is 38 years old and married with two children. Consuelo studied agricultural science but has not yet gotten her degree. She has a consulting firm located in a rented office where she employs seven people and offers services for a wiD. variety of projects.

Consuelo is now requesting a loan to pay for the costs associated with getting her college degree. Consuelo dreams of finishing construction on her home and expanding her consulting firm.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To pay the costs of completing a college degree.

loans.name: Che Beltha

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Beltha is married to Che Thomas and they have one child; she lives in Ntambesi, within the town of Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in a motorbike. In the past she has taken out loans to sell vegetables, and do crops and pig farming. The motorbike will be used as a taxi in the area. She has already found a driver (her son) for her bike who will pay her at the end of each day.

This is Beltha’s fifth loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 2003. Bikes are one of the most efficient forms of transport in and around Bamenda. As many of the roads are in shambles, bikes are often able to move through these areas quicker and without suffering as much damage as cars. Beltha will continue her profitable firewood business for extra income.

Recently Beltha was very upset when her husband sold their only piece of land. And he also married another lady and stopped paying school fees for their son. Beltha is ready to build her life back with loans from GHAPE and collaboration from her son.

With the profit from this loan, Beltha plans to repair her family house. She also plans to take care of her family, pay school fees, ensure that they eat well, and buy their medication. She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the lengthy repayment period.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike, fuel, and paying for documents

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce L. is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children. She resides in Haatso with her family. She is a food vendor and sells fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, cooked and pounded together, and eaten with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of the Ghanaian society. It is enjoyed either as breakfast, lunch, or supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to open a restaurant and help her children in school.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: Mrs. Samai Y. is a villager in Doem Roes village in Kandal province. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Sokchea, is a hard working construction worker. He has a problem because he does not have enough construction supplies to support his work. Mrs. Samai Y. decided to request a loan to buy construction supplies for her husband’s work. She is 51 years old and a mother of four children; two of her children are employed in a garment factory and two attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband’s work.

loans.name: Deona Ann

texts.en:
“To become successful in life” is a simple ambition that every individual hopes to achieve, just like Deona-Ann M. of Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is a hard-working mother who has this great ambition for her family, but how? Deona Anne asked herself. She is challenged by the prevailing economic crisis but never loses hopes in seeking good business opportunities for she believes that, if “there’s a will there’s a way”. This quotation encourages her to work hard and to find some possible solution for the attainment of her goal.

Her business is selling vegetables in her cogon-made (a kind of grass used for thatching) vending stall in front of their house. Her husband Leonardo M. is a simple farmer; both are working hard for the success of their family and sending their children to school. She plans to improve her business and to increase their agricultural products in order to gain more income for the sake of their children.

There are lots of micro-finance organizations where she lives, but she chose to join ASKI where she could seek financial support for her vending due to its programs and benefits and because it is a Christian development organization. She is now asking the lenders for financial support of PHP 10,000 that she can use as business capital for her farming business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba G. is a 40 year old trader. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in Eguase, in the central region of Ghana. She sells used clothes and footwear through hawking. She purchases her stock of goods from importers in Accra Ghana. Aba has ten years of sales experience in the field of marketing.

Through this business, she manages to support her children's education from the business proceeds. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to increase her business. Aba has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan will enable her to make remarkable business progress.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and shoes of a greater variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide all her kids with a quality education to make them more resourceful in the future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers. Aba belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem O. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He sells motor spare parts for a living. Kazeem is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more motor spare parts. He says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ni Made Purnasih

texts.en: Ni Made Purnasih (DNR.M-0659) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 400,000 - 500,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Made Purnasih joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Made Purnasih is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her second loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Made Purnasih - (DNR.M-0659) merupakan 38 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Made Purnasih memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made Purnasih sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made Purnasih menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 - 500,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Made Purnasih bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made Purnasih meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Made Purnasih berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Timoteo tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas agrícolas, cultivando la tierra para luego vender sus cosechas; el producto que cultiva es la papa nativa de su región; siembra en grandes extensiones de terreno que luego de 6 meses de trabajo dan sus frutos con las ventas que realiza en el mercado de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad. En esta agotadora labor, Timoteo no está solo, ya que tiene el apoyo incondicional de su esposa y sus 2 hijos menores, y esto lo anima para seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, mejorando cada año en su producción y en la variedad de papa que ha de sembrar. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y considera que su experiencia en su banco comunal será muy enriquecedora para su vida, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad y responsabilidad. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono, funguicidas y una mochila fumigadora, lo cual utilizará para la mejora y cuidado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Timoteo is 45 years and old lives with his wife and their two children in their own house. Since childhood he has worked in agriculture, cultivating the land and then selling his crops. The product he grows is the potato native to his region. He plants large tracts of land and then after six months of work sells the fruit of his labor in the market of the city nearest his community. In this exhausting work Timoteo is not alone since he has the unconditional help of his wife and their two young children, which inspires him to continue working in farming, each year increasing his production and the variety of potatoes he plants. This is his first loan with MFP. He thinks that his experience with his community bank will enrich his life and commits to make his repayments punctually and responsibly. The money he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer, fungicides, and a knapsack sprayer which will be used for the care and improvement of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and a knapsack sprayer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals for his farming land

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business making & selling ice and ice candies. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice and ice candies in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month for these activities.

Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

location.town: Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie Y. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Lorelie is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lorelie owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic loading in the local community. Lorelie is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Lorelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorelie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of relatives and family members.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gayceli

texts.es: Gayceli tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y su bebe de 7 meses en su casa propia. Desde los 19 años implementó, en un espacio de su casa, una tienda donde vende diversos productos comestibles y otros artículos para el uso en el hogar. De esta manera trabaja atendiendo esmeradamente a su clientela, la que cada día le asegura los ingresos económicos que necesita para mejorar su calidad de vida. Gayceli se abastece de mercadería cada semana, pues así logra satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Debido a las ganancias obtenidas durante todos estos años, Gayceli se proyecta al futuro con una tienda más grande y con mayor variedad y cantidad de productos que ofrecer.
