Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy animada de continuar el trabajo en equipo con su banco comunal, así como de seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería en productos comestibles de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Gayceli is 30 years old, and lives with her husband and seven-month-old baby in her own home. Since she was 19 years old, she has run, in a space in her house, a store where she sells various foods and household items. She works carefully with her customers, so she has a secure income she can use to improve her quality of life. Gayceli stocks up on merchandise every week, so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

Due to the income she has earned in these years, Gayceli sees herself in the future with a larger store and with a greater variety and quantity of products to sell. This is the fifth time she has taken out a loan with MFP; she is excited to continue working with the team at her communal bank, and will continue making punctual payments. The money that she requests will be used to buy merchandise and basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in merchandise

loans.name: Khaldé Fothy Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupes de femmes adultes qui faisons du commerce de denrées de premières nécessites comme du riz, de l'huile de cuisine , du sucre  et tout autre type de produits de grandes consommation.Nous avons deux boutiques qui se trouvent au marché de notre écovillage que nous voulons ravitailler en marchandise pour le mois de septembre, car à cette période de l'année, les difficultés de ravitaillement sont très nombreuses à cause de la saison des pluies qui s'installe et les routes sont difficilement praticable. Les populations des villages  environnants éprouvent des difficultés pour s'approvisionner en denrées alimentaires, à cause de leur enclavement. Donc grâce au prêt, nous pourront stocker beaucoup de produits pour faciliter l'accès aux populations voisines. Cela nous permettra aussi de créer des emplois fixes aux jeune de notre écovillage qui vont gérer ces boutiques.
texts.en:
We are a group of adult women doing commerce in staple goods, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, and any other kinds of widely-consumed goods.  We have two stores located at the marketplace of our eco-village that we want to resupply with merchandise for September because supply problems at this time of year are quite numerous due to the rainy season settling in.  And the roads are difficult to navigate.  The people of the surrounding villages exhibit difficulties in supplying themselves with food items due their isolation.  So, thanks to this loan, we'll be able to stock a lot of goods for facilitating access for neighboring populations.  This will also enable us to create steady jobs for our eco-village's young people, who are going to run these stores.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential goods and domestic items

loans.name: Airwing Group

texts.en:
Mtezi L., age 23, is single with one daughter of 2 years. He sells second-hand clothes. He started this business 3 years ago and works daily from 8am until 5pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 138.

This will be Mtezi’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to increase his working capital.

Mtezi will share this loan with his loan group, Airwing, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mtezi is standing 1st on the right in the back row.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa L. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Teresa is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 36 year single mother of four children aged between 14 and 20 years. All her children go to school .She resides and rents a one roomed house where she stays with five people  Harriet takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Harriet works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She sells in Kampala at Arua park stage in Kampala, city one the various bus stages in Uganda. Harriet buys sugar ant milk from nearby shops.  She pays transport costs to and from home. She is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of merchandise and city council authorities who no longer want them to operate in the city center   . Her monthly expenses include rent  feeding the the family and medication  .Harriet   sells to all categories of people both on retail and works seven days a week  She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more milk  and sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a whole sale shop.

loans.use: To buy more  milk and sugar  charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, dos de los cuales estudian, en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace un año. Cuando llegan al peso adecuado ella los ofrece en venta en el mercado de su distrito. Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer de carga y lo que percibe no es suficiente para afrontar los gastos del hogar. Por este motivo ella da todo de sí para sacar adelante su negocio y apoyar a la economía de su hogar.

María quiere brindar a sus animales una alimentación de calidad, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para cerdos.

Su más grande anhelo es tener un espacio habilitado para la buena crianza de sus cerdos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 34 year old mother who lives with her husband and 4 children, two of whom are in school. They live in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked raising pigs for a year. When they weigh enough she offers them for sale at the market in her district. Her husband is a deliveryman and realizes that this is not enough to meet the household expenses. For this reason she gives all of herself to push her business forward and to support the household finances. Maria wants to provide to her animals good quality food, and for this reason she is asking for the first time for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to invest in buying nutritious feed for the pigs. Her greatest dream is to have a space properly fitted-out for raising the pigs. She is a hard-working mother, and is responsible and very dedicated to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed for pigs

loans.name: Luzgarda

texts.es:
La socia LUZGARDA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijas mujeres, ellas viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de venta de comidas, nuestra socia prepara de comida desayuno, almuerzo y cena y su restaurante se encuentra ubicado en la  Plaza de Armas del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer joven, luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica al negocio y quiere aumentar su capital de negocio comprando víveres y verduras para preparar más platos de comida.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
LUZGARDA, 24, is a member of the "HATUN SONCCO" communal bank. The name of the bank is from the Quechua language. "HATUN means "Big, and "SONCCO" means "Heart" so, translated into Spanish, it means "Big Heart." She lives with her life partner in the imperial city of Cusco and they have two daughters. She alternates her domestic chores with a small, prepared meals sales business. She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner in an eatery located in Cusco's Plaza de Armas (Main Square). She has had this line of work for several years now and she does very well thanks to all the effort she puts into it. She is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who, with much dedication, sees to her business. She wants to increase her working capital buying more groceries and vegetables to increase the number of her meal preparations. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Byabasiita Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Willy N. is a good person. He is 40 years old and married with 5 children in primary and secondary schools.  Willy has a retail shop and a bar in the Byabasiita trading centre and has managed both businesses for 9 years. He is able to make profit which enables him take care of his family, his children’s education and general duties. He says that good customer care has helped him succeed. In the future, he would like to become richer and provide his family with a better living condition. Willy needs a loan to be able to boost his business, as the profits he makes help him to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop and bar with more products to sell.

loans.name: Lira's Group

texts.en:
Lira, the leader of this group, comes from the city of Karabalta. She is thirty-eight years old and, together with her husband, she is raising four children. Her eldest son, 19, is serving in the army; a daughter, 13, and another son, 6, are going to school; the smallest daughter is just two years old. Nowadays, it is extremely difficult for people of Lira’s age to find a proper job. Moreover, even young people are forced to leave the city in search of better opportunities. In such conditions people choose to engage themselves in either trade or animal husbandry. Lira and her husband have chosen to raise livestock and poultry. Due to their savings they were able to buy some land and started farming. Later on, they bought cows. Now, Lira’s husband has taken over most of the duties regarding the cattle and the land while Lira has had to stay at home and take care of her daughter. However, she has found an excellent way to help her husband in supporting the family. While staying at home, Lira has started manufacturing traditional articles and handing them in to the shops to sell. Surprisingly, her articles attracted many customers and Lira started to earn decent money. Now, her monthly income is around $155. Lira wants to start raising turkeys. She hopes to obtain this loan and purchase turkeys to raise. These are Lira’s partners: Domira, 48, is the mother of two children. Domira sells milk products and her husband raises livestock. Domira needs a loan to purchase coal. Istatoj, 53, is a widow and has raised four children. To make a living she is engaged in animal husbandry and selling milk. She has applied for this loan to purchase coal. Gulnara, 46, has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Gulnara helps her husband in working the land. Besides that, she keeps some cattle and sells milk. Gulnara needs this loan to purchase coal. Klara, 52, has one son. With her husband she trades in milk and turkeys. Her husband mainly looks after the turkeys. Klara hopes to obtain this loan and buy coal for the winter. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase turkeys to raise

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 46-year-old woman. She is married with five kids who are all in school. Hannah is a resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able to work hard to provide her kids with a quality education for better careers in the future. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to save more to finance her kids’ school fees. Hannah has been in business for 15 years now.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en: Enhbaatar A. is 33 years old and lives with his wife, Lhamsuren, and three-month-old baby boy, Nyambayar. Two years ago, Enhbaatar started a new business with his friend building his own ger and furniture. He was married that same year. The profit from their little business is the only income his little family has. It takes him anywhere from one to three months to finish the wood for a ger, and it sells for 1.5 to 2.5 million tugrugs (about $1,200 to $1,500). Usually the gers are then sent to UB to be sold. The wood is extremely expensive, so Enhbaatar would like a loan to help him buy the wood that he needs. He wants his business to do well so he can acquire his own building out of which he will work. In the meantime, he also drives a taxi to make ends meet. His wife doesn’t work, so she can stay home and take care of their new baby. Enhbaatar is an industrious, hardworking young man. He is very accommodating and a very pleasant person to be around.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living without a man. A 31-year-old mother of two kids, she lives in the town of Angono, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

Joy’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her children; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2001. The previous loans she received from Kiva were carefully invested in her restaurant. Since then, the restaurant has been performing well and earning sufficient profit. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her business as she continues to expand. Joy needs a loan to help boost her business for increased profit.

Now requesting her sixth loan, she is requesting 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her restaurant, to be used to pay for cases of beer, liquor, pork, chicken, groceries for her enterprise and an additional videoke karaoke machine.

Joy is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her children and being able to send them to school until they finish college. She also hopes to expand her business and if possible she can have a branch in the town of Taytay, Rizal, in order to provide employment to others. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

She is happy that her living condition is better than in the past because she can generate more income from the business. Joy would like to send all the best wishes to all her lenders around the world. She hopes that they will support her again in the future.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country

loans.use: Additional working capital for her restaurant.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: A la vivienda del señor Esteban
texts.en:
Esteban’s home is missing the inside fixtures. He has two small children, so the walls are stained and marked and he needs to paint them and make some other repairs. At the moment he does not have the money he needs to make the improvements, so he is requesting this loan. He plans to repay with part of the money he ears at his job.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Fidel Salvador

texts.es:
El Señor Fidel Salvador Blandón Pinel, reside en una comunidad que se llama guayucali a unos 35 km de Condega, la actividad de trabajo de este cliente es la agricultura sembrando granos tales como frijol y maíz y cultivo de la papa, también  la ganadería mantiene su hato ganadero y también a la compra y venta de ganado. El crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar 4 toretes para desarrollo y después venderlos, ya que él quiere comprar estas 4 reses para  tener otros ingresos una vez venda estos animales. Este cliente comenzó esta actividad de trabajo cuando don Fidel Salvador después que terminaba la época de cosecha de granos comenzó a vender ganado para tener otra alternativa de trabajo y esto lo hizo primero vendiendo toretes que el sacaba de las vacas que él tiene, quedándose solamente  con el ganado hembra, al ver que esto le estaba dando resultado y mas ganancia fue ahí donde inicio a trabajar con apoyo financiero por parte nuestra para comprar más animales y tener mayores ganancias.
La actividad de trabajo de este cliente es netamente agropecuaria el siembra en épocas de cosecha en invierno granos básicos como frijol y maíz para comercializarlos, también siembra hortaliza cultivo de la papa con sistema de riego esto lo hace en verano, y también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad ganadera este cliente solamente se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos únicamente en épocas de invierno esto lo viene practicando  desde la infancia ya que se ha acostumbrado y criado en este  tipo de trabajo de campo. Ahora con esta otra actividad como es la compra y venta de ganado él espera seguir mejorando su operatividad de trabajo, aumentar la cantidad de novillos para la venta y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos y tener  trabajo en todo el año, don Fidel tiene una esposa que le ayuda a los trabajos y quehacer del hogar como el cuidar de sus hijos y preparar los alimentos, también tiene 4 hijos que estudian y le ayudan a las labores  o trabajos de campo.
Este cliente tiene 9 años de trabajar con Ceprodel a recibido 12 créditos para esta misma actividades de trabajo de campo.
Don Fidel ha venido mejorando su actividad de trabajo y su nivel de vida esto se debe al impacto y beneficio que le han dado los financiamientos otorgados por Ceprodel, permitiéndole mejores condiciones básicas en su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Fidel Salvador Blandón Pinel lives in a community called Guayucali, some 35 km from Condega. He works in agriculture, growing crops such as beans, corn and potatoes. He also keeps livestock, taking care of his herd and buying and selling animals. He will use the loan to buy 4 steers to raise and sell. He will then put the income from these 4 animals to further use. Fidel Salvador began selling livestock after the harvest season for his crops ended, in order to have an additional type of work. At first, he sold calves that were born to his cows, keeping only one female. When he saw that this was going well and producing profits, he began to work with financial support from us to buy more animals and increase his income. Fidel Salvador dedicates himself full-time to agriculture. After the winter harvest, he plants staple crops such as beans and corn to sell. He also raises vegetables such as potatoes, using an irrigation system. He does this work in summer, and he also works buying and selling livestock. Before he started raising livestock, he worked exclusively raising staple crops in the winter season. He has done this work since his childhood, since he grew up in the countryside and was accustomed to this work. Now, with this additional livestock business, he hopes to continue improving the effectiveness of his work, increasing the number of cattle he sells and thus obtaining more income and having work throughout the year. Fidel has a wife who helps him in his work as well as with the household chores, such as preparing food and taking care of their children. He has 4 children who are in school and who also help him on the farm. Fidel has been a client of Ceprodel for 9 years and has received 12 loans to support his agricultural work. Fidel has constantly improved his farming and ranching business and his standard of living, thanks to the impact and benefits of the loans granted by Ceprodel, which have allowed him to raise the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 4 steers to raise

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es: Arlen es una joven de mucha iniciativa, lleva varios años  administrando su  negocio la venta de ropa de segunda  mano y cosméticos el cual inicio con el apoyo de su esposo proveniente de su trabajo como albañil, solo tiene un hijo el cual esta pequeño, su mayor objetivo es poder mejorar su pequeño cuarto ya que tiene poco espacio el cual espera poder hacer un aumento para tener mejor comodidad. Tiene en inventario ropa la cual espera vender pronto y poder ver las ganancias, con los financiamientos ah logrado aumentar las ventas ya que tiene muchos encargos de la Avon ya que trabaja mediante catálogos. Con este préstamo comprara ropa nueva, ropa interior para dama y caballero, así como una variedad de crema para el sol en este verano lo cual se vende por ser de buena calidad y accesible de precio. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener un modulo en donde pueda exhibir su ropa a los clientes y así lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Arlen is a young lady with initiative - she has been running her business selling secondhand clothes and cosmetics for several years. She started out with the help of her husband who is a bricklayer. She has only one young son. Her main objective is to be able to do up their small room as they have such little space. She hopes to make it a bit bigger so that it is more comfortable. She has a stock of clothes that she hopes will sell quickly and will give her an income. With the money she wants to increase her sales as she has many orders from Avon as she works through the catalogues. With this loan she will buy new clothes, underwear for men and women as well as a variety of good quality suncreams for this summer which she will sell at an affordable price. In the future she would like to have a stall from which she can display her clothing to her clients and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear for men, women and children, as well as creams, colours and perfumes

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon S. has been a local farmer for many years, planting different kinds of crops to earn a living. She grows rice, vegetables, and some fruit crops, which she can plant three or four times a year with two seasons, the rainy season and the dry season. Her husband assists her in the business. Yuon S. has been blessed with seven children; one of whom is married and others are single. Most of the children are employed at different jobs. 

In the past, Yuon S. hired a neighbor’s animal to help plow her farmland, because she doesn’t own an animal herself. She has also been planning to buy one but she has no money yet. Therefore, Yuon S. is applying for a loan in order to buy a couple of cows to facilitate plowing of the farmland.

loans.use: To buy cows for plowing farmland

loans.name: Pius Kiproech

texts.en:
Pius Kiproech R. is a 37 year old man married to Nancy Koech. They  have 5 children: Titus (15 years old, in primary school), Kiplagat (13 years old , in primary school), Kimutai (12 years old, in primary school) Sharon (9 years old, in primary school) and Jepkemei (4 years old, in primary).

Pius practices horticultural farming. He started this venture four years ago. From this business he gets a profit of KES 15,000.
He has borrowed a loan of KES 75,000 from KADET. Pius will use the loan for fencing, clearing the land, acquiring skilled labor, purchasing seeds, and purchasing fungicides and insecticides.

Pius practices horticultural farming in a semi arid area. If this loan boosts his business, he will use the extra profit to extend his horticultural practices. Pius's hopes and dreams are to own a transport vehicle. He describes himself as a hardworking Christian farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and for fencing.

loans.name: Ana Sonia

texts.es:
Ana Sonia A. López, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, es madre soltera y vive con su nieta la cual está estudiando, ella  posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, esta tienda es    es el apoyo económico para su familia.
Sonia inicio su tienda  con mucho esfuerzo  hace 10 años, que en la actualmente está ubicado en su casa, comercializa sus productos con sus vecinos como son  (azúcar, café, papel higiénico, sopas instantáneas, detergentes y otros), ella solicita el préstamo para fortalecer su negocio y comprar  diversidad de productos.
 Con el dinero que ella necesita comprara: leche, arroz frijoles, aceite, detergentes, entre otros, ya que sus clientes le buscan y no cuenta con ellos. Su sueño es tener una tienda con productos suficientes, para obtener más ventas y así ayudarle económicamente a mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ayudar a su nieta con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ana Sonia A. López is 56 years old. She lives in the municipality of Jucuapa in the department of Usulután. She is a single mother and lives with her granddaughter, who is in school. She has a store where she sells basic products. This store is her family’s source of income. Sonia started her store 10 years ago, through a lot of hard work. It is currently located in her house. She sells products to neighbors, such as sugar, coffee, toilet paper, instant soups, detergents, and other things. She is requesting the loan to strengthen her business by buying a variety of products. With the loan, she needs to buy: milk, rice, beans, cooking oil, and detergents, among other things, because her customers ask for these things and she doesn’t have them. Her dream is to have a store with enough products so that she can increase her sales and thereby help to improve the quality of life in her home and help her granddaughter with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, rice, beans, cooking oil, and detergent

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El Señor René V. tiene 62 años y esta casado con la Señora Valentina Villarroel por más de 40 años, tiene un hijo que estudia en nivel secundaria, el esposo es agricultor produce papa, papalisa en su terreno que tiene 2.5 hectáreas en la comunidad de Liriuni, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, cuidando de el ganado vacuno y de la casa. 
Don  René V. y su familia viven en una comunidad Liriuni a 1 km de colomi  muy alejado de la ciudad  de Cochabamba por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, y se descubrio que Don René V. necesitaba capital para ampliar y aumentar la producción de papa, papalisa, ya que él tiene terrenos que no están siendo cultivados. 
Don René  nos comenta que quiere ampliar la producción de papa, papalisa así tener ingresos suficiente para ahorrar dinero para que su hijo termine de estudiar en la universidad y ser profesional, el sueña ver a sus hijo profesional ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Mr. René V. is 62 years old and has been married to Mrs. Valentina Villarroel for over 40 years. They have one son who is in secondary school. Mr. René V. is a farmer who grows potatoes and other root vegetables on his 2.5 hectares of land in the Liriuni community. His wife helps with the farm chores, raising cattle and taking care of the home. Mr. René V. and his family live in the community of Liriuni which is 1 km from Colomi. The community is far from the city of Cochabamba which makes it very difficult to go to the bank for a loan. EL CIDRE had the initiative to go to this rural area. The group discovered that Mr. René V. needed capital in order to increase and expand the production of root vegetables. He currently has land that is not being cultivated. Mr. René V. told us that he would like to expand the production of root vegetables in order to have sufficient income to save money for his son’s university education. His dream is for his son to have a professional career as he himself did not have such an opportunity due to a lack of economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Group 3

texts.en:
Presentation G. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Presentation is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Presentation is married and has one adult children. To make a living, Presentation owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like "biko" (a variety of rice cake), "suman" (another variety of rice cake with coconut milk, wrapped in a banana leaf), and more in the local community. Presentation has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Presentation joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Presentation has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Presentation is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Presentation from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Airforce Group

texts.en:
Amina Said, age 24, is married and has one seven-year-old daughter. She has sold eggs door to door for 6 months. She works from 9 am to 12 noon daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $189. This will be Amina’s first motisha (motisha is to motivate good payers) loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of eggs.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Air Force, which consists of 9 men and women from her community. The members of the group hold each other accountable to pay back the loan. 

In the picture,  Amina is on the right in an orange dress.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul T. is the leader of the group. She is 33, married, and has a six year old daughter. To make money, Jazgul and her husband sell fruits and vegetables in the market. They have been doing it for ten years, and earn 15,600 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase some land in the village. With this loan, Jazgul wants to purchase fruits and vegetables (potatoes, cucumbers, strawberries) in order to resell them at a higher price in the market. In the future she wants to expand her business and save some money to purchase a flat.

Sagyndyk A., 70, is married. He has two daughters, and both of them work in a sewing workshop. Eight years ago, with the initial investment of 8,000 soms, Sagyndyk purchased ten goats. He resold all of them for 17,000 soms. And now, he hopes to obtain a loan to purchase cattle for breeding.

Nazira K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 43 and married. She has a daughter, who is 23 and works as a waitress. Nazira works as a nurse, and she also resells silver to make some money. She started this activity a year ago with the initial investment of 8,700 soms and now she makes 6,000 soms per month. Nazira applied for the loan, because she needs more money to purchase silver in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and purchase a big house.

Anarkan S. is 39 and married. She has two sons, and both of them are at school. In order to make money, Nazira works in a sewing workshop. With this loan, she wants to repair her house.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Brenda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Brenda tiene 22 años de edad ella una joven muy emprendedora y ha salido adelante con todas las dificultades por las que ha atravesado. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, por lo que tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse a este medio de vida, el cual le ha enseñado a mantener a sus clientes, pues ella asiste a las diferentes empresas públicas y privadas en donde pueda ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar pantalones, vestidos, camisetas y faldas. Ella valora y agradece tener este negocio que le permite mejorar su calidad de vida, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Brenda, 22, is a very enterprising young woman who has managed to get ahead despite all the difficulties she has encountered. She sells clothing and cosmetics and has been in this line of work for over 3 years. She has learned how to keep her customers because she visits them in their various private and public institutions where they work to offer a wide variety of products. She is asking for funding to buy pants, dresses, t-shirts and skirts. She values and is grateful for this business that makes it possible for her to improve her quality of life. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing items.

loans.name: Zoila Emperatriz

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 36 años de edad reside en el Municipio de Lolotique, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de las edades de 10,7,2 años los cuales dependen económicamente del ingreso que genera el negocio que es una tienda de venta de productos básicos.
El negocio fue iniciado por la madre de Zoila hace quince años, lo atiende a lunes a domingo ;actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como son, aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar y otros productos que le demandan sus clientes. Este préstamo le ayudara para incrementar los productos y le permitirá tener variedad para aumentar las ventas y asi genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos familiares.

Sus objetivos son apoyar a sus pequeños hijos en sus estudios y que culminen una carrera universitaria a futuro abrir otra tienda.
texts.en:
Zoila is 36 years old and resides in the town of Lolotique in the Department of San Miguel. She is a single mother with three children (ages 10, 7, and 2) who are financially dependent on the income she generates from her business. Zoila has a store where she sells basic products.

Her mother started this business fifteen years ago. Zoila now manages the store Monday through Sunday. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy products for her store such as oil, beans, rice, sugar, and other items that her customers demand. This loan will help expand her inventory and allow her to have more variety so that she can increase her sales and generate the necessary income to cover the family expenses.

Her goals are to support her young children with their studies so that they can earn a university degree and to open another store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, beans, rice, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-oeun C. is 54 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Vanny Yous, is 51 years old. They have been married for 28 years and have four children, three of whom are married and live outside the family home and one who is a tailor. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sam-oeun’s wife is a tailor. He assists his wife in the business. He is asking for his first loan of $200 to purchase a sewing machine for his wife’s tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his wife’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more items, like sugar

loans.name: Mwachiru

texts.en:
Mwachiru is a married man with eight children, five of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

He operates a "posho" mill (maize grinding machine) business, neighbours and passersby being his potential customers. Mwachiru faces a challenge of seasonality. He hopes to purchase another posho mill (maize grinding machine) and start a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase four cows  at Kshs 10,000 each and start a livestock business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase four cows at Kshs 10,000 each to start a livestock business

loans.name: Pabla Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Pabla es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta, nos dice que le gusta todo, los créditos, los intereses bajos etc. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene tres hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad y que ya tienen compromiso.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y además tiene un pequeño salón de billar donde ella vende ciertas bebidas con grado de alcohol. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 en ambos negocios, nos cuenta que su tienda la tiene ya hace 18 años y que empezó por la necesidad ya que tenia que sacar a sus hijos adelante a pesar de estar sola.  Los productos de su tienda las compra en Portoviejo y también recibe en su local ciertos productos.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar mas productos para surtir su tienda. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mujeres Organizadas” (Organized Women) communal bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte hamlet.  This area is known all over the country for the delicious sweets made by its inhabitants.

Pabla is the founding member of the communal bank.  She is very happy with it and tells us that she likes everything about it; the loans, the low interest, etc.  She’s 58 years old and single now, but has three adult children, who are now on their own, from a previous relationship.

She has a store where she sells primary needs products, and also has a small pool hall where she sells certain alcoholic beverages.  She works both businesses every day from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM, and tells us that she started 18 years ago because she needed to get ahead with her children, since she was raising them alone.  She buys her store inventory in Portoviejo, but also gets in certain local products.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more products to stock the store.  Her dreams are to continue working and to stay healthy.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
RUFINO P. L.



 DON RUFINO P.    TIENE 3 HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD VIVE CON SU ESPOSA EN UNA COMUNIDAD MUY  TRANQUILA  EN  SU CASA PROPIA  LLEVA 27 AÑOS DE SER COMERCIANTE,  INICIO SU NEGOCIO VENDIENDO ROPA USADA DE CASA EN CASA Y LUEGO VENDIO PANTALONES Y TRAJES DE NIÑO.
DON RUFINO SUEÑA CON PODER TENER DOS LOCALES DE ROPA NUEVA YA QUE ACTUALMENTE  VENDE  EN LA BANQUETA  DE EL MERCADO ROOSEVELT.

DON RUFINO SOLICITA UN NUEVO CREDITO A FAPE PARA PODER INVERTIR EN  PANTALONES DE DAMA Y TRAJES PARA NIÑOS YA QUE DURANTE ESTA  TEMPORADA TIENE MAYORES VENTAS  Y ALQUILA POR DOS MESES,  DOS METROS CUADRADOS DE BANQUETA EN LA MUNICIPALIDAD DE GUATEMALA ,  PARA PODER COMERCIAR PRODUCTOS NAVIDEÑOS Y ROPA.
ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON FAPE POR QUE LE HAN AYUDADO INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERIA POR MEDIO DE LOS CREDITOS
texts.en:
Don Rufino has 3 adult children and lives with his wife in their own house, in a very quiet community. He has been a business man for 27 years. He began his business selling used clothing from his house and later sold pants and children’s clothing.

Don Rufino dreams of being able to have two stores for selling new clothes, since he currently sells clothes in the Roosevelt Market.

Don Rufino requests a new loan from FAPE to invest in women’s pants and children’s clothing, because during this season he makes more sales and is renting two square meters of space for two months in Guatemala City, to be able to sell Christmas products and clothing.

He is very grateful for FAPE, because it has helped him build his business through their loans.

loans.use: Wholesale clothing purchase

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alejandro; el tiene 39 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio
alterna sus actividades diarias con el servicio de taxi el trabaja todos los días siendo
su horario desde las 06am hasta las 07:00pm y otras veces más tarde, esta es la única
actividad que realiza por el momento y es de esta manera saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la terminar de construir su casa.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandro belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Alejandro is 39 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his taxi service.  He works every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Sometimes he works later.  This is the only business activity that he has at the moment and it is how he gets his family ahead.

Alejandro is requesting this loan so that he can finish building his house.  He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. prepares kenkey for sale at Abura. Esi has received a senior high education. She is single, but takes care of 10 dependents. She is responsible for the welfare of her home. Esi is asking to use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

In this photo, Esi is in the process of making the kenkey.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia P. is from the city of Cogon Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old. Alicia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The primary source of income for the business is selling flowers in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC; she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a public inspector for the district's government agency. Byambasuren operates a taxi service in the city using his own car. He started his own business in 2007 by transporting a variety of loads in the Huchit shonhor market, one of the largest markets in the city. Today, he drives a taxi after selling his big truck and purchasing a small car. In addition, he operates a welding service to supplement his earnings. For the future, he plans to build a big house with fence for his family. He is requesting a 800,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase necessary spare parts for his car that is used as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora Maria Luisa se dedica a la venta D. diferentes productos como ser perfumes, productos D. limpieza para el hogar y es costurera. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá lubricantes para movilidades, pues es un producto que tiene buena acogida entre sus clientes. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro D. la ciudad D. La Paz.  Ella tiene cuatro hijos y es mujer sola, y por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar la mercancía que  necesita para tener más inventario para vender y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
María Luisa sells a variety of products like perfumers and home cleaning products; she’s also a seamstress.  She plans to use the loan to buy vehicle lubricants which are products that are quite popular with her customers.  

She lives in a rented house located in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  She has four children and is a woman alone.  

This is why she’s requesting a loan to buy merchandise she needs in order to have more inventory to sell and have more income.

loans.use: To buy vehicle lubricants to sell as part of her business selling various products.

loans.name: Hayrullo

texts.ru: Пайзиев Хайрулло житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 61 год. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, работает в средней школе, учительницей. Сам Хайрулло имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 30 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en: Hayrullo P. lives in the the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 61 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife works in the secondary school as a teacher. Hayrullo has secondary education. He make a living by breeding large cattle and has been in this business for 30 years. He is taking out this loan to increase the head count of his cattle. He wants to expand his business and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Gerardo Rubén

texts.es:
El Sr. Gerardo Rubén tiene 24 años, su pareja es la Srta. Sandra Beatriz Samudio de 20 años, viven en casa propia en el barrio San Blás de Caacupé, distante 52 km de la capital del País.
El sr. Gerardo Rubén se dedica a la compra-venta de queso paraguay, insumo principal para la producción de la chipa, cada día sale al interior del país a buscar donde conseguir buenos precios, lo que hace que obtenga un buen margen de utilidad.
Con el crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva obtendrá mayor movimiento de su negocio y cubrir la demanda de su clientela, con ello mejorará sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén is 24 years old; his partner is Miss Sandra Beatriz Samudio, 20 years old.  They live in their own home, in the San Blás section of Caacupé, 52 km. from the capital.
Rubén buys and sells Paraguayan cheese, the principal ingredient used to produce chipa.  Every day he travels to the rural areas to find places that offer good prices, which enables him to enjoy a good profit margin.
With the loan from the Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva, he will increase business activity and satisfy his customers’ needs, and thereby improve his income and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy chese for resale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 38 years old and married, with four children.  He operates Joma Motors where he mainly does vehicle repairs and maintenance.  He started the business thirteen years ago.  He was previously employed in a garage and went into business after getting enough experience.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and raised his living standards.  With 30, 000 kes, he will buy gauges and pipes.

loans.use: to buy gauges and pipes

loans.name: Nancy Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy es cliente antigua, anteriormente se le atendió como cliente kiva, ella con su esposo lograron comprarse un terreno donde construyeron su casita, la señora vende fruta de temporada por mayor en la zona de el tejar y su esposo trabaja en el transporte como taxi publico por la zona central, ellos tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, y otros dos hijos mayores quienes formaron su propio hogar, la Sra. Nancy es una cliente responsable quien trabaja con nosotros desde hace diez años, los créditos que saca son para aumento de capital, ya que las frutas de temporada algunas son muy caras, por otra parte también destinan una parte para el mantenimiento de su transporte, que es la otra fuente de sus ingresos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. en la foto la Sra. Nancy se encuentra en compañia de su esposo.
texts.en: Nancy is a previous Kiva client and she and her husband managed to buy a piece of land where they built their little house.  Nancy sells seasonal fruits in quantity within the El Tejar zone, and her husband drives a taxi in the central zone.  They have two school-aged children and two other older children on their own.  Nancy is a responsible client who has worked with us for ten years.  She will use some of the money from this loan to increase her working capital and buy seasonal fruit, some of which is expensive.  She will use another part of the money to maintain her transportation, which is her other source of income.  She is grateful to the institution for the backing.  She appears with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy frut for resale and perform maintenance on her transportation

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee forma parte del banco comunal “Espíritu Santo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa en general. Su taller de costuras lo tiene ubicado al interior de su casa. Sus clientes son colegios, empresas y particulares. Confeccionando uniformes y costuras en general. En su taller Haydee cuenta con 3 máquinas de coser, entre estas una máquina de coser en línea, otra bordadora y una overlook básica. Sus materiales los compra en la ciudad de Concepción y cuando se da la ocasión de viajar a la ciudad de Santiago compra ahí sus materiales. Además la hermana de Haydee la ayuda con las compras y se las envía a la ciudad de Talcahuano por encomienda. 
Con el préstamo comprará una máquina de coser overlook industrial. Además de materiales para sus costuras, específicamente telas.
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio y contratar a una persona que le ayude en el taller, ya que durante todo el año la demanda de sus servicios es alta. Solo durante los meses de mayo, junio y julio, las ventas tienden a disminuir. Sin embargo todo el año llegan a su casa clientes particulares. 
Haydee vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 24 años y su nieto de 4 años de edad. Su hija estudia Construcción Civil. Sus sueños a nivel personal, son poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar. 
Haydee está muy agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Las reuniones a las cuales asiste son muy gratas y comparte bastante con los demás socios del banco comunal. Con las capacitaciones ha podido incorporar a su negocio diferentes técnicas de contabilidad, sobre todo en el registro de ingresos y gastos generados en su negocio. 
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Bíobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the “Espíritu Santo” (Holy Ghost) community bank which is located in the city of Talcahuano.  Her business is general dressmaking.  Her sewing workshop is located in her home and her customers are schools, companies and private customers.  She makes uniforms and clothes in general.  In her workshop, Haydee has three sewing machines: one straight line machine, one embroidery machine and one basic overlock machine.  She buys her materials in the city of Concepción and when she needs to she also travels to the city of Santiago to buy her materials there.  Haydee's sister also helps her with her purchases and sends her parcels to the city of Talcahuano.

Haydee will use her loan to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine.  She will also buy materials for her sewing work, specifically fabrics.  Her goals are to expand her business and to hire someone to help her in her workshop since the demand for her services is high throughout the year.  Only during the months of May, June and July do her sales tend to drop.  However, throughout the year she receives private customers in her home.  

Haydee lives together with her husband, her 24 year-old daughter and her 4 year-old grandson.  Her daughter is studying civil construction.  Haydee's dream on a personal level is to be able to better provide for her family's well-being.

Haydee is very grateful for the loan she has been offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will enable her to invest in her business and make more profit.  She finds the meetings to be very pleasant and she shares a lot with the other members of her community bank.  The training sessions have enabled her to incorporate different accounting techniques into her business, above all as regards the recording of incomings and outgoings in her business.

Talcahuano is a municipality and city-port in Bíobío region, in the south of Chile.  It is known as one of the main ports in the country.  Its name in Mapudungun (Mapuche language) means 'thunderous sky'.  It has a very attractive natural landscape, owing to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows and mountains, with beautiful vegetation.  Its economy revolves around its port, its naval base and an important industrial area with iron and steel companies, oil refineries, petrochemical companies, cement companies, gas companies, etc.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock sewing machine and materials for her sewing, specifically fabric

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Ama K. has been selling shea butter and powder. She plies her trade in Besease Village (near the fishing town of Elmina) the traditional way, carrying her wares around on her head. 

Ama is married to a farmer and they have five children. Her income helps to pay for some of the household expenses. She wants to save up for her children’s education and she wants to expand her business. She will use her loan to purchase larger quantities of powder and shea butter, which she hope will increase her sales. Any additional profits she earns will be reinvested into her business and set aside for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of powder and shea butter, which she hope will increase her sales.

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa, ya no tienen hijos a cargo, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, lleva ya muchos años realizando cultivos año a año, aprendió desde muy joven a través de su padre.
Actualmente el necesita invertir en insumos para llevar a cabo la siembra, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita obtener abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar el trabajo agrícola y recibir la cosecha para comercializar el frijol y maíz que produzca. 
Él aspira tener una granja de gallinas ponedoras, ya que por su edad,  siente que las labores agrícolas dentro de un par de años no las podrá realizar,  pensando siempre en tener una fuente de ingreso, Además le gustaría ahorrar para comprarse un vehículo para transportarse y transportar las cosechas.
texts.en:
Tereso is 59 years old.  He lives with his wife and they no longer have any children in their care.  Tereso grows corn and beans.  He has been growing crops for many years.  He learned the business at a very young age from his father.

Tereso currently needs to invest in supplies so that he can sow his crops.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy manure, fertilizers and pest treatments.  This loan will help him to farm and harvest his crops and then sell the beans and corn that he produces.

Tereso aspires to own a farm of laying hens.  Owing to his age, he feels that he will no longer be able to carry out farm work in a couple of years time.  For this reason, he is thinking about a future source of income.  He would also like to save up to buy a vehicle which he can use for his own transportation and with which he can also transport his crops.

loans.use: to buy materials, manure, fertilizers and pest treatments

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar is 44 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His son is 14 years old and attends a local secondary school. He manages a meat and meat product trading business with the help of his wife. They started their business at a local market in 2007 and are planning to expand their business. They collect husbandry animals from herders and sell their meat to city residents. He is a friendly man who says, "I want my son to be educated and have a better job." He is requesting a 650,000 MNT loan to purchase husbandry animals for his business.

loans.use: To purchase husbandry animals

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene  29 años de edad, ella es soltera y sin hijos, vive con sus padres, dicha vivienda la casa está ubicada en el caserío Wiracocha  en el distrito de Tambogrande en  Piura. Milagros vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Milagros Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Milagros  desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milagros is 29 years old, single, and does not have children. She lives at her parents’ house which is located in the village of Wiracocha in the District of Tambogrande, Piura. Milagros lives in the rural part of the district and does not receive basic services.

She sells cosmetics through catalogs. Milagros sells these products to her neighbors and friends. Every day she strives to attract more customers and generate more orders for her products so that she can earn a better income. This business helps her with covering her personal expenses and assisting her parents with the household finances.

Milagros wants to expand her business by establishing a retail outlet for selling cosmetics out of her home. Her customers will be able to view the products she has on hand and not have to wait as long as a month before receiving their orders. In order to do this, she needs to acquire more products. To accomplish this goal, Milagros is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics so that she can set up a shop in her home.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado  e pai de 6 filhos dos quais não lembra as respectivas idades, mas os mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia e  sustenta os seus netos que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é pensionista na PESCOM uma empresa de pescaria, é negociante há mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que tambem são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu quinto empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (cervejas, refrescos, vinhos, e outros) para o seu estabelecimento. Os primeiros empréstimos foram de: 5.300.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 24.500.00mt para comercio e habitação.
Pretende ampliar o seu negocio para obter mais lucros, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Born in the Boane district of the Maputo province in the south of Mozambique, Pedro is married and the father of six children. He doesn't remember their respective ages, but the oldest go to school. Pedro attended school until the fourth grade, but stopped there for financial reasons. He lives in his own house with his family, and he also supports his grandchildren, who live with him. 

He never left Maputo, and is a pensioner of PESCOM, a fishing company. For the last eight years he has been a shopkeeper, and currently has an income of close to 5,000.00mt per month, which he puts towards household expenses. He also saves a bit in his bank account. 

Pedro has never borrowed from other banks, and he heard about Hluvuku from some friends who are also clients. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku, and is for 12,000.00mt. He plans on buying merchandise (beer, refreshments, wine, and others) for his business. His first loans were for the amounts of: 5,300.00mt, 7,000.00mt, 10,000.00mt, and 24,500.00mt for his business and his home. 

He wants to expand his business to make more profit, and in order to do this he plans on taking out more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (beer, refreshments, wine, and others) for his business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa has worked as a fishmonger for 12 years and is shown here with some smoked fish she has prepared for sale. She is divorced and has seven dependents. With the assistance of her ex-husband's family, she takes care of the family and the home. 

This loan will serve as an additional source of income that will allow Theresa to acquire more fresh fish to smoke and offer for sale. Her future plan for her business is to buy a plot of land and to reinvest in her business for further growth.

loans.use: to acquire more fresh fish to smoke and offer for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old and married. She has three children. 

She has a business selling beauty products and cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, make-up and hair products. She sells her products to various clients all around the city of Cusco. 

In addition, she also has a small furniture-making business. 

Gladys is asking for a loan in order to buy more beauty products to sell such as shampoos, hair clips, lotions and make-up. She will also use part of the loan to buy wood and other materials to make furniture. 

Gladys is a very hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell such as make-up, perfumes and hair products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 35 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 17 ans, vu sa charge, elle se decide un jour d'ouvrir une cabine telephonique pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Ses revenus sont de 40.000frs a 60.000frs par jour, elle a une bonne stategie parcequ'elle a su fideliser ses clients.
Ayant deja beneficie d'un premier pret, elle a rembourse avec succes et a fait des epargnes considerables, pour ce second pret elle va s'approvisionner en stock de cartes comme cartes MTN a 100.000frs , Airtel a 80.000 frs, Sim a 40.000 frs.
Pour l'avenir , elle veut ouvrir une boutique pour vendre les telephones et accessoires et avec les benefices elle pourra subvenir a l'education de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old, single and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 17. Faced with the need to provide for her family, she decided one day to set up a telephone booth. She earns between 40,000 and 60,000 CFA francs per day. Her business strategy is good, because she has a loyal clientele.

After having been granted her first loan, which she has repaid successfully and which enabled her to save up a considerable amount of money, Christine applied for her second loan which she will use to buy recharge phone cards, such as MTN cards for 100,000 francs, Airtel cards for 80,000 francs and Sim cards for 40,000 francs.

Her plans for the future consist in the opening of a store to sell phones and accessories. She will use her profit to continue to provide her children with education.

loans.use: to buy recharge phonecards from various companies.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with five children who all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth, thread and an additional sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread and an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Margaret Mbula

texts.en: Margaret is a 40-year-old widowed woman with one grown up daughter. She describes herself as talkative and social. She operates a clothing sales store. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more clothes to sell during the Christmas season. Her business goal is to open up a boutique in town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her grandsons to become graduates.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Magaly Esther

texts.es: Magaly de 50 años vive con su esposo en el barrio las Américas al suroccidente de la ciudad y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 21 a 26 años. En familia poco a poco han construido sus sueños, así como con sus ahorros lograron comprar un lote y gradualmente, paso a paso,  tener hoy su vivienda propia. En lo que han logrado en familia,  ha estado presente su negocio, pues sin él no hubiera sido posible su crecimiento familiar, empresarial y personal. Magaly vende mercancía variada como ropa, calzado, fantasía, desde hace 15 años. Distribuye sus productos a crédito en plazos acordados con sus clientes que son vecinos, familiares y empleados referidos por sus mejores compradores. Su experiencia data desde cuando tenía 15 años y ya trabajaba en almacenes de fabricación de prendas de vestir. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido estar muy cerca de la educación de sus hijos y esto es muy importante para su familia. Su credikiva es el crédito # 11 que Magaly hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que ha estado vinculada durante 10 años y con los cuales ha logrado un mejoramiento de las condiciones habitacionales de su familia;  con su primer credikiva comprará mecedoras en la ciudad de Sincelejo y los distribuirá entre clientes interesados que ya han realizado sus pedidos.   En la actualidad su rotación de cuentas por cobrar es de 15 días mientras su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 35%,  indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una inversión exitosa de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Magaly, 50, lives with her husband in the Américas neighborhood on the southwest side of the city and they have three children, ages 21 through 26.  As a family they have built their dreams little by little and with their savings were able to eventually own their own home.  Also the family achievements show in the current business which has been responsible for family, entrepreneurial and personal growth.  

Magaly has been selling different merchandise such as clothing, shoes and accessories for 15 years.  She distributes her products on a credit basis to her customers who include neighbors, family and referred acquaintances through her best buyers.  Her experience dates back to when she was 15 years old and worked for a clothing manufacturer.  Thanks to this activity she has been able to supervise her children's education and this is very important for the family.  Her credikiva is the 11th loan Magaly has had through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She has been a member for ten years and has been able to improve her family's lifestyle thanks to the loans.  Her first credikiva will be used to buy rocking chairs in the city of Sincelejo which she will distribute among interested customers who have already placed orders.  Her current accounts receivable turnover is 15 days and profit on sales is 35%.  These are the financial indicators we used to project growth potential and we forecast a successful investment from her credikiva.

loans.use: To buy and distribute rocking chairs.

loans.name: Raquel Maria

texts.es: La señora Raquel,  se dedica a la venta de comida,  es una clienta nueva de la institución, que demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se lo hizo, la cliente vive en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de el Alto, La Paz Bolivia, ubicada al sur de esta ciudad. La Sra. Raquel en la actualidad vive con sus dos pequeños niños pero cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá política,  su Suegra para el cuidado de ellos, cuenta que el esposo las abandonó y no sabe donde se encuentra.   La Sra. Raquel es muy trabajadora y además abnegada con sus hijos, ella tiene la voluntad de que con trabajo, va un día tener su casa propia y además que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerza a lograrlo día a día. El negocio es muy concurrido y por esta razón tiene la necesidad de ampliarlo por esta razon solicito el  crédito que lo utilizara en la compra de mesas, sillas y un refrigerador para la venta de comida,  para llegar a tener una mayor venta y poder de esta manera superarse y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Raquel sells food, and she is a new client of the Institución.  She demonstrated herself to be friendly and courteous during the evaluation that was done.  She lives in the Villa Adela area of the city of El Alto, La Paz, Bolivia; which is located to the south of this city.

Raquel currently lives with her two small children, and her mother-in-law helps her take care of the children.  She says that her husband abandoned them, and she does not know where he is.

Raquel is very hard-working, and she is also self-sacrificing for her children.  She has the wish that through work she will one day have her own house.  She also wishes that her children will come to have professional careers.  She works hard every day to achieve that.

Her business is very busy, and that is the reason that she needs to expand it.  That is why she requested the loan to buy tables, chairs, and a refrigerator to sell food.  This way she will have greater sales and be able to excel and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ezira

texts.en: Ezira is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the general store business for two years starting with 200,000 shillings and he now has 1,800,000 shillings in working capital. His hardships are limited funds, debtors and inflation but his vision is a bigger shop plus educating his child. Ezira needs the loan to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is engaged in agriculture. She keeps fruits and vegetables in the freezer to sell during the winter season. To meet the rising demand for frozen fruits Larisa would like to keep fruit not only from her orchard. With the requested loan Larisa plans to purchase more fruit. This loan will help Larisa to increase her business income and insure a brighter future for her family. Larisa lives together with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for extra fruit to freeze and sell in winter.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a tax inspector. Together with her husband she brings up a two year-old son. Farida works as a bookkeeper in a bank. A few years ago, the couple decided to save money from their salary and invest the savings in livestock breeding. In their opinion it is an effective way of investing money. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future Farida wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
