MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con el señor Gerardo, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Omar, Beatriz y José Luis de los cuales todos estudian, 2 están cursando quinto y sexto año de primaria y el mas pequeño esta en tercer año de preescolar, se dedica a la venta de maíz y refrescos, desde hace mas de 6 años.
Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio, buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, también para mejorar un poco mas su solvencia económica y así asegurar el futuro y educación de sus hijos, el crédito que recibió decidió invertirlo en la compra de mas maíz y refrescos, para continuar con sus ventas  
El deseo más grande que tiene doña Rosa (como mejor la conocen sus vecinos) para su negocio, es la de incrementar su inversión, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quisiera poner un deposito de refrescos, para así mejorar e incrementar aún más sus ganancias, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y puedan tener una muy buena profesión.
Esta muy satisfecha por contar con el apoyo de FRAC y los donadores de kiva, ya que gracias a esto ahora goza de una mejor producción y surtido en el negocio, que le ayuda, para continuar ahorrando parte de sus ganancias, puesto que así asegurara la educación superior de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda is 34 years old and is married to Mr. Gerardo, together they have 3 children: Omar, Beatriz and Jose Luis, who are all in school.  Two are in the 5th and 6th grades of elementary school and the youngest is in the third year of preschool.  For the last 6 years, she has been making a living selling corn and beverages.
She decided to start this business as she was looking for a way to help her husband with the household expenses and provide a better quality of life.  It also helps to improve their financial position and assure the future and education of the children.  The loan received is to purchase corn and beverages to be able to continue selling them.
The greatest wish that Doña Rosa (as she is known by her neighbors) has for her business is that the increase in investment will produce rapid growth.  She would like to get a tank of beverages to improve and increase her sales and profits and continue to support her children in their studies hoping that they will have a good profession when they grow up.
She is very satisfied with the support from FRAC and the donations from Kiva, since due to these she enjoys improvements in the output and stock of her business.  This helps her to continue saving a portion of her income towards the advanced education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en: Because the price for pigs is better now, Ni Ketut decided to ask for a new loan. The loan will be used to purchase two pigs and feed. Ni Ketut said, this business really helps her family to increase their income. Now, it's not only her husband who can work, but she also can help support the family. Her husband very happy about that. She will be saving all the profit for future needs.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Marknaf

texts.en:
Marknaf has operated a medical clinic for the last seven years and earns a monthly profit of KES. 10,000. He is married to Christine, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has applied for his second loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees.

He will save the anticipated profits, and in the future he hopes to expand his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María Carolina tiene 44 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 6 hijos, pero vive con 2 de ellos, de 13 y 5 años. Habita en su casa propia en el centro poblado San Fernando de Kivinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo (selva central). Ella es una mujer de campo. Le gusta lo que hace. Con la agricultura ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. En sus terrenos de cultivos propios siembra: yucas, plátanos, frijol, maíz y cítricos. Sabe muy bien como comercializar sus productos, ya que cada uno de ellos se cosecha en distintos meses del año. Así se abastece. Y como ella no desperdiga, también se dedica a la venta de hojas de plátanos. “Es rentable vender hojas, cada paquete está a 5 soles y a la quincena vendo de 60 a 70 paquetes”, dice. También compra y vende maní, adquiriendo el kilo a 8 soles, y lo que ofrece de 10 hasta 11 soles. El negocio es conveniente. Con el mismo esfuerzo y perseverancia, María desea ampliar sus sembríos, para producir maní y plátanos, de esa manera sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida. Este sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por lo que agradece de antemano el apoyo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”, su banco comunal, por que sabe que en equipo los logros serán mayores. De obtener el dinero, contratará personal para la limpieza de sus parcelas de yucas y maíz. Con lo sobrante comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
María Carolina, 44, is a single mother of six children, two of which (ages 13 and 5) live with her.  She has her own home in the center of the town of San Fernando de Kivinaki in the province of Chanchamayo (central forest).  She is a farmer and loves what she does, as it has allowed her to provide for her children.  On her cropland she grows yucca plant, plantain, beans, corn and citrus fruits.  

She is an expert at selling her produce since each harvest occurs in different months of the year, and she stays stocked this way.  And since she does not throw anything away, she also sells plantain leaves.  "Selling the leaves is profitable, since each packet is worth 5 PEN and every two weeks I sell between 60 to 70 packets.", she says.  She also buys and sells peanuts, which she purchases at 8 PEN and sells for 10 or 11 PEN.  The business is easy.  With the same effort and perseverance, María wants to add to her crops and grow peanuts so she can give her children a better quality of life.  

This is her first loan through MFP and she is grateful for the support.  She is happy to belong to the communal bank "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki" because she believes that more achievement comes through teamwork.  The loan will be used to hire workers to clear the yucca and corn fields.  The rest will be used to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire workers and buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy (in the photo), age 47, is a widower with three sons and two daughters. One of the children has full-time employment, three of the others attend school. Another one raises ducks for a living. He is hired and gets paid with fees. The family lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vuthy is a soldier. He is applying for a loan of $800 to purchase new motorcycles for commuting because the old one breaks and uses more gasoline than the new ones.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz K. owns a small store of general household items in the small town of Devechi. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Gulnaz is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and quality of her inventory. She feels that a more varied inventory will increase her customer base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo has 20 years of experience in furniture making. He started his own business 15 years ago. His carpentry workshop is located in his home. His products, more specifically, include wardrobes, shelves and other items his customers request. His wife and his children help him in his business, and they help clients from 7 AM to 6 PM.

Pablo will use the loan to buy wood, glue, sealant, sandpaper, solvant and other supplies needed to meet customers' requests. Pablo is really well known in his area and people always look for him because he finishes his work on time.

Pablo is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. Pablo and his wife work hard every day to succeed with their workshop in order to be able to give their children better food and a good education. Pablo also hopes that the revenue generated from his new investment will allow him to keep adapting his home to suit his shop's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

Pablo tiene experiencia en ebanistería desde hace 20 años en trabajos que realizo con familiares que tenían este oficio. Se inicio con su negocio desde hace 15 años. Su taller de ebanistería esta ubicado en su domicilio. Sus productos a elaborar son las cómodas, anaqueles y otros artículos que sus clientes le soliciten. En su negocio lo apoyan su esposa e hijos y dan atención a sus clientes desde las 7AM a 18PM

Pablo utilizara su crédito en la compra de maderas, goma, sellador, lijas, diluyente y otros para así cumplir con su clientela. Pablo es muy conocido en su sector y siempre lo buscan por lo que cumple con su trabajo a tiempo.

Pablo es casado tiene 39 años y 4 hijos menores de edad. Pablo junto con su esposa se esfuerzan día a día para seguir adelante con su taller y así poder contar con sus ingresos y darles una mejor alimentación y educación a su familia. Pablo también anhela que con los ingresos obtenidos generados con esta nueva inversión podrá seguir adecuando su vivienda.

loans.use: Carpentry Material

loans.name: Musabe

texts.en:
Musabe started her business over 10 years ago. She was married, but her husband died in 1997, leaving her alone with 7 beautiful daughters. All the difficulties of taking care of children and their home were on her shoulders from that point on.

Musabe was the manager of a kindergarten, but the salary was not enough to support her big family, so she decided to sell soft drinks in the open-air market. Gradually, she was able to increase her circulating capital and rented stall space in Shark shop in Panjshanbe for her present business.

In 2006 Musabe became a client of Micro Invest. Her first loan was US$ 150. Thanks to the loans, she was able to sign contracts with several sewing shops of traditional women's dresses for long partnership. Currently she has US$ 2000 in her turnover.

Today Musabe has many clients and is very satisfied with her place of business. In future she hopes to rent another stall for her eldest daughter. Musabe has two dreams: first to give all her children a good education and secondly, she dearly wishes that her family will not to be in need of anything.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lưu Thị Chiên lives in the village of Hưng Đạo, district Hưng Nguyên. A retiree 10 years ago but she did not just stay home and collect pension from the government. All her five children are grown up and they would like very much help their parents financially but Mrs Chiên does not want to depend on her children. This is why she had contracted a loan from "Quỹ Tình thương" organization 10 years ago. With an small initial loan of only 50 USD, she invested in a small store selling basic goods. Her inventory includes cooking oil, sugar, instant noodle cups ...etc. This not only generates income for her but also provides her a sense of personal satisfaction knowing that she can take care of her self. With the full support from her husband, also a retiree, Mrs Chiên requests a loan of 200 USD to buy more stock for her store which will in term increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Sau khi về hưu, chị Lưu Thị Chiên, xã Hưng Đạo, huyện Hưng Nguyên không chấp nhận việc chỉ ngồi nhận những đồng lương hưu của nhà nước. Mặc dù các con chị, gồm 4 gái và một trai đều đã trưởng thành và luôn mong muốn được giúp đỡ cha mẹ nhưng chị không muốn phụ thuộc vào con cái. Đó là lý do vì sao chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ 10 năm trước. Với số vốn được vay ban đầu là 50 USD, chị đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Cửa hàng nhỏ bao gồm những món hàng như cân đường, chai dầu ăn, gói mì chính vừa tạo ra một khoản thu nhập vừa làm chị cảm thấy vui khi thấy mình vẫn còn đủ sức làm việc. Với sự hỗ trợ, động viên của chồng cũng là một cán bộ nghỉ hưu, chị đang xin vay thêm 200 USD để mua thêm hàng, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Señora Natalia is the mother of two children: she is very hard-working and dedicated. She has a small bakery located insiD. her home, a business she inherited from her dear parents and to which she has devoted herself for more than thirty years together with her husband, Antonio.

As a result of much effort, dedication and above all kindness they have been able to convert their small business into one of the most crowded and their breads into some of the most requested in the town. In order to maintain this level of appreciation and regard, she starts her work at 3 in the morning and finish at five in the evening, together with two other people whom they employ in the bakery. Natalia’s wish is to complete the expansion and renovation of her bakery because up until a few days ago they were working with this in mind, but didn’t count on their lack of budgeted funds.

It is for this reason that she his asking a loan of $350 dollars, money which will allow her to complete the renovation of their important work space. Natalie promises to be punctual in her repayments and to return the loan within six months. With our help Natalia and her family can make their dreams reality.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Natalia es madre D. 2 hijos, muy laboriosa y persistente, cuenta con su pequeña panadería ubicada en su domicilio, oficio que heredó D. sus queridos padres y al que se dedica hace ya más D. 30 años junto a su esposo, Antonio.

A base D. mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y sobre todo amabilidad han podido convertir su pequeño negocio en uno D. los más concurridos y D. sus panes uno D. las más solicitados D. su ciudad..Para continuar con este aprecio y preferencia inician su trabajo a las 3:00 D. la madrugada y la culminan a las 5:00 D. la tarD., junto a otras 2 personas a quienes ofrecen trabajo en su panificadora.El deseo D. Natalia es culminar con la ampliación y mejoramiento D. su panadería porque hasta hace algunos días estuvieron trabajando en ese propósito pero no contaban con su falta D. presupuesto.

Es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo D. 350 dólares, dinero que le permitirá concluir con el arreglo D. su tan apreciado espacio D. trabajo, Natalia promete ser puntual y devolver el préstamo en un lapos D. 6 meses.“Con nuestra ayuda Natalia y su familia pueden hacer realidad sus sueños.”

loans.use: Completion of the installation of a bakery

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Héctor and Yeny dedicate themselves to farming and selling their agricultural products. This is very common in Perú. Every day, they put all their energy into their goal of raising strong healthy crops. However, Héctor always looks for other ways to improve his income to sustain his family by holding different temp jobs. Extra income provides for his children's needs and supports them during the time they wait for money from crop sales. Meanwhile, Yeny has responsibility for cultivating their crops. This entrepreneur's wish is to increase the quantity of their products, so that post-sale profits will generate sufficient savings to build their own house. Both believe that this work will allow them to move ahead in life. To materialize their beliefs, they require some capital for investment and turn to you for support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Héctor y Yeny, se dedican al cultivo y a la comercialización de productos agrícolas; actividad muy común en el Perú. Diariamente ponen todo su entusiasmo con el propósito de que sus plantitas crezcan sanas y fuertes; sin embargo Héctor siempre busca la manera de generar ingresos económicos extras para el sustento familiar desempeñándose en diferentes trabajos eventuales a fin de satisfacer eficazmente las solicitudes de sus hijos debido a que es muy larga la espera para obtener las ganancias agrícolas.Mientras tanto, Yeny se encarga del cuidado de sus cultivos; el deseo de esta emprendedora familia es aumentar la cantidad de sus productos y con la comercialización de estos ahorrar lo suficiente para construir su casita, ambos creen que con este oficio podrán salir adelante y para concretar este pensamiento requieren de una suma de dinero como capital de inversión y es por eso que recurren a vuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Capital for their agricultural work for better family benefits

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria E. is a mother who, like all mothers, tries to offer a good education to her dear children. And even more so when these children are just a step away from turning into what their dear mothers yearn for. This unselfish mother has worked as a baker for more than 4 years. This business that she began has turned into an important business for her community. She continually has orders to fill and has even more business now that her list of clients has notably increased.

For this reason, she requires much help to prepare her wonderful tasting breads and rolls that she happily bakes very early in the mornings. She is asking for a loan to aquire tools for bread-making in order to make their production easier. Let's grant her petition so that she can continue delighting her community with her delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Maria E., es una madre que como todas trata de brindar educación a sus queridos hijos y aún más cuando estos están a un paso de convertirse en lo que sus queridas madres anhelan. Esta abnegada madre se dedica a la labor panadera hace más de cuatro años y el negocio que emprendió se ha convertido en una gran ayuda para su localidad; los repartos que realiza son continuos y más ahora que su lista de clientes se ha incrementado notablemente, por tal motivo requiere de mucha ayuda para elaborar sus riquísimos panes y panecillos que muy de mañana hornea alegremente.Hace la solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir herramientas de panificación a fin de agilizar su producción.Posibilitemos su petición para que siga deleitando a su comunidad con sus deliciosos panes.

loans.use: Purchase tools for bread-making.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Mamhmadali H. is 49 years old. He has a secondary education. He is married and has six children. Mahmadali has a small plot of land where he wants to plant wheat. Mahmadali intends to use the proceeds of his loan to purchase wheat seeds as well as purchase livestock. When the wheat is ready to be harvested, he will use the wheat to make flour for bread for his family during the winter. The profits he receives from reselling livestock will cover his loan payments. Mahmadali plans to repay his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хомидов Махмадали, возраст – 49 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Махмадали имеет небольшой участок земли, на которм он хочет посеять пшеницу. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение семян пшеницы, а также на приобретение и продажу мелкого рогатого скота. Полученный урожай он планирует отсавить себе, так как в течение всей следующей зимы он будет пользоваться ею для производства муки и выпечки хлеба. За счет прибыли, которую он планирует получать от продажи мелкого рогатого скота, будет погашать текущие платежи по кредиту. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds  and breading and selling livestock

loans.name: Ahliba

texts.fr:
Madame Ahliba B. was born in 1966. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a saleswoman of food products, an activity that has been very profitable but still needs a larger investment. To better satisfy her customers, Madame B. is asking for a loan that will allow her to reinforce her purchasing power and to buy larger stocks of corn and rice. This will allow her to see her revenue increase and better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame B. Ahliba est née en 1966, mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse des produits alimentaires, une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite plus de fonds. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientele, Madame B. Ahliba sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer son pouvoir d’achat et constituer un stock de mais.et de riz. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et de mieux s’occuper des besoins de sa famille

loans.use: To stock corn and rice.

loans.name: Simiona

texts.es:
Simiona sells basic food products at her grocery store. She is 36 years old and she has 3 children. There is nothing impossible for her, since she considers herself to be a very active woman and she is especially cheerful with her children and her clients. Her dear husband Mr. David supports her with all of her decisions and he helps her with her business. Simiona is a woman with a desire of self-improvement and success and she works hard for the being well-being of her dear children. She wants to see her business grow and for this reason she needs a working capital that will help her increase the quantity of products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Simiona, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos. Para ella no existe nada imposible ya que se considera una mujer súper activa y sobre todo jovial con sus hijos y sus clientes. Su querido esposo el señor David la apoya en todas sus decisiones y le brinda su apoyo dándole la mano en su negocio. Simiona es una mujer con ganas de superación y deseos de éxito y se esmera por procurarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos. Ella quiere ver crecer su negocio y para ello requiere de un capital que le ayude a incrementar la cantidad de productos que oferta.

loans.use: Increase working capital to buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Vasilina

texts.en:
Vasilina has a small clothing business at a busy market in Kahovka, Ukraine. In business for eleven years, she has gained much valuable experience and met the clothing needs of many customers along the way. Vasilina is married and has a fourteen-year-old daughter. She currently makes about $300 per month in profits and has about $3000 worth of inventory on hand.

Vasilina has requested a short term loan to help purchase additional merchandise to sell in her kiosk. The spring and summer are busy times of the year for clothing vendors like Vasilina as the weather improves and customers get out to shop and update their wardrobes. This loan will help Vasilina obtain necessary inventory so she can earn a good profit and continue the success of her business.

loans.use: Purchase new invenory

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Mwajabu L., who is married and has two children aged 2 and 10. In 2008, Mwajabu established her café business and now she requires a loan in order to purchase additional ingredients, such as rice, beans, and maize, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients such as rice, maize, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old. She is married with three children aged seventeen, fifteen, and twelve years respectively. They are all currently in school.

Mary is a petty trader who trades in maize and ginger. She has been a retailer of ginger and maize for the past twelve years and provides for her family.

Mary wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of maize and ginger to serve her customers throughout the season. She faces increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country. The loan will help her with increasing costs and enable her to raise her income to support her children at school.

She belongs to a community group called "Blessing Trust Group" where group members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

This photo of Mary was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of maize and ginger.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 27 years old, she studied up to grade 9, she speaks "aymara" and Spanish, she lives with her partner and has two children that are studying. Her address is in the Marquiri sector, in Caritamaya, district of Acora, province and region of Puno.

Olga has had a small general store for five years, she also started buying and selling livestock (lamb and beef) at fairs in Ilave and Acora. In addition, she makes crafts (puppets, hats, scarves).

She belongs to the “New Horizon” community bank, where she received an initial loan of $115 USD (S/. 300) that was used to purchase six lambs to feed and sell when grown.

With savings and the loan of $375 USD (S/. 1000), which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a loom to make hats and puppets in large quantities and this way sell them in large quantities as well.

She is very thankful for the first loan because it helped her switch activities and increase her income, learning to be responsible with her payments. Her big dream is to purchase different types of looms and be able to offer a variety of products to increase her income and help with her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Olga tiene 27 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, habla el idioma aymará y castellano, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, su domicilio esta ubicado en el Sector Marquiri, del Centro Poblado de Caritamaya, del Distrito de Acora, Provincia y región de Puno.

Olga tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, hace cinco años, también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino que los compra y vende en las ferias de Ilave y Acora a su vez se dedica a la producción de Artesanía (títeres, chullos, chalinas).

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar seis ovejas para engorde y después ser vendidos.

Con este crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprarà, junto a sus ahorros, una Maquina de tejer, para que pueda elaborar, chullos, títeres, en cantidad y poderlos vender por mayor.

Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito por que le ayudo a cambiar de negocio e incrementar su ingreso económico; aprendiendo a ser responsable en sus pagos. El gran sueño que ella tiene es comprar mas variedad de maquinas de tejer para que pueda variar los productos y de esa manera incrementar su ingreso económico y poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a loom to weave hats, puppets and scarves

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old. She is married with three children, ages 7, 2, and 1. She has owned a small spice shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
El microempresario José Ángel B. M. tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en nivel primario, este señor se dedica desde hace 4 años a vender trastes de cocinas, trastes plásticos, flores plásticas, escobas, electrodomésticos, entre otros productos. Para asegurarse sus ventas compra algunos productos por encargos los cuales vende al crédito y otros los vende de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. En esta actividad el microempresario B. manifiesta tener una ventaje y es que la mayoría de sus productos por ser de material plástico le permite poca depreciación. Este señor obtiene parte de sus productos al crédito a corto plazo por lo que tiene que recuperar rápidamente la venta de esos productos y las ganancias son pocas. Trabaja por un lado de la modalidad por encargo que consiste que sus clientes le encargan productos y solo los entrega y por otro lado oferta su producto al publico en general. Sin embargo no cuenta con mucho capital, por tal razón esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

6 Abanicos corrientes a US$ 12.00 cada uno, 8 planchas Black & Deker a US$ 10.00 cada una, 1 lote de flores plásticas a US$ 74.00 el lote, 3 docenas de chinelas variadas a US$ 18.00 cada docena, 1 lote de traste de cocina a US$ 150.00 el lote, 3 docenas de escobas a US$ 60.00 cada docena, y ½ lote de trastes plásticos a US$ 160.00 el medio lote.
texts.en:
The small business owner Jose Angel B. M. is 31 years old, is married, and has a son who is currently attending primary school. For the past 4 years he has been selling dishes, plastic dishes, silk flowers, brooms, and electrical appliances among other products. To supplement his sales he takes some orders for products sold on credit and he also carries out door-to-door sales as well sales from his home. Mr. B. seen an advantage because most of the products he sells are plastic based and they depreciate slowly. He obtains some of his products on short-term credit loans but he is required to quickly sell off those products and his earnings are small. He also takes orders from his clients and he himself delivers the products, but he also sells to the general public. But through all of this he still cannot accumulate much capital, which is the reason why he is requesting a loan. He will put those funds towards the following purchases:

6 standard fans at $12 each; 8 Black & Decker irons at $10 each; 1 lot of silk flowers at $74/lot; 3 dozen flip-flops at $18/dozen; 1 lot of kitchen dishes at $150/lot; 3 dozen brooms at $60/dozen; and, 1/2 lot of plastic dishes at $160/half lot.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 standard fans; 8 Black & Decker irons; 1 lot of silk flowers; 3 dozen flip-flops; 1 lot of kitchen dishes; 3 dozen brooms; 1/2 lot of plastic dishes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty cuenta con 23 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos y con su esposo que es agricultor. Ella ha crecido en el ambiente del cultivo, proviene de padres agricultores, y se ha casado con un responsable agricultor. Después de cocinar el almuerzo que lleva a la chacra, apoya en las labores agrícolas a su esposo, han sembrado de 4 sacos de semilla y esperan cosechar un aproximado de 50 sacos, también está sembrando maíz y habas, estos sembríos necesitan de abono, porque sino, dice,  no producen como para ser vendidos en el mercado. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de carne roja de ovino. El problema para ellos es el incremento de los abonos.  Betty y su esposo trabajan a veces junto y a veces cada quien en sus actividades, con el afán de comprar una casa propia, ya que quiere su privacidad, nos dice. Con el préstamo, comprará abonos y guano para sus cultivos de habas y maíz, con la finalidad de que produzcan bien y puedan cotizarlos un buen precio.
texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old and lives in her parents’ house with her two children and husband, who is a farmer. She was raised in a farming environment – her parents are farmers – and she married a responsible farmer. After cooking the breakfast which she takes to the farm, she supports her husband in his agricultural labors. They have planted four sacks of seed, and hope to sow approximately 50 sacks. She is also planting corn and beans. These crops require fertilizer because if not, she says, they will not produce enough to be sold at the market. At the same time, she dedicates herself to the sale of red meat from sheep. The problem for them is the high price of fertilizers. Betty and her husband work together sometimes, and at times each alone with their own activities. They yearn to purchase their own home, as she tells us, she would like her privacy. With the loan, she will buy fertilizers and manure for the bean and rice crops hoping that, in the end, they will have a good harvest and be able to sell their products for favorable prices.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Susana Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Susana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Perseverantes ubicado en el  Jr. Yarinacocha Mz. B Lt. 15, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 37 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos menores D. edad que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como contador para una empresa maderera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. productos D. bellezas “UNIQUE”. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora D. Educación Inicial y cuenta con el mismo negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza, UNIQUE.    

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará crema D. manos y cuerpo, loción, colonias, etc. 

Susana es una mujer que trabaja constantemente para darles una educación a cada uno D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Susana belongs to the community bank "Mujeres Perseverantes" located in the Jr. Yarinacocha Mz. B Lt. 15, district of Yarinacocha, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 37 years of age, is the mother of four young children who depend on her, is married, and her husband works as an accountant for a lumber company. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles, she decided to invest it in the sale of "UNIQUE" beauty products. She has worked with the community bank for 5 years. Currently, she is an early education teacher and still counts on her business selling UNIQUE beauty products. With this loan of 1,500 Soles ($500), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy hand and body cream, lotion, colognes, etc. Susana is a woman who works constantly to give an education to each of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase hand and body cream, lotion, colognes, etc.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Mrs. Ken M. (pictured with her mother), 29, was married in 1998 and has four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of them attend school and the other child is too young for school. The family lives in a small village across from the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Ken has been a silk weaver for 4 years, a skill she learned from a neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then sells it in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman and also builds wooden houses. Ken is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 21-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Moussa has been working as barber since 2002. He also sells men's perfumes, and shaving and cleaning products for men. Moussa has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase gel, bags, necklaces, perfumes and other accessories for men. This is the first time that Moussa has requested a loan.

Moussa is special in his field, because his workplace is clean, his work is good, and he is fast. His clients are his friends, family members and neighbors. When he first started his business, he lacked cash, which made him borrow money. Now, thanks to his work, he has been able to use his business income to repay his loan. 

Moussa decided to be a barber, because he learned it in a academy, and he gained experience in one of his friend’s salons.

loans.use: Moussa will use the loan to purchase gel, bags, necklaces, perfumes and other men's accessories.

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: La Sra. Zoila vende en un kiosco en un colegio,  desde hace diez años, tiene 48 años de edad, y habita en anexo en villa Venezuela, con un hijo de 18 años de edad, que estudia, inicio cuando ingreso una solicitud para administrar el kiosco del bar., para esto presto dinero en una financiera, con esta solicitud en Afodenic es la segunda que ha sido de mucha beneficios ya que ha logrado invertir en su negocio, con esta solicitud de préstamo va invertir en infraestructura para hacer varias reparaciones a su casa de habitación. Sus planes a futuro es poder crecer y mejorar las finanzas para el bienestar de su familia. a si como poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zoila, 48, lives near Venezuela village with her 18-year old son, who is a student. She has been selling goods in a kiosk (inside a local school) for ten years. After making her initial request and securing the rights to operate the kiosk, she was able to begin operating her business by borrowing money from a local finance institution. She will use the current loan amount she is requesting from Afodenic to make necessary infrastructure improvements to her home. This loan will allow her not only to make these much-needed repairs, but also to grow (and therefore improve!) her family's financial well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials necessary for home improvement

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: S. is 49 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has three children; all of them are students. She is married to Katha, 48, who owns a set of music instruments that he rents out. S. has been selling sausages to the villagers in front of her house since 2006. She is good at making a tasty spicy sauce for her customers so that she can earn a better profit. At the family's proposal, S. is looking for a loan of US$ 600 to buy more music instruments for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more music instruments for her husband's rental business

loans.name: Kyambadde Aidah Group

texts.en:
Kyambadde A. is 32 years of age; she is married with 8 children. She owns a house with 5 rooms and that is where she lives with her family. She does not have water in her home, neither does she have electricity. She has to fetch water from a nearby spring. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is feeding her children.

Kyambadde A. sells charcoal from her home and she works seven days a week. She receives about 30 customers a day; she sells her charcoal both retail and wholesale. She has done this business for 10 years now.

The challenges she faces in this business are that since she has to collect the charcoal from the villages, the distances are very far and when it rains it is very difficult to access the village roads because most times they become impassable.

She has worked with MCDT for eight years and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she needed some capital for her business. She wants to use this loan to invest in her business and her aspiration is to start up a retail shop.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas se encuentra trabajando en la zona de Cerrito, Capiatá, hace cerca de dos años. Se reunen habitualmente los días lunes y siempre que pueden pagan adelantado. Todos los ciclos completan de una o dos semanas antes de la fecha. Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de artículos en el barrio en el cual residen, tanto en sus respectivos domicilios como recorriendo casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos.

Liz Lorena B.	Cocinera - 
Silvia R.	Venta de Ropas - 
Teresita A.	Venta de Joyas - 
Zulma B.	Venta de bebidas - 
Maria Luisa A.	Despensa - 
Inmaculada R.	Kiosko - 
Crecencia R.	Venta de ropas - 
Luciana M.	Venta de ropas - 
Angélica B.	Despensa - 
Ernesta V.	Venta de Carbón - 
Silvia R.	Venta de comidas - 
Jovina O.	Mercería - 
Nilsa C.	Venta de cosméticos - 
Cristina Arévalos	Venta de frutas y verduras - 
Luz Marina M.	Venta de bebidas - 
Aurelia G. 	Venta de Lencería - 
Liliana M. 	Costurera
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas (United Women) has worked in the Cerrito Zone, Capiatá, since two years ago. They meet regularly on Mondays and pay in advance whenever they can. They finish all of the payment cycles one or two weeks before the due date. The women who make up this group sell things in their neighborhood, selling from their own homes or going from house to house to sell their products. Liz Lorena B. Cook - Silvia R. Clothing sales- Teresita A. Jewelry sales - Zulma B. Beverage sales - Maria Luisa A. Food sales - Inmaculada R. Kiosk - Crecencia R. Clothing sales - Luciana M. Clothing sales - Angélica B. Food sales - Ernesta V. Coal sales - Silvia R. Food sales Jovina O. Hardware sales - Nilsa C. Cosmetic sales Cristina Arévalos Fruit and vegetable sales Luz Marina M. Beverage sales Aurelia G. Lingerie sales - Liliana M. Seamstress -

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, soft drinks, beers, wines; purchase of underwear, purchase of fruits and vegetables, purchase of candy, purchase of sugar, maté, oil, rice, pasta, cookies, milk, etc.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. She says one of her children has completed the junior high school while the others are in the primary schools. She says she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Akua works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Akua’s husband is a farmer.

Akua is a trader. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies, doughnuts, chips (french fries), etc. Akua distributes to retailers in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Akua has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Holdorov

texts.ru: Турсунов Холдор- мужчина 53 лет. Женат отец 4-х детей. Холдор получил потребительский заем для  строительства сарая. Холдор является клиентом нашего Фонда с 2008 года. Ему очень нравятся наши условия. Холдор по специальности водитель. Он работает в колхозе водителем. Также Холдор на выходные на своем легковом автомобиле занимается частным извозом.  Жена присматривают за домашним скотом , которое также дает, прибыль семье.
texts.en:
Holdor T. is a 53 year old man. He is married and has 4 children. Holdor received a consumer loan in order to build a shed. Holdor has been a client of our Fund since 2008. He likes our terms. Holdor is a driver by profession. He works at a collective farm as a driver. In addition, on the weekends Holdor uses his car to provide rides. His wife takes care of the livestock which also brings income to the family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build shed

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor García tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Leonor tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es venta de ropa y pollo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Leonor inicio este negocio por la necesidad de llevar un sustento diario a su hogar, y contribuir en la formación de sus hijos. La ubicación del negocio es en su vivienda y poco a poco es que ha aumentado su negocio. Los propósitos de Leonor son de predominar en el mercado. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos variados. Los sueños de Leonor son de lograr establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Leonor García is 57 years old. Her marital status is married. Mrs. Leonor has 3 children and all are working. She works selling clothes and chicken. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Leonor began this business because of her need to earn a daily living for her home and to contribute to her children’s education. The business is located in her house and little by little it has grown. Leonor’s goal is to dominate the market. The financing is to buy varied products. Leonor’s dream is to establish another business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hamidan Muhammad Sharif Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy biscuits (cookies) and chips for her canteen.

Hamidan baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past eighteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage.

Hamidan baji, herself, operate a clothes-sewing business to pay off the utilities because her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her clothes-sewing business.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Yasmin Elizabeth

texts.es: Yasmin Elizabeth R. de 37 años de edad reside en el municipio de Apopa ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Yasmin vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos aun menores de edad que actualmente se encuentran estudiando. El esposo de Yasmin aporta mensualmente 200$ para los gastos familiares. Yasmin se dedica la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, viaja en  el transcurso de la semana a diferentes departamentos del país ofreciendo sus productos, Yasmin solicita un crédito para surtir su inventario en ropa.
texts.en:
Yasmin Elizabeth R. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Apopa, located in the San Salvador district. Yasmin lives with her husband and their two dependent children who are students. Yasmin's husband earns $200/month for family expenses.

Yasmin sells clothes as a street vendor. During the week, she travels to different districts throughout the country offering her products. Yasmin is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Regalado

texts.en: Regalado D. started to farm rice when he got married to his wife, Ma. Leah D.. He is the provider in the family and he needs to work to be able to support his three children who are going to school everyday. Regalado needs additional capital on his farm to buy fertilizers, herbicides and to pay the laborer so he is applying for a loan of Php 7,000. He hopes to see that this will improve his yield. CEVI helps small business grow. It provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and to pay the laborer

loans.name: Claire

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92698&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Claire es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Claire es casada tiene 5 hijos de 31, 27, 21,13 y 7 años, los dos últimos están en la edad escolar. 
Claire  no trabaja por que sufre de la presión alta y no puede trabajar, ella ayuda a su esposo con los prestamos el  da el servicio de taxi todo el día.  
El préstamo es de gran ayuda para su familia  por que ellos invierten en el arreglo del carro  es el único ingreso que ellos tienen. 
Claire necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, ellos van a invertir en la compra de una combi para dar movilidad. 
El sueño de Claire es que todo le vaya bien con el servició de movilidad.
texts.en:
Claire is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Village Bank. She is married with five children ages 31, 27, 21, 13, and 7. The two youngest are school-aged. Clare does not work because she suffers from high blood pressure, instead helping her husband with loans since he provides taxi services all day long. The loan is a great help to her family because they will invest it in car repairs, which serves as their only source of income. Claire requests a loan of 1400 soles which they will invest in the purchase of a van to give them mobility. Claire’s dream is that everything goes well with the transportation service. Her previous loan can be found here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92698&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a van

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet Udechkwu is 34 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the town of Warri with her family and makes a living selling second-hand clothes. She has applied for a loan of $650 to buy more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers, and wishes to extend her thanks to all Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto C. C. vive en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento San Salvador. Carlos vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores de edad estudiantes universitarios. El negocio familiar es una librería que hace años, Carlos montó desde su propia casa. El sueno de Carlos siempre fue que sus hijos asistieran a la universidad y recibieran una educación formal, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para ampliar su mercadería, y seguir aportando para la preparación intelectual de sus hijos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Toeung

texts.en:
S. is 28 years old and lives in Banteay Meanchey Province where she earns a living by selling various kinds of fruit in the local market. She is a married woman who is blessed with three children. All three of them are students and dependent on her income. Her husband helps be responsible for the family’s living expenses by driving a taxi.

S. requested a loan to increase the quantity of fruit she sells. She proposes to use some of the loan to repair her husband’s broken taxi.

loans.use: To increase her quantity of fruit and to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprar materiales quirurgicos.

loans.name: Naomi Wambui

texts.en:
Naomi Wambui is 62 years old. She is married and has four children. She is currently in the livestock business; she owns three cows. With this loan, Naomi Wambui will diversify her income by expanding into the grocery business. She will use this loan to purchase various items to sell (tomatoes, potatoes, charcoal, and carrots) as well as construction materials to build a small kiosk to use as her store.

Naomi Wambui is not completely new to micro-credit. She had taken a loan of 5,000 Kenya Shillings from another MFI, but there was an issue of fraud on the credit officer's part and she decided to try another loan with a different organization. Her friend introduced her to KADET, and this will be her first loan with KADET.

Naomi Wambui lives in a very low-income area, where squatters (homeless people) have been given some small plots of land to live. 

One day, Naomi Wambui hopes to have a business that will sufficiently meet her needs.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To start a grocery kiosk to sell tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, and charcoal

loans.name: Esmila

texts.es: La señora Esmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre de 5 hijos, todos ya independientes.Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, pero su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas y lleva ya 15 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Esmila, vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares por su buena sazón y sus ventas le van muy bien,  lo ofrece en las mañanas y en las tardes.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Esmila, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmila s a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón San Roque”, which is located in the District of Sacanche, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother 5 children who are all independent.

Wanting to see her children become professionals capable of earning their own incomes, Esmila decided to start a business. She tells us that she experienced a lot of highs and lows in her life, but the enterprising spirit she has always possessed enabled her to succeed. Esmila started her business selling prepared foods 15 years ago. She sells her meals out of her home, which is equipped for accommodating patrons. Gradually she became well-known among her customers, which consists of neighbors, friends, and relatives. She offers meals in the mornings and afternoons, and her sales have done very well.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Esmila will purchase supplies for her prepared meals such as sacks of rice and sugar, chicken, crates of eggs, bananas by the bunch, packets of noodles and oil by the dozen, as well as cooking utensils. These items will enable her to provide quality service. Esmila still feels she can put in the effort required to continue selling food. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Santos Aída

texts.es: Santos Aída R. B. de 53 años de edad, reside en Armenia, vive junto a sus tres hijos, los cuales trabajan. Ella posee una pupusería cerca de la Unidad de Salud de Armenia, lo cual le beneficia ya que las personas que pasan consulta vienen a comer a su puesto. La señora Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar verduras, carne, bebidas, ya que dentro de sus metas esta ampliar su negocio y hacer un comedor. Santos se destaca por ser una señora muy visionara la cual desea seguir mejorando cada día más para su propio sustento.
texts.en:
Santos Aída R. B., 53, lives in Armenia with her three children. The children work. She has a “pupusa” (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled) stand near the Health Unit of Armenia. The location is beneficial because the people who have appointments come to eat at her stand. Santos is asking for a loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, and drinks. One of her goals is to expand her business and have a restaurant. Santos stands out as being a very visionary woman who wants to keep improving more every day for her own sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and other perishables

loans.name: Amahia

texts.en:
Amahia is 26 years old and is single without children. She mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, she supports her parents in meeting the basic needs of the home.

Amahia hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Amahia is a committed LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to mill into cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO FINISH HER KITCHEN AND INSTALL A FLOOR

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth D. M., tiene la edad de 25 años, está  en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene 3 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Elizabeth también trabaja  desde hace muchos años  en la agricultura (granos básico y café) y también con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years of age, lives with her partner, and has one son who is her greatest priority. He is three years old. She wants a loan to buy cattle, her idea being to have cattle that produce both milk and meat. She wants to keep her livestock properly so that she can get the best possible profit when she sells them. This is not the first time that she has had a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that they have always offered her. Elizabeth has also worked for many years in agriculture (grains and coffee) as well as with livestock. She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and more economic stability in the future, and she hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.en:
Catalina M. is from the village of Cabunga-an in the Clarin municipality. She is 47 years old. Catalina is the group leader of a two-member group offered a loan by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of the fellow group member, in the event the other member is delinquent or defaults.

Catalina is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Catalina owns and operates a business by raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over ten years, and she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Catalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and baby clothes

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en:
Mataniu T. is 44 and married with 6 children (ages 5 - 19).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mataniu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Mataniu needs a loan of WST $2250 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2007, Mataniu joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mataniu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mataniu T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who live in Ta Ou Kang Cheung village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Chanthou S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes.  

Mrs. Chanthou S. is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vi Phan, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they cannot earn enough income. Thus, Mrs. Chanthou S. decided to seek a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding. 

She is a mother of two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a new engine

loans.name: Eung

texts.en: Mr. Eung M., a 35-year-old married father of four school-aged children, lives with his family in Siem Reap Province. He currently owns a medium-sized place in the busy local market where, assisted by his wife, he can earn about $3 a day selling fresh fish and various fruits. Eung M. has been engaged in this sector for years and is very busy as he has many customers who need his products. In order to earn extra income and to make the business more successful, Eung M. is looking for a loan to improve his financial capital.

loans.use: To improve the financial capital of his business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a LAPO client. She is 45 years old, married with 7 children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband works as a security guard to support their home. She cooks and sells cassava dough popularly known as Santana or akpu. She has been in this business for long. Florence is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits to support her home. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 59 años de edad, vive solo en su casa propia, pues sus 5 hijos ya son independientes, quienes alguno de ellos lo ayudan en su trabajo. El trabajo al que se dedica es la construcción, en un principio y hace mucho tiempo empezó esta actividad como aprendiz y con el tiempo aprendió todos lo secretos para hacer una buena edificación. La pasión que le pone a su trabajo lo ha convertido en un buen constructor y por ello se ha ganado el reconocimientos de todos los que lo conocen y también en este rubro, por lo que no le falta contratos. El siempre esta viendo la manera de mejorar su trabajo y sus herramientas, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para comprar algunas herramientas y mejorar la calidad de su trabajo. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará herramientas que le hacen falta para lograr un buen trabajo en la construcción.
texts.en:
Abraham is an enterprising man of 59 years who lives alone in his own home. He has 5 independent children, some of whom help him with his work. He works in construction—he started off as an apprentice a long time ago, and with time he learned all the secrets to making a good building. The passion he puts into his work has made him a good builder and has won him recognition from all who know him, and throughout the region, as he never lacks for contracts. He is always finding ways to improve his work and tools—this is the reason he is requesting this loan, to buy some tools and improve the quality of his work. This is his eighth loan with MFP and he has always demonstrated himself to be very punctual with his repayments. With this loan, he will buy the tools that he needs to do a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su Primer ciclo y están pleno de trabajo de integración y distribución de trabajos ya que además de trabajar de forma independiente en sus actividades quieren organizar trabajaos para contar con un fondo en común para cualquier urgencia del comité.
Se puede hablar de la Sra. Marta S. tiene 50 años con  9 hijos, vende choclo,  frutas y verduras en la zona de San Antonio sale a vender por la tarde con sus hijos.
 Es una señora muy guapa y le gusta lo que hace y agradece por el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación por el crédito que se le otorga.   
Tiene una casa pequeña que desea ampliar, por ende ella pone mucho empeño en su trabajo.
Solita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is currently in its first cycle and is fully occupied with the business of integration and distribution of work. In addition to the members’ independent occupations, the group wants to organize communal work in order to have a communal fund for committee emergencies. Mrs. Marta S. is a good representative. She is 50 years old and has 9 children. She sells corn, fruit and vegetables in the San Antonio district. Every afternoon she goes out to sell along with her children. She is a very courageous woman and she enjoys what she does. She is grateful for the help that the Foundation brings her by granting her a loan. She has a small house that she would like to expand and consequently works with a lot of determination. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy fruit and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, pears, strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, peppers and onions.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene T. is 42 years-old and lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional housing tent. His wife works in the local Vocational Training Center and the two sons attend the middle school in their town.

Bolor-Erdene operates a food retailing business out of a small shop. He started his business in 2004 with a working capital of 100,000 MNT and since then it has increased to 6,000,000 MNT. Over the years Bolor-Erdene has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. His wife always helps him with his business and sells the products as well. His business is very important to him and his family. He says, "My only wish is to enlarge the business and create our own food industry." Bolor-Erdene is a hardworking person. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Jocelyn J. is from the town of Trento. She is married. She has been doing farming duties since she was still a teen. She used to help her parents maintain their farm by making sure it was free of weeds and pests. 

Now that she is married, she farms with her husband. She plants rice crops and sells their harvest to her town's market. They have just finished preparing their land for planting and farm inputs are needed for it. 

She applied for a loan from CEVI, where she is a member. She asked for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos that she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will truly help her have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Addah

texts.en:
Addah A. O. is forty years old and is married with two children aged thirteen years and ten years old. Addah’s business is located at Kiandutu, a very busy market in Thika which is the region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples.

Addah makes clothes at her tailoring shop and sells them to local customers. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers; hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Addah is using her Kes 50,000 loan to buy another sewing machine and more materials for making clothes to grow her business and be able to serve her customers more efficiently.

In future, Addah sees herself going back to college to get more training on tailoring and dressmaking, opening her own training school, and having a big boutique in the central business district of Thika. She describes herself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
María de 51 años, ella es comerciante informal de ropa y zapatos, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil y si tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad. 

Para poder mantener a su familia ya que no esta casada tuvo que comenzar a trabajar como comerciante informal de ropa, viejo primero a Colombia porque la ropa es mas barata que en Ecuador y comenzó a venderla a sus vecinos y conocidos, poco a poco ha ido viajando a Colombia comprando y vendiendo. Vende camisas, zapatos, pantalones etc. 

Para continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo zapatos, blusas y pantalones. Ella quiere en un futuro tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and works selling clothing and shoes. She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil and has grown children. To maintain her family (as she is no longer married), she had to begin working selling clothing. She bought it from Colombia because clothing is cheaper there than in Ecuador and she began to sell to her neighbors and acquaintances. Little by little she began to travel to Colombia more frequently to buy and sell. She sells shirts, shoes, pants, etc.

To continue with her business she wants a loan to buy shoes, blouses and pants. In the future, she wants to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes, clothing

loans.name: Richard William

texts.es:
El solicitante es soltero, tiene un hijo en edad escolar al cual le brinda una pensión mensual. Vive en casa familiar y cuenta con un auto tico el cual lo conduce él mismo. El préstamo lo requiere para la poder asi adquirir una radio y poder afiliarse a una empresa de taxis. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en la labor que desempeña.
texts.en:
The loan requester is single and has a son who goes to a school which requires monthly fees. He lives in a house with family and has a Costa Rican car which he drives himself. He wants the loan to be able to buy a radio so he can join a taxi company. He has good personal references. He is a very hardworking person and does his job responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Marielin

texts.en:
Marielin C. is from the village of Panalsalan.  She is 30 years old.  Marielin is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Marielin owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marielin has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marielin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marielin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marielin from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cotton, cloth and quilt sewing needles.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El Sr. Samuel  nacido en Santa Cruz soltero agricultor de 24 años hijo del  Isaac por falta de recursos económicos el dejo de estudiar ya que no contaba tampoco con el apoyo de sus Padres y se dedico a la agricultura el trabaja juntamente con su hermano el señor Limber, ellos siembran maíz, maní y yuca y también se dedican a sacar madera para leñas carpintería, y hacen carbón en tiempo que no se puede sembrar pero mas se dedican a la agricultura, el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra de semillas para la siembra de sus productos, después lo comercializan en el mercado de la localidad de el Torno.  Ellos viven a 10 Km de Santa. Rita hacia el naciente, ellos viven y tienen su casa en su propia parcela.
texts.en:
Samuel, 24, is a single farmer who was born in Santa Cruz; he is Isaac’s son.  

For lack of economic resources he had to drop out of school because he didn’t have support from his parents.  He decided to go into farming and he works alongside his brother, Limber.  They plant corn, peanuts and manioc.  They also extract lumber to be used in carpentry and they make charcoal during seasons that planting is impossible.  But their main focus is on agriculture.

The money from the loan will be used to buy seed for their crops.  The crops are then sold in El Torno’s market.  They live 10 kilometers east of Santa Rita.  They own and live in their house on their own piece of property.

loans.use: For slash and burn field preparation and to plant corn.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, none of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).    

Mary has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Mary sells her products at the market, wholesale and retail.    Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     

The main business challenges for Mary include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to start selling wholesale only.    

Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
