Roxana; tiene 31 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza de una empresa llamada Unique, ella vende en forma independiente y por medio de este negocio puede pagar sus estudios, la socia quiere una tienda para que pueda vender los productos de belleza. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Roxana belongs to the “Mosoc Runa” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Roxana is 31 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products from a company called Unique.  She sells independently and is using the income from her business to pay for her studies.  She would like to have a store where she could sell her beauty products.  She is requesting a loan to buy beauty products wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy beauty products wholesale

loans.name: Freda

texts.es: La Sra. Freda vive en la localidad D. el Torno distante a 39 km D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz , es nacida en el departamento D. Potosí, hace uno 30 años que se vino a vivir al departamento, buscando días mejores y nuevas oportunidades D. trabajo, es viuda hace unos diez años, su actividad es la venta D. verduras, como cebolla, zanahoria, tomate por caja, etc. VenD. en el mercado central, el destino del crédito es para aumentar su mercadería ya que, por fiestas D. fin D. año el negocio tienD. a estar en su mejor nivel, tiene tres hijos D. los cuales ya todos son independientes, la Sra. Freda esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Freda lives in the town of El Torno, which is located 39km from the city of Santa Cruz. She was born in the Department of Potosí. Freda moved to this department thirty years ago in search of better days and new job opportunities. She has been widowed for approximately ten years.

Freda sells vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes, and other types of produce by the case. Her business is located at the central market. This loan will be used to increase her inventory of merchandise for the year-end holidays when the level of her business is at its best. Freda has three children, all of whom are independent. She is very grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: Acquire more produce

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rock and oil to resell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Marciana G. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Marciana, 56, has a high school education and is married to Ceferino, a bouncer. They are raising one child who is in high school. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Marciana presently runs a direct selling business. Products range from household detergents, cosmetics, apparel and footwear, among others. Having been at least two years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most importantly, her customers. Monthly she is able to earn an average of Php5,000.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her direct selling business and other items ordered in advance by her customers all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.

Marciana's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: items ordered in advance by her customers on her direct selling business

loans.name: Vân

texts.en: Vân N. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of the Kompong Cham province. Since 1979, she has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Her husband, Thim Than, is a 50-year-old farmer who helps her in the same business, and the daily revenue which he can make is about $1 a day. This is the time for preparing the dry-season rice-field, but her old cow is not able to help with the plowing process. So Vân N. has decided to ask for a Kiva loan to buy a new cow in order to replace the old one. With the remainder of the funds she will plant peanuts.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the old one, and to plant peanuts.

loans.name: John Njigua

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. He is 32 years old, married to Grace Wangui and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He has serviced all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilser and potato seedlings for planting.

In future, John hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Juana Alcira

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Juana después de hacer sus actividades del hogar  se dedica a confección artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde hace tallado de madera y después vende sus productos en las ferias artesanales. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar madera para el tallado de su artesanía. 

Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, has three children.  She was born in Cusco, Perú.  After doing her household chores, Juana makes crafts.  She has a small workshop in her house where she carves wood.  She then sells her items at artisanal markets.  She’s been in this occupation for 25 years now and does quite well.  Juana needs the loan to buy wood to carve into crafts.

Juana is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and pledges, at the same time, to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood for her crafts.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Namnama, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase purchase fertilizers such as manure. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will again be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa A. sells provisions, including snacks and soaps, amongst other things. She’s been running this business for two years now, at Jukwa, near Abura, Cape Coast. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children. With her earnings, she helps pay for the household expenses. She plans to expand her business by growing the sales of provisions. Her loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of goods, which she buys from Takoradi, a town about a couple of hours away. She plans to save up the extra proftts she earns from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of goods to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hard-working woman who, through a lot of hard work and commitment, has been able to set up her own business. She runs a shop where she sells such household goods as maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, and detergents. She began this business ten years ago and has worked hard over the years to make it financially stable. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day. 

In order to continue selling her products and satisfy her customers' needs, she intends to use her loan to buy items such as bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, and sugar to stock in her shop. 

In the future, she would like to operate as a wholesale business and to increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy items such as bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, and sugar to stock in her shop

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza  1 Group

texts.en:
Eusebia is the coordinator of her group Union con Esperanza 1 (Union with Esperanza). Her story is not unlike others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican community, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. 

Eusebia's group is located in Puerto Plata, a city on the north coast where the economy is based around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple setting, with her three children. She is a widowed woman.

Eusebia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling accessories at her beauty salon. She will be buying hair and beauty products and some accessories like jewellery. She will use the profits to save. Her most difficult challenges are to overcome from her husband's death and to raise her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products, and Accessories.

loans.name: Mee Group

texts.en:
Elita C., 37, operates a retail business that sells groceries in Gweru where she lives. She has applied for this loan through MicroKing for the purposes of increasing her stock levels by buying sugar, rice, bread, soap, etc. 

Elita and her husband are both teachers and get their supplementary income from their teaching professions. They have two children aged 13 and 10, both attending school. Elita has been running the business for the past 10 years and she employs one person. 

She faces some transportation challenges on deliveries as well as competition. Low stock levels are a cause of concern for her and she hopes that the capital injection will assist on increasing the stock levels. She envisions herself operating from her own shop premises and diversifying into selling electrical goods. 

Note: In the photo, the lady seated is Elita.

loans.use: to increase her grocery shop stock levels

loans.name: Ayebi

texts.en: Ayebi A. is married to a farmer and they have two children. Ayebi helps pay for the children’s school fees and the utility bills, using her income from her provision stall business, which she has run for eight years. She sells items such as rice, sugar, condensed milk and slippers. She is keen to add more items to her shop to cater to her customers needs. A Kiva loan will allow her to purchase more slippers and more varieties of food items. She hopes that this larger selection will also help attract new customers to her shop. Any additional profits she earns will be reinvested into her shop to grow it further.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and more varieties of food items.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old, married and has a seven-year-old child. She want into business as a tailor in 2005 and helps support her family by working seven days a week, eight hours a day. She has already repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy raw materials for her tailoring business, which she would like to expand. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, where Sarita lives, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line streets and store owners sell material and use their sewing machines to turn those purchases into garments. The items which are in highest demand are school uniforms for children and the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. BPW borrowers use Kiva loans to buy cloth and/or sewing machines that will increase their productivity and profitability. 

This loan will be administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, the Patan Business and Professional Women. In 2007, Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal and now operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. Patan BPW also seeks to empower Nepali women within their homes and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a tailoring business

loans.name: Oumran

texts.en:
Oumran, 25, is a single man who has been working in tile polishing for eight years. He also transports water, in addition to driving agricultural transport.

Oumran has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for three cycles. He is in good standing as a borrower, a hard worker and a man with a good reputation. In order to keep up his work, Oumran has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy the necessary tools and hardware for his tile polishing machine. This hardware will help improve his quality of work in a short period of time. Oumran is also seeking to finish pasting tiles and installing aluminum windows in his own house, which he is currently building to be his home. He needs to expand his business tools in order to cover more project requests.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and hardware for his tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 40 years old and is married with 2 children aged 15 and 12. He runs a building material store in Kissy, a neighborhood in Freetown.

Ali has been in this business for 10 years and sells paints, cement, nails and brushes at his store. He also earns income from another business (taxi transport). He says that the main challenge to his business is inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cement, saws, binding wire, metal pans and nails. Ali says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to build big shops and make his business well-established.

loans.use: To purchases more cement, saws, binding wire and metal pans

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly has been running a human resource consultancy firm for the last 21 years. He supplements this income from earnings of his rental houses. He is a patient, hardworking and time-conscious 46-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children, ages 15 and 8.

In the next five years, he wants to have expanded his business and to employ several employees to handle the expanding clientele. His dream is to own a college that teaches business management and human resources. He wants 95,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stationery and for advertising his business.

loans.use: to buy stationery and for advertising his business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and married, with 2 children, 8 months and 3 years old. He has no other dependents. He and his family live in a mud wattle house in Kibaale, Uganda.

Emmanuel has been selling cereals for four years and has been able to use the business proceeds to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. Emmanuel faces a challenge of price fluctuations for produce. His dream is to buy a motorcycle and set up a food store. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, es una mujer tímida pero trabajadora de, 32 años; junto a su esposo Hernán, cuidan de sus 2 hijos: Hilder y Melina, en armonía ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de arveja, habas, papa, flor y maíz, ya tiene 12 años de experiencia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cortar las flores de papa, ya que es señal de una pronta cosecha. La dedicación que le brinda a sus terrenos agrícolas le permiten obtener buenas ganancias en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, lugar donde comercializa su cosecha; pero las flores de gladiolo los vende en el mercado central de la capital del país. Sus planes son sembrar flor de gladiolo y mantener en buenas condiciones su plantación de habas para que le proporcione buenos frutos en la temporada de cosecha. Además de tener sembríos de maíz que comenzará a dar fruto en los primeros meses del año que viene, así asegura su ganancia por temporadas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde obtiene buenas experiencias para la mejora de sus sembríos. Por eso espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir con su progreso. Haydee de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja y 5 bolsas de fertilizantes naturales para su cultivos de maíz que sembró hace un mes.
texts.en:
Haydee, age 32, is a shy but hardworking woman. She and her husband Hernán take care of their two children, Hilder and Melina, and live in harmony in their own home in the village of Patay. Haydee engages in farming. Her main crops consist of peas, beans, potatoes, flowers, and corn. She has 12 years of experience. What she enjoys most about her work is trimming the potato flowers since it signals that the harvest is approaching. Her dedication to her land allows her to generate good earnings at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where she sells her harvest. However, she sells gladiola flowers at the central market in Lima. Her plans are to plant gladiola flowers and maintain good conditions for planting beans so that she can produce good output at harvest time. In addition, she has crops of corn that will bear fruit during the first few months of the upcoming year, which will secure her seasonal income.

Haydee belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Picaflores de Patay” and is receiving her eighth loan from MFP, which has provided her good experiences that have helped to improve her crops. With everyone’s support, she hopes to continue her progress. By obtaining assistance, Haydee will invest the money she requested in a bag of pea seeds and five sacks of natural fertilizers for the crop of corn that she planted a month ago.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds and five sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Fredy Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy es soltero, vive con su padre y hermana a los cuales apoya económicamente, su principal ingreso es dedicarse al transporte urbano en su moto taxi, se dedico a esta actividad, puesto que su madre le regaló la moto antes de fallecer y así poder apoyarlo, trabaja todo el día por el cercado de la ciudad de Ica. El préstamo lo va a invertir para hacer mantenimiento total a su moto y colocarle techo de fibra de vidrio y así poder dar un mejor servicio, su sueño es comprarse un auto y poder brindar el servicio de taxi. El Sr. Fredy está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Fredy is single, lives with his father and sister, both of whom he financially supports.  His main income is from providing urban transport in his mototaxi (small vehicle pictured above).  He has worked in this business since his mother gave him the moto before she died and has been able to support it.  He works everyday in the outskirts of the city of Ica.  He is going to use the loan to invest in the total maintenance of his moto and to install a fiberglass roof, in order to offer better service.  His dream is to purchase a car and be able to provide a taxi service.

Fredy is very grateful for the loan being offered.

loans.use: to provide routine maintenance for his mototaxi

loans.name: Aramat

texts.en:
Aramat has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 42 years old and is married. They are blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his second loan. He has been loaned KES 50,000, and he plans to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. 

With the anticipated profit made he wants to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dream is  to be the best and best-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Marsylyn

texts.en:
Marsylyn is a hardworking businesswoman, age 25. She is married and blessed with three children. 

For the last three years, she has been managing a salon to support the family. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair chemicals and a hair drier. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and a hair drier.

loans.name: Quenia Mercedes

texts.es:
Quenia, es originaria de una comarca llamada Las Marías, ubicada en León, ella tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, es comerciante se dedica a vender y elaborar tortillas, lleva 1 años y medio con  este negocio. Anteriormente vendía cuajadas, frijoles cocidos y leña. También trabajo como domestica  pero decidió tener un negocio propio que le permitiera pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. Ella dice que con la experiencia que ha adquirido durante estos años le han permitido sobrevivir de su negocio ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar y solventar parte de los gastos de su hogar. 
Realizo el préstamo para comprar materia prima como maíz, leña y cal para elaborar sus tortillas. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir más fácilmente la materia prima que necesita, podrá producir un poco más y mejorar sus ingresos. Dentro de sus metas nos dice que ella quiere poner una pulpería, hacerle reparaciones a su cocina que es donde elabora sus tortillas, también mejorar el resto de la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Quenia is originally from a district called Las Marías which is located in León.  She is 39 years old and the mother of four children.  She is a saleswoman whose business is making and selling tortillas.  She has been in this business for one and a half years.  She used to sell curd, baked beans and firewood.  She also worked as a maid but decided to set up her own business which would allow her to spend more time with her children.  She says that the experience she has gained over the years has enabled her to survive in her business, help her children study and cover some of her household expences.

Quenia requested this loan to buy raw materials such as corn, firewood and lime with which to make her tortillas.  This investment will enable her to acquire the raw materials she needs more easily.  This means she will be able to produce more and improve her income.  She tells us that some of her goals are to set up a grocery store, to make some repairs to the kitchen where she makes her tortillas and to improve the rest of the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, firewood and lime for making her tortillas

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon (in the photo) and her husband, Sopheap, have been married since 2003. They have three children- one son and two daughters. The family is living in a village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Mon is a rice farmer. Her husband is a mason; he also assists in his wife’s farming business. Mon is asking for loan of 500 USD to build the fence around her house.

loans.use: To build the fence around her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking business woman, age 29. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been selling cereals for the last five years to make a living. She also does farming for more income. Mary has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. 

In the next 5 years, Mary wants to buy a lorry for transporting cereals. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy beans, maize, and peas for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 24 years old with two children living in Phu Man village. Her husband is a carpenter. Therefore, they opened a wood workshop to make wooden furniture in 2006. Through a neighbor, she learned about SEDA's credit program in 2009 and obtaining more capital to expand her workshop. She can achieve 4,000,000 VND of profit from this kind of business.  Regarding her last loan, she received 6,944,000 VND that she used for maintaining her cutting machine. To meet more and more orders from her customers, she hopes to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more wood.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Rafayil

texts.en: Rafayil is only 23 years old, but already has 10 years of experience in cattle breeding. From a very young age, he helped his father look after their herd of cattle by taking them out to pasture and making sure that they were fed. Now he has his own herd and earns an income of 300 AZN a month. He would like to expand his business so that he can one day build his own house. To make that possible, he is applying for a loan for 1,100 AZN to buy three new cows and fodder for them to eat.

loans.use: to buy three cows and fodder for them to eat.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from the village of Ozamis City. She is 43 years old. Lilia is married with five children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoos, candies, diapers, etc in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Lilia is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan, 52, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

Kan and her husband are farmers. Kan is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to reduce how much they spend on public transport. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 43 ans, celibataire avec 5 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 7 et 24 ans, elle se lance dans l'alimentation il y'a de cela 20 ans quand elle se sépare avec son mari, et elle se sent abandonne avec une lourde responsabilité de s'occuper de ses enfants.

Ayant deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêts de Hope, elle a assure les frais d'écolage de ses enfants, elle a épargne avec succès et a rembourse sans difficultés, sa vie sociale et économique a entièrement changée.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en ajoutant des cartons de tomates pelées, des cartons de cassoulets, des cartons de macédoines, petits pois et toutes les articles qui attirent les clients.
A l'avenir elle est entrain de continuer a épargner et avec ses benefices elle veut construire une boutique pour laisser l'étalage du marche et tient fermement a amener ses enfants a faire des longues etudes.
texts.en:
This client is forty-three years old, single, and has five children between the ages of seven and 24 in her care. She began in the food business 20 years ago when she and her husband separated and she was abandoned with the great responsibility of taking care of her children.

She has already benefited from several HOPE loans.  She has been able to pay for her children's education, to successfully save money and payback loans without difficulty.  Her social and economic life has completely changed.

With this new loan she will increase the stock of her merchandise by adding boxes of peeled tomatoes, cassoulet [meat and bean stew], fruit and vegetable salads, peas, and all the items that attract clients. 

In the future she will continue to save money and with her profits she would like to build a shop so she can move from her stall at the market. She believes strongly in encouraging her children stay in school a long time.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods such as peeled tomatoes, fruit and vegetable salads, sweetcorn, and dried sausages.

loans.name: Godinez Group

texts.es:
La señora Asucena es casada. tiene, 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía a la elaboración de canastillas de plásticos de diferentes diseños y tamaños, inició este negocio con un poco de capital y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales consistente en cintas de plástico, y producir mas canastas,es el futuro desea ver su negocio convertido en una fabrica de canastas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica al comercio, la artesanía y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Asucena is married, 59 years of age, and never had an opportunity to study. She has 6 children, 3 of whom are studying. Asucena is an artisan who makes plastic baskets of different designs and sizes. She began this business with little capital and up to the present, she has 6 years of experience.

Asucena is requesting a loan to purchase ribbons of plastic to be used in producing more baskets. Her future desire is to see her business converted into a basket factory. The remaining members of the group are involved in commerce, artisan crafts, and raising domestic animals.

loans.use: buy materials for making baskets to sell.

loans.name: Amude

texts.en: Amude is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Amude is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es:
Don Santos es originario de Telica municipio de León, es  casado, tiene 2 hijos. El es comerciante tiene una vulcanización y también  es dueño de  una barbería. El comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven el recuerda que su primer negocio fue reparación de bicicletas   después aprendió el oficio de la barbería  y de ultimo adquirió experiencia en un taller de vulcanización.   
El realizo el crédito para comprar repuestos de bicicletas y artículos para la barbería. Pues son herramientas y artículos muy necesarios para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. 
Una de sus expectativas poner un taller de reparación de zapatos  y brindándole servicios de mucha utilidad y necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is from Telica in the municipality of León. He is married and has two children. He is a businessman with a tire repair shop. He is also the owner of a barber shop. He began working when he was very young. He remembers that his first business was in bicycle repairs. Later he learned the barber business and most recently he has acquired experience in a tire repair shop.

He requested this loan to purchase bicycle parts and items for a barber shop. These are very necessary tools and items for the functioning of his business. 

One of his hopes is to start his own shoe repair shop and offer much needed and useful services to his community.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts and items for a barber shop.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Pachacutec Group

texts.es:
Lesly es una mujer emprendedora,madre de dos hijos pequeños de 10 y 5 años de edad con quienes vive desde que se separó de su esposo,se dedica desde hace tres años al alquiler de habitaciones de su vivienda donde sus principales clientes son familiares de sus vecinos recomendados ya que no puede confiar en desconocidos por temor de sus pequeños,el préstamos que solicitó lo va a invertir en la ampliación de su vivienda y modificación de desagüe para brindar mejor servicio a los inquilinos,Lesly se siente feliz de poder contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas Kiva ya que el préstamo la ayudará a dar mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
"Gracias Kiva prometo no defraudarlos
texts.en:
Lesly is an entrepreneurial woman and the mother of two small children aged 10 and 5 whom she now lives with since separating from her husband. She has worked for three years renting out rooms in her home. Her main clients are recommended family members of her neighbors since she cannot trust unfamiliar people out of fear for her small children.

She is asking for a loan to invest in the expansion of her home and the modification of the drainage system to provide better services to the tenants. Lesly is happy to be able to rely on the help of Kiva lenders. The loan will help her provide a better quality of life for her small children. “Thank you Kiva, I promise not to disappoint you.”

loans.use: to improve her home and modify the drainage system.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is an enthusiastic young person who is from Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Since he was a child, he needed to help his grandmother who he lives with. He began to sell candies on the buses of the city and, in 2000, Alejandro and his grandmother created a small store called “PALETERIA ALEX”.

In May of 2001, with great effort, he saved a little money and invested in another business of custom jewelry sales while his grandmother took care of “Paletería Alex” in the morning.

Alejandro needs a loan for US$1,200 American Dollars, payable in 6 months, to provide merchandise in the “Paletería" and also to invest in more varieties of custom jewelry to allow him to help grow his business with his grandmother.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Alejandro es un joven entusiasta originario de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, que desde muy pequeño se vio en la necesidad de ayudar a su abuelita que es con quien vive, inicio vendiendo paletas en los camiones y en el año 2000 entre el y su abuelita pusieron una “Paletería ALEX”. En mayo del 2001 con lo que pudieron ahorrar pudo obtener un pequeño capital para invertir y así inicio otro negocio de venta de joyería de fantasía, mientras su abuelita en las mañanas continua atendiendo la “Paletería Alex”. Alejandro esta solicitando un crédito de US$ 1,200Dólares americanos a 6 meses para surtir la peletería y tener más variedad en joyería de fantasía para así sacar adelante a su abuelita.

loans.use: Purchase custom jewelry and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy dairy feed and other dairy supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new mototaxi

loans.name: Uju

texts.en: Mrs. Uju I. owns and operates a small mini-store in her area, selling drinks and snacks to her community. She is 48 years old and married with five children. She feels sure that she can increase her business turnover and care for her children better with a loan of US$ 400 as added capital.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more inventory for her shoe business

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery is 22 years old. She left her native pueblo of Moho about 5 years ago with many dreams and expectations to triumph in life. She now lives in Juliaca along with her aunt Mauricia, from whom she learned the business of dealing in firewood, work which she carries out diligently to generate income so she can be able to cover the expenses she incurs in her studies in clothing manufacture and to give help to he dear younger brother Julio. Rosmery's aspiration is to own her own clothing workshop, a labour which she is now preparing herself for in a technical university where she hopes to effectively develop her progressive bent. But at the moment she wants to increase her stock in wood to generate better economic returns so she can bring the possibility to realize her dreams closer each day. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan of $275 and promises to return it after a span of 6 months. "We can help this young woman to make her dreams reality."

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Rosmery tiene 22 años, salió de su pueblo natal Moho hace aproximadamente 5 con muchas ilusiones y expectativas de triunfar en la vida, actualmente radica en Juliaca junto a su tía Mauricia, de quien aprendió la labor de comercialización de leña, trabajo que desempeña diligentemente para generar sus ingresos económicos y así cubrir los gastos que le ocasionan seguir sus estudios de confección de prendas de vestir y al mismo tiempo apoyar económicamente a su querido hermano menor Julio.La aspiración de Rosmery es poseer su taller de confección, labor por la cual actualmente se prepara en un instituto técnico, en donde más adelante espera desenvolverse eficazmente; pero por el momento desea aumentar la cantidad de sus artículos para generar mayor beneficio económico y ver cada día más cercano la posibilidad de hacer realidad sus sueños, para esto solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares y promete rembolsarles en un lapso de 6 meses.“Nosotros podemos ayudar a esta joven muchacha a hacer realidad sus sueños”

loans.use: Purchase of firewood to increase sales and continue her studies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia and her husband had many dreams of living in a warm united home, with a lot of family love; they had three children as a result of the love they shared. Sonia’s husband had to travel on business to a cement fabric. With huge sorrow Sonia has to work very hard in different activities always taking care of her little ones so she could provide for the everyday expenses of her family. Sonia sells her vegetables at the local market and she administers the family vehicle which helps them raise her family’s quality of life. Now she has a small oil (fuel) shop and she wishes to keep prospering with her little children. She will use the loan to repair her vehicle and get the necessary things for this purpose. This hardworking family is awaiting your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Sonia y su esposo formaron su hogar con muchas ilusiones de vivir en un ambiente cálido y sobre todo en unión y amor familiar, fruto de esa concepción y el inmenso amor que se tienen nacieron tres hijos. Sin embargo en este ambiente su esposo tuvo que viajar para trabajar en una fábrica de cemento. Con esta inmensa pena Sonia tuvo que trabajar arduamente en diferentes actividades siempre acompañado de sus pequeños, para así generar el sustento diario, es por ello que vende verduras en su localidad y administra adecuadamente su vehículo con el cual ha ayudado a incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia.Ahora junto a sus hijitos desea seguir prosperando a través de su pequeño negocio de venta de petróleo y para esto está solicitando un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá reparar su vehiculo y adquirir lo necesario para lograr este propósito.Esta familia luchadora espera anhelantemente vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para invertirlos en la consolidación de un nuevo negocio.

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
Marilú is a very selfless and hard-working woman, who since her childhood has appreciated the imperative value that work has in the lives of all of us. More so now because of the weight of her family’s expenses on her and because of her partner’s abandonment. Despite her situation, she continues to strive with that same diligent spirit, but her family’s financial situation is not the most favorable and her greatest support is the small grocery store she owns and which she tends to fervently. Because of this, her greatest wish is to buy another refrigerator (which offers her extensive support in the sale of cold drinks), due to the fact that it has not been functioning properly lately and has brought about a diminishing income. For this reason, she wishes to purchase a small refrigerator or freezer to continue offering her community cold drinks being that they have a very warm climate. You can collaborate with Marilú and contribute to the accomplishment of her goals with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Marilú, es una dama muy abnegada y trabajadora que desde su niñez ha apreciado el valor imprescindible que tiene el trabajo en la vida de cada una de las personas, y ahora aún más por la carga familiar que afronta y por el abandono de su pareja, a pesar de estos hechos sigue conservando ese mismo espíritu diligente pero la situación económica que afronta su familia no es la más favorable y su gran ayuda es la pequeña bodega que posee en la que se desempeña fervientemente. Raíz de este hecho posee el inmenso anhelo de cambiar su refrigeradora que tanto apoyo le otorga en la venta de bebidas heladas debido a que en estos últimos días ha estado fallando y ha traído consigo la disminución de sus ingresos, es por ello que desea comprarse una pequeña refrigeradora o congeladora para seguir ofreciendo bebidas heladas a su comunidad por ser un lugar muy caluroso.Vosotros podéis contribuir con Marilu para el logro de sus planes a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a small refrigerator or freezer.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en: Cruz is forty-three years old and sells an assortment of beauty and hair products to women of Hortaliza, a community of Santo Domingo.  She has six children, four of them boys, all of whom attend school.  Cruz says that she doesn’t have a fixed inventory, and instead she takes a flexible approach, purchasing items according to the demand of her customers.  After one year of operation, the entrepreneur is still running business from her home.  She plans on using her loan to rent a small shop in the community so that customers can get the products at ease in a comfortable atmosphere.  Cruz hopes to become the most well known and visited supplier of cosmetics in her neighbourhood.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona is a traveling saleswoman who sells spices (garlic, oregano, whole chiles, etc.) from province to province. Her husband provides DJ services at social events. These two activities make up their main sources of income with which they support their three children. Their home is located in the Villa Esperanza zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan Simona is requesting will be used to buy equipment for the DJ business, specifically a sound mixer which will help improve performance so they can offer better service to their customers.

This is her fourth loan with IMPRO; her prior record allows her to be approved for this request. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and has paid off her previous loans without any problem.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglsi, Kiva volunteer.

Simona es comerciante viajera interprovincial de condimentos (ajo, orégano, ají entero, etc.) el esposo presta servicio de amplificación y ameniza todo tipo de eventos sociales. Estas dos actividades constituyen sus principales fuentes de ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de ellos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que Simona solicita será utilizado para compra de equipo para el servicio de amplificación, específicamente una mezcladora de sonido, la misma que ayudara para el mejor rendimiento de la amplificación y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por la prestataria. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005 y ha cancelados sus previos préstamos sin ninguna dificultad.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her husband's DJ business.

loans.name: Koboté

texts.fr:
Mrs. Koboté K. was born in 1967 in Sotouboua. She is married and the mother of three children. Her primary business is the sale of everyday consumables such as milk, tomatoes, wine, pasta, couscous, eggs, etc. Since she is the only one in the Agoè Démakpoè neighborhood where she lives who sells such necessities, she makes a good income which allows her to contribute to the family's living expenses.

This first loan that she is requesting in the amount of US$ 1025 will permit her to purchase twenty bags of rice and 25 tins of vegetable oil which she intends to sell wholesale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Koboté est née en 1967 à Sotouboua. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de consommation courante tels que : le lait, la tomate, le vin, les pâtes alimentaires, le couscous, l’œuf etc. Etant donné qu’elle est la seule à vendre ces produits dans le quartier d’Agoè Démakpoè, elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfice ce qui lui permet de participer aux dépenses de la famille. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 420.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter vingt sacs de riz et vingt cinq bidons d’huile végétale qu’elle revend en gros.

loans.use:
Expand her inventory of rice and oil to sell wholesale

Augmenter son stock de riz et d'huile

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jeans, sweaters, active wear, sports shoes, coats, etc.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Hanifa T.. She is married and has two children, aged 7 and 18. In 2003, Hanifa opened a combined bar and general store. Now she is applying for a loan to buy additional supplies of beer, soda, water, rice and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of beer, soft drinks, water, rice and soap in bulk.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kadiatou C., 33, is the mother of one child. She is currently getting a divorce so is living with her parents in the Koko district of Koutiala, Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali.

She began to work to earn her living at a very young age since she was not able to continue her studies. Her principal business is selling firewood which she buys from peasants (who supply the city of Koutiala) who have wood-cutting permits. She has a place to store the wood across from her parents' house and she generally retails the wood to a mixed clientele (men and women).

Very experienced in economic matters, she is on her eighth loan with the Microfinance Institution SORO YIRIWASO. All loans were reimbursed appropriately. With this loan, she expects to have a profit of around US$ 280 per month which she will use to make the payments on the loan, support herself and her son, and especially bolster her capital.

Mrs. Kadiatou C. intends in future to get more value from her lot that is designated for housing by putting up a building on it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Kadiatou C. a 33 ans, mère d’un enfant (en instance de divorce) ; vit actuellement chez ses parents au quartier koko de Koutiala Région de Sikasso République du Mali.

Elle a commencé les activités génératrices de revenus dès le bas âge parce qu’elle n’a pas pu continuer les études. Son activité principale est la vente du bois de chauffe, qu’elle achète avec les paysans (ravitaillant la ville de Koutiala) et qui détiennent des permis de coupe de bois. Elle dispose d’un lieu de stockage en face de la maison paternelle et vend généralement le bois en détail à une clientèle variée (Femmes et hommes).

Très expérimentée dans les activités économiques, elle est à huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance SORO YIRIWASO avec un remboursement correct. Elle envisage de réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA. qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir à ses propres besoins (ceux de son garçon) et surtout renforcer son capital.

Madame Kadiatou C. compte dans le futur mettre en valeur son lot à usage d’habitation en y construisant un bâtiment. x

loans.use:
Purchase of firewood for re-sale

Achat de bois de chauffe

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes belongs to the Andres Santa Cruz de Chuachua community bank, district of Zepita, province of Chucuito – Juli and region of Puno. She is 35 years old, and has a son and a daughter that depend on her. She finished grade 5. Maria decided to invest the first loan of $115 USD (S/.300) in the purchase of five lambs, but this business generated little profit.

Currently, she has a general store that she was able to implement thanks to the loans provided by the community bank. With the next loan of $600 USD (S/.1,700) which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a small bull and will invest the rest in a sack of rice, a sack of sugar and a bag of pasta; with the purpose to obtain more income.

Maria Mercedes works in the store in the mornings and afternoons. During the day she also takes care of her cattle and small farm. She is very happy because she is making it on her own but with the support of her oldest daughter and husband; he can’t work because he has been sick for the past 7 months.

Her dream is to have a fully supplied store in a central town and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua, del distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito - Juli y Región de Puno. Tiene 35 años de edad, madre de una hija y un hijo que aun depende de ella, su estudio alcanzado es quinto de primaria. María con el inicialmente accedió a un préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, decidió invertir en la compra de cinco ovejas criollas para el engorde y este negocio genero poca ganancia.

Actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, este pudo implementar gracias a los créditos que recibió del Banco Comunal. Por eso con este préstamo siguiente de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un toro pequeño y las demás invertirá en compra de un saco de Arroz, un saco de azúcar, una bolsa de fideos, para tener más ingresos económicos.

María Mercedes se dedica a vender en su tienda por las mañanas y tardes, y de día cuida sus ganados y hace su chacra, ella se siente muy contenta porque sola esta sobresaliendo adelante con el apoyo de su hija mayor, y su esposo ya que el no puede trabajar porque está mal de salud hace 7 meses.

Su sueño es equipar su tienda de abarrotes en el Centro Poblado y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store and a bull.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Mrs. Yom T. is a 58-year-old farmer, earning approximately $0.50 per day while her husband, Mr. Chan Phok, is a 51-year-old construction worker. She has three children, one is married, and one is a garment worker in Phnom Penh Municipal and another one sells sugar cane juice in Koktlok Krom Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income, Mrs. Yom requests a loan of $400 to purchase one more machine to crush sugar cane for making juice. The loan will allow her to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for crushing sugar cane to make sugar cane juice to sell

loans.name: Asha's Riziki Haigawanyi Group

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years and she is single. She is a bites (maandazi and bread) seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 11am at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Asha isow looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, painting, juice sales, charcoal sales, bites, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Mrs. Nop L. is a farmer in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province. Nop is 55 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is attending the local school and the last one stays at home to do housework. Her husband, Mr. Toem Rith, helps her in their plantation. Aside from this, he is also a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Nop would like to purchase five more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay N., 58, is a widow and lives with eight children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She stays at home doing the house work and cooking for her family members. There is one child who has a business charging batteries. People who live in her village mostly depend on their batteries to power lighting, TV and radio. Another child is a rice miller and another makes rice wine.

Lay N. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a new generator for one of her children who has the business charging batteries.

loans.use: To purchase a new generator.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad N. is a 20-year-old enthusiastic and ambitious young man who is already the owner of a small store. He finished studies in the economics faculty but after graduating, it was very difficult to find a job in the area he lives. He borrowed money from his father and purchased some cosmetics inventory.

Elshad rents a small grocery store in the center of the town, very close to the central bazaar. He has many clients because his grocery products are cheap. He has a wish to build his own store but needs a lot of money for it. He wants to borrow money and use it in his business to make more profit. He will start saving money from his profits and hopes that soon he will be able to start building his own store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Kuy Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Kuy Seng H. is a villager in Ang Tapok village in Kampong Speu province. He is a wedding chef who gets hired for wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy cooking equipment for his business. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy all kinds of cooking equipment for his purpose. His wife, Mrs. Sun Navy, helps him with the business.

Mr. Kuy Seng H. is 47 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a Casino Club while two others help their parents with the business and the youngest one is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of cooking equipment for his work

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es:
DINA EMERITA A. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en el Psje. Centenario Mz. A-24, Lt. 15 AA.HH. 09 de Octubre, Distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años de edad, 06 hijos, su esposo es técnico en refrigeración.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas de segunda mano como: Polos, shores, pantalones, en poca cantidad, llevaba a vender al pimental km. 34 de la C.F.B. del Distrito de Campo Verde – Ucayali.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara 01 fardo de ropas usadas, vende en el pimental, tiene muchos clientes le hacen pedidos, ella los cumple en el tiempo determinado.

Está muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, súper contenta con su familia y su trabajo.
texts.en:
DINA EMERITA A. C. is a member of the “Las Guerreras” microfinance institute located on Centenario Way, block A-24, lot 15 AA.HH. 09 de Octubre, in the district of Callería. She is a 50-year-old mother with 6 children. Her husband is an air conditioning technician.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased used clothing, such as T-shirts, shorts and pants in small quantities. She sold her merchandise in Pimental km. 34 C.F.B in the Campo Verde district of Ucayali.

With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, she will purchase 1 bundle of used clothing. She sells her merchandise in Pimental. She has many customers who put in orders, which she fills on time.

She is very happy with Manuela Ramos for its support, and super happy with her family and job.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 bundle of clothing

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Mrs.Tak S. was born in 1982 and makes a living raising pigs. She also makes and sells cakes from her home. She is married and the mother of two children, who are still young and enrolled in the local school. Her husband's name is Tonh, 31 and he is a truck driver. Tonh owes a truck for transporting earth and soil. He provides this service to the village, which earns him an income of about $9 a day. The family lives in Siem Reap Province. 

Tak S. is asking for a $1200 loan to start a new business as a grocery seller. She will use the loan to build the grocery store, buy a stock of groceries for resale and use the remainder of the loan for her husband's business. Tak S.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available.

loans.use: To build a grocery store and buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: K. Muhayo was born in 1972 in the J.Rasulov region in Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. Muhayo sells cosmetics in the local bazaar. She brings the cosmetics herself from Istaravshan. She sells hair-color cream, creams, and cosmetics. She wants to open an outlet in the crowded bazaar where she intends to sell perfumes and cosmetics. Muhayo requests a loan of $450 (1600 TJS) for 6 months from KIVA so she can import new goods to sell.

loans.use: Import new goods to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía Ríos Núñez es casada y de su matrimonio procrearon un hijo.
Ellos viven  en una casa de interés social cuando ellos adquirieron  su vivienda se la entregaron sin vitropiso, ella  ha  querido ponérselo  pero siempre ha tenido prioridades económicas como lo han sido las necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación y salud de sus hijos. Ella siempre y su esposo han preferido darle lo mejor educación a sus hijos para que en un futuro tenga un profesión pero como también quiere dejarles un patrimonio el cual quiere es su vivienda y darle mantenimiento para esto nenecita capital para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofía Ríos Núñez is married and has a son. They live in subsidized housing. When they acquired their home they were given it without a tile floor. She has wanted to put one in but she has always had other economic priorities like basic food needs, education and health of her children. She and her husband have always wanted to provide the best education for their children so that in the future they have a profession and would also like to provide them an inheritance in their home and provide maintenance. The loan will be used to finish this project.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glazed tile flooring

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a fifty-year-old woman, still married and the mother of six children who are all pursuing education. Mary lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Mary is one of such women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for eight years. Her husband is a food-crop farmer.

Mary buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community. She processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the meat of the palm nuts which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and re-boiled to expel its water content.

Mary wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm nuts in bulk so as to be able to supply palm oil to more customers. She believes the loan assistance will enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances.

Mary is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Mambo (Welcome) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Carolina H. from Mwanza. She is single with two children aged 10 and 13 years.

Carolina has been running a banana business since 2004. She buys bananas from the wholesaler and sells them to her customers. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week. She currently earns about $150 from her business.

Carolina is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase bananas so as to increase her capital. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Carolina thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bananas so as to increase her capital

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana S. comes from the village of Cebulin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Marciana raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately Php 2,000 a month. In 2008, Marciana joined Paglaum Coop to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This is her first loan from Paglaum Coop. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mahmudchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Махмудчон Хакимов торгует на рынке города Истаравшана. Он продает носки. Товар он приобретает у поставщиков. Поставщики же в свою очередь привозят товар из Кыргызстана. Займ хочет получить для расширения своего бизнеса. Дополнительно Махмудчон подрабатывает охраником в центральной библиотеке, в ночной смене.
 Махмудчон женат и имеет сына и дочь.
texts.en:
Mahmudchon H. is married and has a son and a daughter. He sells socks at a market in the city of Istaravshan. He buys his merchandise from suppliers, who bring the goods from Kyrgyzstan. Mahmudchon also works as a night security guard at the central library. Mahmudchon wants to obtain a loan in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion operates a variety store in her village in Centro 1, Mallig, Isabela. Some of her items include bags, clothes, school supplies, and other merchandise that are in demand. She is 43 years old and married to Vivencio, a farmer. They a daughter named Angelica, a high school graduate who is now working abroad and hoping to raise their standard of living.

Because of her desire to develop her business, Consolacion was encouraged to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP30, 000 as additional working capital for her store. She plans to use the loan to buy more goods so she can expand her business and venture into other types of business. For Consolacion, the loan will be a big help in making her business grow and in helping her family have a better way of living.

loans.use: To expand her variety store

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito N. is a 46-year old farmer and the father of three children. He is tilling the farm that he inherited from his parents. He is doing his very best to have an abundant harvest in order to be able to support his children's education. 

He is asking for a loan of 7,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. 

He hopes that someday his family will live a more comfortable life.  He is actively participating in the CEVI credit program including through receiving loans, training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89356&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. 
Elena  se puso a trabajar en la venta de fruta  con su esposo en un puesto alquilado, también tiene un negocio de alquiler de moto-car.
Los préstamos le dan  una seguridad de poder invertir y ampliar su negocio. 
Necesita un crédito de 2000 soles,  para la compra de fruta de la estación.
El sueño de Maria es terminar de estudiar dermatología y trabajar enseñando cosmetología y poner  un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the community bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). She works selling fruit with her husband in a rented stand; she also has a rental car business.

These loans give her security becuase she can invest in and increase her business. She needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy in-season fruit. Maria's dream is to finish her dermatology studies and to work as a cosmetology teacher and open a beauty salon. (Her previous loan can be seen here: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89356&_tpos=7&_tpg=1)

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy in-season fruit

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 52 years old, and is married with four children and five grandchildren. He describes himself as active and friendly. For the past 28 years, Ephantus has owned a small retail shop in Kayole of Nairobi. He is requesting his first loan of 50,000 KES in order to increase his stock of soda, cereals, flour, and telephone cards. While this is his first loan, Ephantus hopes to grow his business and, one day, become a wholesaler. 

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock of soda, cereals, flour, and telephone cards

loans.name: Adjo Akpénè

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’Awatamé à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Mais en 2000, elle a été traumatisée par le décès subit de son mari. Cette veuve était obligée de subvenir seule aux besoins de ses enfants et d’assurer leur éducation scolaire. Cette contrainte imprévisible l’a donc poussée à ouvrir une boutique de vente des produits de mercerie et des tissus légers. Heureusement que cette activité connaît un réel succès ; puisqu’elle arrive à payer son loyer et à régler ses fournisseurs. C’est pour pouvoir reconstituer son stock manquant qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un bal de tissus légers, des rubans, des fils à coudre, des fils de surfilage, des épingles et des boutons. Elle n’a aucun souci pour rembourser son prêt à temps.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Awatamé district of Lomé.  She is married and the mother of five children.  But in 2000, she was traumatized by the sudden death of her husband.  Alone, this widow was compelled to provide for her children's needs and to ensure they are educated. This unforeseeable constraint therefore drove her to open a store, which sells sewing supplies and light-weight fabrics.  Fortunately, this business has really been successful, since she manages to pay her rent and her suppliers.  To be able to replenish her low inventory, she would like to obtain a WAGES loan to buy a bale of light-weight fabrics, some ribbons, sewing thread, overcasting thread, needles, and buttons.  She is not worried at all about repaying her loan on time. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida P., age 37, is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin Province. Brigida and her husband have four school-aged children. To make a living, Brigida owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like banana and hot cakes in the local community. Brigida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Brigida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her aim was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Brigida is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Brigida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette femme vend du charbon de  bois dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2001. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié, une ville située à plusieurs kilomètres de Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à bon nombre de ses besoins. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail aux clients de son quartier. Des revendeuses ambulantes de charbons viennent aussi s’approvisionner chez elle à des prix intéressants. Elle compte dans l’avenir se lancer dans le commerce d’autres produits accessoires. Elle cherche en ce moment à disposer de nouveaux stocks ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 35 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée mais sans enfant.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Nicholas Ngula

texts.en:
Nicholas is 40 years old, married and has two children. He has been in the carpentry business for 15 years. He is on his 5th loan from KADET, and has used his previous loans to diversify his sources of income. Recently, he expanded into the bread and milk supply business. Catherine, Nicholas' wife, runs a grocery kiosk.

Nicholas is the Chairman of his borrower group. Nicholas will use this loan to purchase carpentry machinery for his shop. He employs a few workers. With the profits from this loan, Nicholas will become a meat distributer. He will purchase a cow at wholesale and then distribute the various meat sections to retail butchers.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase carpentry machinery for his carpentry and welding shop

loans.name: Luz Amanda

texts.es: La señora Luz Amanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que  son estudiantes y aun depende de ella.Luz Amanda, mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, CyZone, Avon y Unique, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Se siente muy contenta y tranquila con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará productos de catálogos como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.   Luz Amanda, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Luz Amanda, 37, is a member of the "Los Diamantes" communal bank in the Eslabon district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She has a life partner and is the mother of two children, both of whom are students and still dependent upon her. Luz Amanda is a hard-working woman who, with her characteristic fighter spirit and desire to get ahead by her own efforts, was motivated to start her own business selling cosmetics of the Esika, CyZone, Avon and Unique brands without a boss or a set schedule. Little by little she became well known among her customers and today she tells us that she does quite well with this activity. Currently, she continues with the same line of work, located in her own home, where she sells all day. Sometimes, she goes out to sell door-to-door. She feels happy and calm with what she does. With this 500 sol loan she will buy catalogue products like: perfumes and refreshing colognes, body and face creams, lipsticks and compact powders to keep her customers happy and satisfied. Luz Amanda is calm and happy with what she does and grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou C. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et sans enfants mais elle a la charge de ses deux neveux et deux nièces. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi ce qui lui a doté d'une bonne expérience en crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses neveux et nièces.
texts.en:
Fatou C., aged 35, is married without children, but she takes care of her two nephews and two nieces. She has been a member of a village bank for six and a half years, which gave her a good experience of the credit process. She produces and sells peanut butter. The profit enables her to provide for her nephews and nieces.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her activity

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been selling fish for 15 years. He is a 50-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ali sells good quality, clean fish. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. Ali took on his father’s work; therefore, he didn’t face a lot of difficulties since he was already known by the public and had a client base.
