Ali has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and repair one of his fridges. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and repair one of his fridges

loans.name: Divina Misercordia Group

texts.es:
Divina Misericordia se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Capiatá en fecha 23 de setiembre de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Julia B., quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas caseras y posee una despensa, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 

Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 23 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.


El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 569.500 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa(arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.),venta de ropas ,venta de lencerías, venta de gallinas caseras, venta de carbón, venta de ropas artesanales, etc.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Divine Mercy calls itself an excellent group of women and was formed in the city of Capiatá on September 23, 2008. This happened thanks to the General Director Miss Julia B., who sells home-grown chickens and has a larder. She contacted an adviser in a weekly meeting in the area find out about the work of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs.

The adviser of the program was able to bring together 23 women who are working very happily, already in their 4th loan cycle, both together and individually within the program. The average loan for each member is 569.500 Gs., which goes toward various activities such as: selling food, selling merchandise, selling merchandise for the pantry, (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy, bread, herbs, etc.), selling clothing, selling lingerie, selling home-grown chickens, selling charcoal, selling artisan clothing, etc.

All of the women do these activities to collect funds. They help each other mutually to accomplish the common goals of everyone within the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the pantry (rice, sugar, herbs, dairy, bread, sodas, etc.), purchase of ingredients for making food, purchase of merchandise, purchase of clothing, purchase of plastic products, purchase of lingerie, purchase of fruit, vegetables, and natural medicine, purchase of raw materials for making bread, purchase of thread for making artisan clothing, purchase of charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. José Julio C. M. de 48 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres quienes han fallecido hace 2 años al ser afectados por el terremoto esto esta ubicado en Los Aquijes – Ica vive junto con su hermano con quien comparte gastos de la unidad familiar.
El Sr. Se dedica desde hace 10 años al transporte antes trabajaba para una empresa de transporte posterior a eso se logro comprar su camioneta que ahora la trabaja realizando trabajos de Taxi - Carga (mudanzas, traslado de mercadería y otros) de lunes a sábado de 6:30 am hasta las 3:00 pm en Prolongación Grau – Ica.
El tiene 3 hijas quienes viven con su madre por motivos familiares se separo de ella desde hace 4 años dos de sus hijas son mayores de edad y trabajan independientemente solo una se encuentra preparándose para la universidad y él le apoya en sus gastos ya que desea que su hija logre ingresar y sea toda una profesional.
El Sr. es bien responsable goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos solicita el financiamiento para poder tramitar su brevete que se encuentra vencido y que no le permite trabajar normalmente.
texts.en:
José Julio C. M. is 48 years old and lives in his parents' house. They died 2 years ago during the earthquake that was located in Los Aquijes. He lives with his brother, with whom he shares the household expenses. For 10 years he has worked in transportation. Prior to this he worked for a transportation company; later he managed to buy the truck that he now uses to provide taxi-cargo services (for moving, transporting merchandise, etc.) He works Mondays through Saturdays from 6:30am until 3pm in the area of Prolongación Grau in Ica. He has 3 daughters who live with their mother, as he has been separated from her for 4 years. Two of his daughters are adults and work independently and the third is preparing for the university; he supports her with her expenses since he would like for his daughter to enter the university and become a professional. Jose is very responsible and enjoys good references from his neighbors. He requests financing to be able to renew his driver's license, as it has expired and he is not allowed to work without it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expenditures related to transportation business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 50 years old, married to Ruth Wairimu, and has two children who have finished the higher level of schooling and are now employed. For the last seven years, Isaac has sold construction supplies, especially wall paint, in Naivasha town. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be his second loan. With his loan, he plans to buy more paint for sale and boost his stock.
Isaac plans to continue with his business in the future as it is very profitable. He hopes that he will be able to expand his business to sell paint wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more paint for resale

loans.name: Mirian Gimenez

texts.en:
Mirian Gimenez is 18 years old, is married, and has a 2-year-old daughter. Mirian sells men's, women's and children's clothing, including pants, T-shirts, undershirts, shorts, etc. She has been in the same line of work for over a year, and has been able to help her husband with the household expenses and increase their quality of life.

Mirian learned about Fundación Paraguaya through advertisements in her neighborhood, and asked for help in purchasing her merchandise since she has many orders to fill. She is very thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, shorts, children's clothes, jeans and slacks

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en: Victoriana is thankful to have gained access to CEVI’s program. She is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur and she would borrow money from lenders who charge a high interest for their loans. It brought difficulty to her and she hardly earned from her harvest because of what she had to pay. Now that she is a member of CEVI, she is hopeful that the loan she requested would be truly helpful because of its low interest. She asked for PHP 5,000, which she would use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs needed for her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: H., 38, lives in Battambang province, where she earns her daily income by providing a tailoring service for her neighbors in the village. She has been married for a year and has six children: three are married and have already started new homes and the remaining three are school age. Usually, H. relies on her husband's income; he owns a car and operates a taxi service. H. will be using her first loan to construct a hedge around her house in order to protect her property. She would like to say thank you to the donors who make her loan possible.

loans.use: To construct a hedge around her house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Q. is from the village of Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old and married with four school-aged children. Elizabeth has a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. Elizabeth has been in the business for over two years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan she taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla B. is a very strong-minded woman and she notes that she works hard to better her life. Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Priscilla remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. What motivates her all day is her aspiration to give her family a brighter future. 

To make a good living, Priscilla is a soft drinks dealer in her community. She has been in this business for nine years. She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2007. During the course of her membership, Priscilla has been a good performer: valued for her attendance at center meetings, repayments and business. She is now applying for her fourth loan, this time for 25,000 Philippine pesos, to obtain additional inventory of soft drinks. She is positive that with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of an expanded business will be achieved.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of soft drinks

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JUANA,  ella tiene  51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3  hijos, Nuestra socia alterna su labor de ama del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desde 20 años, nuestra socia ahora también está en el negocio de compra y venta de ropas. La socia solicita el préstamo para traer mercadería y vender a sus amigas y a sus allegados.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Juana, lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department; she’s a member of “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank. Juana is 51 years old, married and has three children. She alternates her household chores with retail activities: she has sold prepared meals for over 20 years. She is also a clothing merchant. She needs funds to bring merchandise to sell to her friends and acquaintances. She is grateful for and values the support provided through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Pedro Celestino

texts.es: Pedro Celestino tiene 51 años, por lo su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues no tenía el capital suficiente para mantener a su familia. Tiene 5 hijos que son mayores de edad que no están a su cargo. Como esta es su principal fuente de ingresos, Pedro trata de brindar una buena alimentación a sus animales para que estos tengan un buen valor con los negociantes que siempre llegan al lugar a adquirirlos. Siempre brinda una fuente de ingresos que le ayuda a solventar la economía de su familia. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de 5 terneros y también vacas. Su deseo es comprar su propia tierra para obtener más ganado.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 years old and buys and sells livestock. He began doing this five years ago, because he did not have enough money to support his family. He has five adult children who are now on their own. Because his livestock is his primary source of income, he tries to provide it ith good quality feed, so that they will become more valuable to the buyers who frequently visit his farm. He always brings in enough income to be able to provide for his family. He is asking for this loan in order to buy five bulls and some cows. He would someday like to buy his own land in order to be able to raise more livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Knowledge Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Celestina describes herself as hard-working and someone who loves selling and serving customers. She is 54 years old and is the leader of the 'Knowledge' borrower group, made up of eight members.  Celestina sells vegetables and spices like tomatoes, onions and peppers in the community market, the business through which she makes income to support her family. Tomatoes, onions and peppers provide much flavor to local sauces and soups and almost every local dish contains these ingredients, making it a good business to sell them. 

Celestina is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of tomatoes in bulk to expand her market. Celestina also engages in farming as her secondary business. She hopes to mobilize more savings to rent a store and sell groceries.

Celestina is married to a farmer and they have three children who are 10, 13 and 18 years old. She hopes to support her youngest child through university education. The other members of the group are mostly farmers. She describes her group members as being punctual and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions and peppers in bulk

loans.name: Clariet

texts.en:
Clariet is a 36 year-old woman who sells second-hand clothing. She sells shirts and skirts at a market near a busy highway. Unfortunately, there are many people who conduct the same kind of business, so competition is one of her biggest business challenges. Local authority regulations can also cause problems. Clariet has been in this business for 4 years.  

Clariet is married and has 2 children, a 13 year old son and an 8 year old daughter. She plans to use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase additional stock of clothing for resale, especially newer fashions. Clariet hopes to expand her business to become the leading provider of second-hand clothing in town. In 5 years, she dreams of moving from selling second-hand clothes to selling new clothes that she would purchase from Dubai. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing for resale, especially newer fashions.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie D. D. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Melanie is married and has 5 school-aged children. Melanie owns and operates a business whose main source of income is selling personal home products from different suppliers to the  local community members. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly S. is from the town of Clarin. She is 37 years old. Jelly is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the third loan taken out by Jelly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola tiene la edad de 23 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de tres años y el otro que recién cumpló su primero. Ella tiene una salón de belleza para lo cual quiere comprar una mesa y sillas que usará para dar más atención a más clientes. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su salón con que cuenta con un local y experiencia en el mercado. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y tampoco no tiene crédito en ningún otro banco. Le agradece a FUDECOSUR que ha brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y una tasa de interés mucho más baja que otros fuentes. Quiere que su inversión en el negocio de más ayuda a su familia y le facilita invertir en más equipo para dar más atención a más clientes. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sean en el futuro personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Paola is 23 years old, married, and has two children. Her oldest child is three years old while the other one recently became a year old. She has a beauty salon and wants to buy a table and chairs so that she can attend to more customers. Paola has managed her salon for a few years from her own location and she has plenty of experience in the marketplace.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she carries no other obligations with any other bank. She is grateful for the loan FUDECOSUR provided because it comes with better terms and a much lower interest rate than other sources of credit. Paola sees this investment as being a great help to her family and it will make it easier to acquire more equipment for her business, allowing her to provide more services to her customers. She also wants to provide her children with the necessary education for them to become prepared individuals in the future so that they will be able to deal with life more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a table & chairs for her salon

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna A. is a 40-year-old mother and wife with six sons and two daughters. Seven of her children are school students and the eighth works in a carpet factory and helps his father pay the household expenses. 

Muna's husband works as a taxi driver in Gaza city. He has been in this profession for five years. Muna's husband needed a $1,500 loan, which he took from FATEN, to renew his car's license and perform regular car maintenance. Muna's husband is saving money to be able to buy a better car than the one he stands next to in the picture.

loans.use: To renew his car license and perform maintenance

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group Lugazi

texts.en:
It pays to be cordial, placid, and resolute, and to always have resources in reserve to deal with the unexpected when doing business. This is the perspective that 46-year-old N. Teddy has been laying to heart the last eight years running her pub and pork-selling businesses in Namataba-Lugazi. N. belongs to the Mukisa women’s group - Lugazi. 

N. has succeeded in making profitable use of her time running this business that she began with the help of her husband. Savings from her pub business rendered countenance to her in getting her on her feet. In a week she makes profits that add up to 450,000 shillings. With this loan she wants to buy more crates of both hard and soft drinks for her business and also to buy pigs to reduce the costs she incurs buying pork from butcher shops.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of hard and soft drinks for her pub and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo L. is from the town of Banga. He is 63 years old. Rodolfo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo plants and harvests rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in farming for over 40 years.

Rodolfo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mecedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is nineteen years old.  She lives with her family in Tambogrande a town in the northern part of Peru in the province of Piura.  It is a primarily rural zone which consists of farmers squeezing a living out of the desert valleys through skillful use of irrigation systems.

On Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays, Mercedes sells food and beverages out of her home.  She sells food, chicha (a traditional beverage which is brewed from corn) and beer.  This business is growing steadily given her hours of attention and the demand in the area.

She plans to use the loan proceeds to expand her inventory and make purchases at bulk prices.  She expects that this will allow her to expand market share and also increase her profit margin.  She hopes to one day expand her business to become a distributor.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Almaas' Group

texts.en:
Almaas lives in Gujranwala which is located in Punjab and famous for its sweetmeat in Pakistan. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family for many years. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She operates a small canteen in a nearby school, where she sells fast food like sandwiches, French fries, burgers and cold drinks to school children and teachers.

Her husband is a government employee and earns a meager income. She is the mother of 2 daughters and a son. Her son drives a rickshaw and her eldest daughter is a school teacher. Her youngest daughter is 6 years old and studying in kindergarten.

Almaas has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her canteen business. She will use the loan in purchasing required items such as potatoes, cooking oil, bread, spices and cold drinks in bulk quantity that enable her to make fast food to sell through the canteen. She has been doing this business for over 10 years and she is sure that this investment will prove profitable for her and she will easily repay the loan. She is a new borrower with Asasah and hopes that it will be a long term relationship for her.

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Almaas.

loans.use: To buy required items for canteen business

loans.name: Geronica

texts.en:
Geronica T. is from Palilan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 30 years old. Geronica is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Geronica owns and operates a retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp. Geronica has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 1600 PHP a month.

In 2004, Geronica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Geronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Geronica is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which she will use to invest in renovating the business. This will be the tenth loan taken by Geronica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Nancy Crisalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy I. es socia del banco comunal El Aguacate, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, también tiene 4 ríos los mismos que  bañan a la ciudad.

Doña Nancy tiene 29 años, su esposo tiene 35 años y juntos tienen  4 hijos de 9, 8, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es maestro en el área de la construcción, viven en casa propia la misma que es de su esposo.

La Señora Nancy se dedica  a la venta bisutería  actividad que la realiza hace un tiempo atrás,  es ella quien compra los materiales para realizar pulseras, colgantes, collares, aretes, trabaja desde su casa y las vende a sus amigas, conocidas y también vende recorriendo la ciudad,  aprendido a realizar sus artesanías en un curso que realizo de bisutería y tejidos lo cual le ha servido para iniciar su propio negocio.

Es el segundo crédito que  realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para obtener los créditos, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para la realizar sus artesanías como son: mullos, perlas etc. Su sueño es tener su casa propia pero construida con su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy I. is a member of the El Aguacate (The Avocado) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Avocado which is part of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is beautiful because of its culture and traditions.  It has a varied gastronomy and four rivers that bathe the city.

Nancy is 29 years old and her husband is 35.  They have four children together who are 9, 8, 7 and 4 years of age.  Her first three children go to a school in the city.  Her husband is a master builder and they live in their own house which is her husband’s.

Nancy has sold costume jewelry for some time now.  She buys the materials and makes bracelets, necklaces, pendants, earrings.  She works at home and sells to her friends and acquaintances and also travels through the city selling.  She learned how to make the crafts in a jewelry making course she took and this has helped her start her own business.

This is the 2nd loan she’s had with the communal bank.  She likes it because of the ease with which loans are obtained.  She will use the new loan to buy materials to make her crafts like: beads, pearls, etc.  Her dream is to have her own house but to build carefully.

loans.use: To buy pearls, beads, pins, etc.

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en: Alex K. (pictured at the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born forty-eight years ago in a small town called Lunsar.  Alex is married and has four children.  For ten years now, Alex has been managing a pharmacy. Mr. K. will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy more medicines to add into his pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for pharmacy

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov C., 25, sells rice, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. The family has to spend USD 81 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C. appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy necessary items for her son's bakery

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, Saumu has operated a food stall, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is competition from other food stall operators. Saumu decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her livelihood. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase wheat flour and sacks of sugar. In the future, Saumu hopes to increase her sales to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de San Blas se formó el 19 de diciembre de 2007. Con trabajo duro y dedicación ya están en el décimo ciclo de sesiones, conjunta y solidariamente en el programa. Además de su trabajo independiente, crean fondos para tener algo de capital dentro del grupo y ayudarse para alcanzar sus objetivos, trabajan arduamente para apoyar financieramente a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Juana González. Ella se dedica a traer mercadería a Clorinda. Vive sola y trabaja mucho. Ella es una mujer de escasos recursos, pero gracias al comité de crédito y sus socias cree que es capaz de mejorar considerablemente su negocio y su gestión. Ella dice que este préstamo podría mejorar sus ingresos y quiere usarlo para comprar frutas, verduras, pan y todo tipo de bebidas.
texts.en:
The women of the San Blas Committee formed their group on December 19, 2007. With hard work and dedication they are in their 10th loan cycle with this program. In addition to their independent work, they create funds to have a bit of capital within the group, and to help each other reach their objectives they work very hard to financially support their families. 

A very moving story is that of Sra. Juana Gonzalaez. She works bringing merchandise to Clorinda. She lives alone and works a lot. She is a woman who has scare resources, but thanks to the credit committee and her partners she believes she is capable of considerably improving her business and its manaagement. She tells us that this loan could help improve her income, and she wants to use it to purchase fruits, vegetables, bread, and vatious types of beverages.

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, tea, rice, beverages, starch, corn, flour, etc.

loans.name: Keth

texts.en:
Keth B. is 49 years old.  She resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. B. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 1.3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2.3 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 45 on food and USD 100 on the other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase groceries to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Guicela Mercedes

texts.es:
Guicela Mercedes tiene 34 años, vive con el compañero y con los 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Guicela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa.

Le gusta jugar indor
texts.en:
Guicela Mercedes, 34, is living with her spouse and 4 children. 

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Guicela farms corn and rice.  

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for her crops.   Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

Her dream is to own a house.  She enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Gustavo Javier

texts.es: El joven Gustavo Javier P. R. es soltero no tiene hijos y tiene un negocio de cabinas de Internet y juegos de play station, inicio esta actividad con sus ahorros logrados por su trabajo como docente el cual ejerce despues de culminar sus estudios en un instituto de su ciudad,se vio obligado a poner este negocio debido al bajo sueldo que percibe,esta ganando experiencia por ello quiere mejorar el servicio a sus clientes adquiriendo accesorios que mejoren la experiencias de sus clientes su sueño a futuro es hacer crecer mas su negocio tiene buenas referencias vecinalesy se ve muy ordenado y empeñoso,es por ello que se propone el presente credito lo cual mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo Javier P. R. is a young man with no children who runs an Internet cafe where he also offers Play Station games.  He started this business with some savings that he made from his job as a teacher, a job which he pursued after finishing his studies. He saw it as a necessity to start the business because of the low salary he was earning. He is gaining experience and wants to improve the services he offers to his clients buy purchasing accessories that improve their experiences. 

His goal for the future is to further grow his business.  He has good references, is very orderly and hardworking, this is why he is being offered the credit.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for his computers

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella D. C. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Stella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Stella owns & operates a general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Stella has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC.  Stella is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase sugar, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Stella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción se conformó un grupo llamado "Santa Ana", en honor a dicha santa por los favores y cuidados recibidos por ella.
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas, de empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne, y  otras actividades.
Este grupo se encuentra en su 9vo ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de resposabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia a las capacitaciones.
La sra. Viviana se dedica a la venta de bebidas, ella posee un depósito de refrescos, cervezas, sidras, vinos, gaseosas y otras bebidas en el local mismo de su casa, desde hace mucho tiempo, es un negocio que fue prosperando rapidamente gracias a la buena atencion que ofrece a sus clientes y a la buena calidad de us productos.
Se ha convertido en el medio por el cual obtiene los ingresos económicos para su canasta familiar, para poder prosperar y vivir dignamente.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar más bebidas para su depósito, pues de esta manera tendría más oportunidades de complacer los gustos de su clientela y ganar más beneficios.
Todas las mujeres del comité esperan contar con el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
In the city of Asunción, a group was created which was named "Santa Ana" in honor of the saint from whom the group's members have received favors and care.

The members of this committee work in different business activities which include selling clothes, snacks, empanadas, tortillas, croquettes, roast meat, and other activities.

This group is entering its 9th loan cycle.  Their sense of responsibility and their desire to make progress are clear.  They all attend their training sessions.

Viviana sells drinks.  She has a store in her home where she sells soft drinks, beer, cider, wine, soda and other drinks.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Her business has quickly prospered thanks to the good customer service that she offers and the good quality of her products.

Viviana's business has become the source of income with which she covers her family's basic daily needs.  Through it, she has been able to prosper and live a decent life.

Viviana is requesting this loan to buy more drinks for her store since this will give her more opportunities to please the tastes of her customers and gain more benefits.

All the women in the committee hope to be able to count on Kiva's support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soda, cider, wine, beer, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luís tiene una tienda en la que comercializa prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ropa como ser: pantalones, sacos. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en alquiler en una casa que  queda  ubicada en la zona de Bella Vista de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente.
texts.en: José Luís has a store that sells men's and women's clothing. His loan will be used to buy clothing such as pants and jackets and this source of income will help him to cover his costs. He rents a house that is located in the Bella Vista area in the city of Paz. He is single and has no children. José is very satisfied with the loans he has received in the past.

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets, and other items for his clothing store

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en:
Watfa is a 36-year-old mother of nine from southern Israel. She lives and works in the Negev. Watfa opened a household, kitchen supplies, gifts and trinkets store. She has gained clientele not only from her village but also from the surrounding area. Watfa's draw is the variety and size of her stock as well as her low prices. She has found a niche for many shoppers and has return customers throughout the year.

The wedding season is coming soon. In order to benefit from this retail opportunity, Watfa needed this loan to increase her stock and purchase additional gifts, mattresses, sheets and other household items for sale.

Watfa wants to expand her business even further and in the future, she wants to include some high-end quality pieces to appeal to an additional customer base. For her family, she wants peace and happiness and to continue and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gifts, mattresses, sheets and other household items to sell

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor Hugo es chofer y tiene su taxi y es socio propietario en “TRUFI 408”. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehiculo. Vive en casa de su suegra  ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en: Víctor Hugo is a cab driver, he drives his own taxi and is a partner in the “TRUFI 408”. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a new engine for his car. He lives in his mother-in-law’s house in Pasankeri, a neighborhood of the capital La Paz; he is married and has no children. This is the first loan he is requesting to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Solidario Bethlehem Group

texts.es:
Solidario Bethlehem Este grupo esta formado por Liria D. 28 años D. edad tiene 3 hijos y es casada, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa típica usada, esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. ropa tipica, también esta doña Maria D. 40 años, ella tiene 3 hijos y no tiene esposo porque la abandono, ella venD. ropa típica, además hace bordado y costura que la gente le llega a pedir en su casa desD. hace 15 años ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. ropa tipica. 

La líder del grupo, es doña Marta Alicia ella tiene 5  hijos, y se dedica a la venta D. leña D. pino y encino y también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, desD. hace 15 años,  ella esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para comprar suficiente leña porque viene el invierno y no se consigue leña seca entonces ella tiene una galera y allí podría almacenar la leña pero la camionada D. leña tiene un precio elevado entonces ella quiere que se le otorgue este crédito para poder tener cuando no haya pero espera que fape pueda apoyarla  y asi tener mas ganancias en su negocio confía que se le pueda brindar el apoyo.
texts.en:
The Bethlehem Solidarity Group consists of the following members:

•	Liria  is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells used traditional clothing.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more traditional clothes.  

•	Doña Maria is 40 years old.  She has three children but no husband since he abandoned her.  Maria sells traditional clothing, but she also embroiders and sews for other people who come to her home to submit orders.  She has been in business for 15 years.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy traditional clothing.

•	Doña Marta Alicia is the group leader.  She has five children.  Marta has a business of selling pine and oak wood.  She also manages a small store in her home.  Marta has been in business for 15 years.  She is requesting a new loan to buy enough wood for the winter season because she is not able to obtain dry wood during that time.  Marta has a storage shed where she can keep the wood, but buying wood by the truckload is expensive.  This is why she is requesting this loan.  She expects FAPE will assist her so that her business can generate more revenue.  Marta is confident of receiving the support.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Yarlin Janette

texts.es: Yarlin Janette tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 3 años en su negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ella siempre se esfuerza por complacerlos en los diferentes pedidos que le realizan. Ella tiene que alistarse muy temprano por las mañanas para preparar su bolso en donde transporta la mayoría de sus productos que son de manera ambulante. es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cremas, bolsos, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas, shampoo, tratamientos y otros.
texts.en: Yarlin Janette is 36 years old and she has been a retailer for more than 3 years. The majority of her customers know that she always makes every effort to satisfy their different requests. She has to wake up very early in the mornings to prepare the bag in which she carries the majority of her products, since most of her sales are made out in the street. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy creams, bags, shoes, clothes, cosmetics, towels, bed sheets, shampoos and health treatments among other products.

loans.use: To buy creams, bags, shoes, clothes, cosmetics, towels, bed sheets, shampoos and health treatments.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past three years, Caro has operated a clothing sales business, selling at wholesale and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also operates a retail shop which provides her with another source of income. Caro faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

Caro plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: 5 Hai Son Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Mrs Binh operates a food stall selling fish, shrimp and frogs. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs. Binh is 54 years old and married with four children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 5 Hai Son Hoang Truong solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.


In 2011, Binh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Binh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Binh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardships that Binh faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

In the future, Binh hopes to remodel her house, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.es:
Mary de 40 años se vió en la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos a su familia, así es que decidió dedicarse a la venta de comidas rápidas, lo cual la hace sentir útil cuando colabora en la educacíon de sus hijos.

Las ventas la realiza desde la 16h00pm extendiéndose hasta las 21h00pm. Junto a Rubén su esposo quien es albañil tuvo 3 hijos cada uno de 13, 8 y 9 años los que estudian en el colegio fiscal.

Entre sus planes está hacer un préstamo y comprar una cocina industrial, platos y varios que necesita para mejorar su negocio. Además que con sus ganancias ella sueña ver a sus hijos profesionales y que tengan un mejor provenir.
texts.en:
Mary, age 40, saw the necessity of helping her family with their costs, so she started selling fast food. This makes her feel useful when she helps provide her children with an education.

She makes her sales from 4:00 pm until 9:00 pm. She and her husband Ruben, a bricklayer, have 3 children ages 13, 8 and 9 who attend public school.

Her plans include taking out a loan and buying an industrial kitchen, dishes and various items that she needs to improve her business. Above her earnings, she dreams of seeing her children as professionals and for them to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial kitchen, plates, and glasses.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a hard-working businessman aged 34. He is single. For the last four years, he has been operating a retail shop so as to make a living.  He supplements his income from the earnings he makes from his cyber cafe. 

In the next five years, he wants to have  opened up  a mini-supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a printer and a computer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has become business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a printer and a computer.

loans.name: Krabo

texts.en:
Krabo is 45 years old and is married with four children between the ages of six and 20. Her children attend school and live at home. Unfortunately, Krabo never went to school as her aunt always sent her to the market and she did not have the opportunity. For the past 22 years, since she left her aunt, she has been selling palm nuts, charcoal, and plantains at the local community market. Krabo makes a lot of profit.

Krabo is requesting a loan to purchase more palm nuts and plantains to get more customers for her business. In the future she plants to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and plantains

loans.name: Mario Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Mario es soltero, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con sus padres, reside en la ciudad de Curuguaty. 
Es propietario de una parada de Taxi que se compró con la ayuda de sus padres, cuenta con un auto que está a su nombre, en cual trabaja todos los días cubriendo el itinerario de Curuguaty – Salto del Guaira. Hace como un año que trabaja en esto.
Comenta que tiene muchos clientes puesto que hay pocos ómnibus por esos lugares. Además de eso, optan por el servicio también por el confort y la rapidez. Dice que todo su esfuerzo es para ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa, ya que la vida está muy dura
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas para su taxi, ya que necesitan un mantenimiento, para que con eso pueda ofrecer mayor seguridad a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Mario is single.  He is 28 years old and lives with his parents in the town of Curuguaty.

Mario owns a taxi stand which he bought with the help of his parents.  He has a car in his name which he uses every day to work the Curuguaty - Salto del Guaira taxi route.  He has been in this business for one year.  He tells us that he has a lot of customers as there are few buses in these places.  Also, people opt for a taxi service for comfort and speed.  He says that he works hard so that he can help his family with their household expenses as life is very hard.  

Mario is requesting this loan to buy tires for his taxi as they need maintenance so that he can offer better safety to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Suny

texts.en:
Suny (in the photo) is 31 years-old, and her husband, Sothea is 32 years-old.  They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have a young daughter.  

Suny sells rice, food and desserts at a local school, while her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $250 in order to renovate the shop where she sells rice, food and desserts.

loans.use: tTo renovate the shop where she sells rice, food and desserts.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a thirty-eight-year-old widowed woman with two school-going children. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Catherine has operated a boutique for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors, relatives and friends. She faces the major challenge of seasonality where demand is high at month end only. She dreams of owning a beauty shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because they cater to their clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is single  and works hard to support her family. She has a snack food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Angeline is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use  to buy more snack foods to sell.  Angeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks  to sell.

loans.name: Namubila Shg Group

texts.en:
Hillary is the facilitator of the Namubila SHG group. Hillary and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Hillary takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Hillary was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ an acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hillary and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Hillary will save for future use and build a house.

In 2012, the members of Namubila SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

He is pictured in the photograph together with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nenencia

texts.en:
Nenencia, a 49-year-old married mother of three grown children, is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City where for over 30 years she has been making and selling ice cream in the local community. She earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nenencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a container for her ice cream cart. This will be her sixth loan taken out from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a container for her ice cream cart.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат замужем. Ей 25 лет. Она имеет средне – специальное образование, продавец. Уже пять лет как она занимается торговлей. В основном Назокат продает детскую и женскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nazokat is married, she is 25 years old. She has specialized secondary education, she is a salesperson. She has been in the retail business for five years now. Nazokat mainly sells women's and children's clothing. She is asking for a loan to increase commodity turnover.

loans.use: to increase commodity turnover.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.ru: Угул 1963 года рождения, преподаватель с высшим образованием, имеет 3х детей. Замужем, муж Рахимчон работает слесарем – востребованная профессия и его работа не имеет сезонности и имеет стабильный доход. В семье работает ещё сын в маслозаводе «Авангард». Клиентка сама работает в общеобразовательной школе преподавателем персидского языка и заведующей учебной частью. После информирования о программе кредитования в ее школе образовали группу солидарной ответственности в составе преподавателей из этой же школы, и с 2009 года начали кредитоваться в нашей организации. Этот кредит берет на потребительские цели, несколько раз уже использовала целенаправленно кредит, пользуется уважением среди коллег и имеет положительное кредитное досье. Стаж ее кредитования непрерывный и она рада, что сотрудничает с нами.
texts.en: Ugul was born in 1963.  She is a teacher with a higher education and has three children.  She is married, and her husband, Rahimchon, works as a mechanic, which is a highly-demanded, non-seasonal profession, that brings in a stable income.  Their son works at a butter plant, called Avangard.  Ugul herself works at a secondary school as a Persian language teacher and an assistant principal of studies.  After learning about the financing program, her school formed a solidarity group, consisting of teachers from this school, and started to obtain loans from our organization since 2009.  This loan is being obtained for consumer goals.  Ugul has previously used loans purposefully several times; she is respected among her colleagues and has a positive credit history.  Her loan history is continuous, and she is glad to be partnering with us.

loans.use: to achieve consumer goals

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma de 38 años de edad, hace 19 años unió su vida con Miguel, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años. Esta feliz familia vive en una casa propia en el centro poblado de Kivinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Kivinaki es un lugar propicio para el desarrollo de frutos como: naranjas y tangello, productos a los que dedica mucho de su tiempo para su producción. Del mismo modo, pero en menor cantidad cultiva paltas y plátanos.
Con esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos, quienes también la apoyan en las labores del campo.
Los cuidados para sus sembríos son constantes, por eso debe recurrir a personal para que trabajen sus tierras.  
Por su parte Miguel, su esposo, trabaja como albañil en distintas construcciones. Así añaden más ingresos a su canasta familiar.  Y como Vilma no es conformista, distribuye muy bien su tiempo para desempeñarse como profesora  de educación inicial en un jardín de niños en la comunidad de Yaroni. “Me gusta sentirme ocupada. Con lo que hago me siento bien. De manera decente puedo brindarle a mi familia lo necesario para vivir”, comenta orgullosa. Más adelante, piensa adecuar habitaciones a su casa, por que ha visto un negocio rentable en el alquiler de cuartos. Este sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por lo que agradece de antemano el apoyo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”, su banco comunal, por que sabe que en equipo los resultados serán mayores. De obtener el dinero, podrá pagar la mano de obra para el cultivo de sus naranjas y plátanos. Si el trabajo es intenso destinará entre 250 y 300 soles a 10 operarios por día.
texts.en: Vilma is 38 years old. She married husband Miguel 19 years ago, and together they have two children, ages 18 and 15. This happy family lives in their own home in the center of Kivinaki, province of Chanchamayo, Peru. Kivinaki is a place for growing fruit, such as oranges and tangelos, produce to which Vilma dedicates a lot of her time. She also grows avocados and bananas on a smaller scale. With this job she was able to educate her children, who also help her in the field. Care for her crops is constant, so she has to rely on workers to tend to her land. Her husband is a construction worker, so they both add to the family finances. And since Vilma is a nonconformist, she also spends time working as a kindergarten teacher in the community of Yaroni. "I like to feel busy," she says proudly. "What I do makes me feels good. I can provide my family what it needs to live in a decent way." In the future she would like to set up rooms in her home because she sees a lucrative business in renting out rooms. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she welcomes the support in advance. She feels content to belong to the "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki" community bank because she knows working together will produce better results. With the loan, she plans to hire workers for her orange and banana crops. If the work is intense she plans to allocate between 250 and 300 soles (approximately $90-$110) for 10 workers a day.

loans.use: to hire 10 workers to grow oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Blessed Group

texts.en:
This is Florence, a 28-year-old lady from Masvingo. She is a single mother with a 5-year-old child. 

Florence is into a retailing business, buying and selling clothes and shoes imported from South Africa. She has been in this business for 3 years and has been operating from her residential place. Florence is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy more clothes and shoes for resale. She says high competition in the market is the major challenge she faces. She is planning to open a shop in the Central Business District of Masvingo town. 

With the extra income from this loan, Florence will be able to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Erika Tatiana

texts.es:
La Señora Erika es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, es muy rica en su cultura, su gente es muy amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Erika tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y en su unión han concebido 2 hijos de 3 años y un bebé 11 meses de edad. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá y comparten los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Erika por el momento se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que están pequeñitos, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  al cual fue invitada por su mamá, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para iniciar con la venta de estos productos.
 
Su meta iniciar con el negocio de venta de cosméticos y llegar a tener un local para vender estos productos.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank and she lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has great architectural beauty and a rich culture. Its people are friendly and they keep their culture and traditions. 
 
Erika is 20 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 2 children, a 3 year old and an 11 month old baby. Her husband is a private employee. She doesn't own her own home, so she lives in her mother's home and shares the expenses. 
 
Erika is at this time taking care of her children who are small. This is her first loan in the communal bank, to which she was invited by her mother. She is going to invest the loan in buying cosmetics to start selling these products.   
 
Her goal is to start this business selling cosmetics and to have a locale to sell them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 48 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería el elabora diversos trabajos como camas, armarios, estantes entre otros, el socio trabaja a pedido de acuerdo lo que le soliciten sus clientes, el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera para realizar sus trabajos.
El socio se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "HATUNCHASKAS", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

He is 48, has a common-law wife and two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business where he makes beds, armoirs, and shelving, among other products.  He works on an order basis to customer demand.  He is cheerful and responsble, and very determined to get ahead for his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy wood for his business.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy wood for his business.

loans.name: Ranaivomanana

texts.fr:
Ranaivomanana a  60 ans, il est marié. Le couple a cinq enfants dont 4 déjà mariés. Le dernier travaille déjà et ne vit plus chez lui. Sa femme l’appuie dans  son activité génératrice de revenu. 
Il a 5  années d’expérience dans l’activité de confection et de vente de draps. Avant, il travaillait auprès d’une unité de boulangerie et a créé une unité de pâtisserie. L’idée de créer cette activité lui est venue à l’esprit car sa sœur vendait des draps, Ayant constaté l’existence du marché et la rentabilité de l’activité, il a décidé de se lancer dans le secteur mais tout en confectionnant lui-même même les draps.  
Il projette de faire lui-même la broderie mais cela nécessite l’acquisition d’une machine à broder.

loans.use: acheter des toiles draps imprimés et unis

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina and her husband sell home products, cosmetics and clothing. Unlike other businesses in her area Sabina does not sell these products out of her home. Instead she is a door to door salesman in her community. This type of business has proven to be successful because many mothers and business owners do not leave their home during the day. Sabina sees this as a business opportunity as she can target these people as potential customers. She also makes her products attractive by allowing her customers to pay in small amounts at a time. She has learned that not all of her clients can afford to buy these items for the full price at the time of purchase, but that they can pay her in small amounts over a two week period. Thus Sabina and her husband have created a business that is convenient and accessible to the community. They are seeking a loan to be able to purchase a larger variety of products for the upcoming Christmas season. They will use the profits to benefit their two children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more products to sell for the upcoming Christmas Season

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She sells sugar, flour and rice in bags to her customers. She buys her goods direct from wholesalers and later retails them to her customers. Due to the moderate price of her goods everybody patronizes her shop. She is unable to supply them because her capital is insufficient to buy more goods. She is seeking a loan of $1100 from Kiva to enable her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is 32 years old and her husband is 37. They have two daughters, ages 10 and 4. The eldest daughter is a fourth grade student. Xuyen has Hepatitis B and her youngest daughter is often sick due to undernourishment. Xuyen sells fruits and vegetables door-to-door and her husband is a mason.  Their combined income is only $7 per person per month after purchasing medicines for their health issues. Xuyen is requesting a loan of $75 to enable her to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, which will increase her income and help her provide more nourishment for her children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Etobe

texts.en: Mr. Etobe N. is a businessman who travels to nearby states to buy clothes for resale. He specializes in the sale of men's wear. He is happy that whenever he needs funds for growth, LAPO always comes to his aid.  Mr. N. is now requesting a loan of $ 750 to expand his clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more men's wear for resale

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Aged 28, Mrs. Adjo A. is married and the mother of four children. Coming from a poor, polygamous family and wishing at all costs that her younger brothers and sisters will also be successful, she has taken responsibility for these five youngsters. Her income comes essentially from the sale of food products, especially fish. She is looking for funding to open a small grocery store. For this reason she is asking for financial support of $800.

Agée de 28 ans, Madame A. Adjo est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Sortie d’une famille pauvre et polygame et voulant à tout prix que ses petits frères et sœurs réussissent aussi, elle a pris à sa charge ces derniers au nombre de cinq (5). Ses sources de revenus proviennent essentiellement de la vente des produits vivriers et surtout du poisson. Elle cherche plus de moyen afin d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un appui financier de $800.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of food products

loans.name: Ana Fati

texts.en:
Ana Fati W. is a sixty-year-old lady who is married and has eight children. Five of the eight live overseas. Out of the three who live with Ana, one daughter is mentally handicapped. Her daughter's needs are one of her main obstacles. No one in the family works, except for Ana's husband, who is a village leader (the Pulenuu). Ana has a garden that helps to supplement the family income.

Supporting the family is not that easy for Ana. Every morning she has to irrigate and weed the garden. Aleisa, where she lives, is far from the town, so petrol is one of her daily expenses. She has an old van that she uses to transport her cabbages, cucumbers, spring onions and flowers to the market. Ana is old and not suitable for hard work like digging holes in the garden, and so she hires two boys from her neighborhood to dig the holes for her. She is on her seventh loan and has received $4,000. Ana is requesting this loan to fertilize her garden and improve her home. Her dream is to have a market overseas for her goods and also to build better housing for her and the children.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her garden and also iron roofing and timber for home improvements.

loans.name: Penina Lam

texts.en: Penina is a 37 year old mother of seven children.  This is her 7th loan from SPBD since she joined SPBD in 2005.  She runs a vegetable garden as well as a peanuts plantation.  Penina applied for this loan in order to buy supplies for her businesses and for renovating her house.  She sells her crops only on Friday, and she can earn a profit of 260 Tala ($104 USD), which is helpful for family expense like church donation, groceries, and bills.  Her husband drives a taxi and earns a profit of 380 Tala ($152 USD) a week.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden/plantation and for renovating her house

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es:
Militza is 33 years old and has 1 son, Elizabeth is 36 years old and has 4 children, while Nay is 27 years old and has 2 children. Militza, Elizabeth and Nay have been members of the Gratitude Communal Bank for 1 year.

Militza and her husband sell wood. Her husband is a carpenter and, besides manufacturing furniture, they buy and sell wood.

On the other hand Elizabeth sells food, purple liquor, jora liquor (a beverage that is prepared with a special type of corn), and also, together with her husband, she has a motor-taxi.

Nay sells trout, but before she had other businesses which included a beauty parlor, selling imported clothes and also a restaurant. Currently the trout business allows her to attend her children.

They need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles and 800 soles, respectively, that will be used for the repair of their motor-taxi and the purchase of eucalyptus wood, rice, corn, sugar, jora, cereals, a freezer, and a cooler. They tell us that in their Communal Bank they learned to save and to be punctual and responsible.

Their dreams are to have a lumber business, to live conveniently and want for nothing, to have their own house, to have more capital for their business and to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Militza tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, mientras que Nay tiene 27 años y 2 hijos. Militza, Elizabeth y Nay pertenecen al Banco Comunal Gratitud desde hace 1 año.

Militza junto a su esposo venden madera; su esposo es carpintero y además de fabricar muebles, compran y venden madera.

Por otro lado Elizabeth vende comida, chicha morada, chicha de jora (bebida que es preparada con maíz), y también junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi.

Nay vende truchas, pero antes ella tuvo otros negocios como salón de belleza, vendía ropa importada y también tenía un restaurante. En la actualidad el negocio de truchas le permite atender a sus hijos.

Ellas necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 400 soles y 800 soles, respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de madera de eucalipto, arroz, maíz, azúcar, jora, cereales, congeladora, cooler y para la reparación de su mototaxi. Ellas cuentan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables y a ahorrar.

Sus sueños son tener una empresa maderera, vivir cómodamente y que no le falte nada, tener casa propia, tener más capital para su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: To repair their motor-taxi and to buy Eucalyptus wood, rice, corn, sugar, jora (a species of corn), cereals, a freezer and a cooler

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Hang T., age 26, is a mother of one young child and is currently employed by a garment factory earning around $4 each day. She is too shy to be photographed, so her house is shown instead. Her husband is a construction foreman making on average around $3 each day in revenue. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to repair her house, which frequently leaks during the rainy season. This will improve the quality of life for her family and allow them to work better.

loans.use: To fix the leaks in her home.

loans.name: Gulbeniz

texts.en: Gulbeniz S. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Fizuli. She is married and has five children. During Soviet times, she worked in a textile workshop making sheets. She lost her job when she became an IDP. This is when she started buying wholesale fabric and selling it door to door. Now she buys both finished and unfinished fabric. She sews the unfinished fabric into bed sheets in order to make a greater profit. Gulbeniz has an IDP neighbor that she would like to hire for her business. She will use this loan to buy inventory for this new employee to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of new inventory for her fabric store

loans.name: Kossiwa Akofa

texts.fr:
Born on February 1, 1981 in Aného (50 kilometers east of Lomé), Mrs. Kossiwa Akofa Z. is a dynamic and organized lady who has started up a small business, a store in which she sells liquors, milk products, and everyday necessities. She is married and is financially responsible for a younger sister who is in high school and two younger brothers who are in middle school.

Mrs. Kossiwa Akofa Z. is currently requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 1200 to buy 50 cases of beer to stock the new little bar that she has very recently opened.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 1er février 1981 à Aného (50km à l’Est de Lomé), Madame Z. Kossiwa Akofa est une femme dynamique et organisée qui exerce son commerce à travers la création d’une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des liqueurs, des produits laitiers et des produits de première nécessité. Elle est mariée et supporte une petite sœur qui fait le lycée et deux petits frères qui sont au collège.

Pour la première fois, Madame Z. Kossiwa Akofa sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 500.000FCFA pour acheter Cinquante casiers de bière pour alimenter la nouvelle buvette qu’elle vient de créer tout récemment.

loans.use:
stock up on drinks

S'approvisionner en boissons gazeuses

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Isabel F. R. belongs to the communal bank called "Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin in Moyabamba. She sells candy made out of sugar cane and peanuts. She works from home. She sells her candy in different stores throughout the city and they have become very popular.

She studied to become a nurse technician, but she was never able to do it since she got married and had a family. Her mother-in-law taught her how to make this type of candy and she's been making it for the past 3 years. She's had a lot of success by doing this.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic ingredients such as peanuts, sugar and plastic bags for packaging.

Isabel is 24 years old with 2 small children. She's a very responsible and independent woman. She's very happy with what she's doing. She has the support of her husband. She's very well-known in the area, and she also has a big clientele due to her good customer service and high quality products. She would like to one day be able to expand her business to other areas in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Isabel F. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Ayaymaman vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Moyabamba y distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces confitados a base de maní y chancaca (azúcar natural de de caña) negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa, sus productos lo distribuye en las bodegas de los distintos barrios de la ciudad y son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Es enfermera técnica de profesión, pero nunca lo ejerció, al casarse y buscando el bienestar económico de su familia, con el apoyo de su suegra quien le enseño la elaboración de estos productos a base de azúcar decidió dedicarse a este negocio hace 3 años con mucho éxito.
