Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1500.00 , el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de confinados de maní, alfeñiques y turrones como: chancaca en atados, maní en quintales (bolsas de 50 kilos) y bolsas plásticas para el embasado de estos productos. Isabel tiene 24 años, 2 hijitos pequeños, es una mujer responsable y capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, esta contenta con lo que hace, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad que brinda al vender, desea ampliar su negocio a otras provincias de la región.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Habiba S.. She is a widow and has two children aged 6 and 11. She owns a rice and clothing business. Habiba has applied for this loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. For example, when a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. This is a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. They are, therefore, labelled ‘not-creditworthy’ by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services, for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing and rice in bulk

loans.name: Dinh Dung's Group

texts.vi:
• Mr. N. Dinh Dung (ID number: 020027), 50 years old, wants to borrow 150 USD to buy pigs to breed. Besides, he also plants vegetables in the garden and sells them at the supermarket. His average income is 8-9 USD/day. He has repaid his first loan.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Vien (ID number: 020029), needs 125 USD to breed chickens and pigs.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Bang (ID number: 020030), needs 125 USD to breed pigs. .
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hoa (ID number: 020061), needs 125 USD to breed chickens.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Huyen (ID number: 020062), needs 125 USD to breed pigs.
    • (This group has applied, and been posted under ID number 50849 before but with a wrong amount of loan. Now, this group is re-posted with the current ID. The actual amount of loan is 650 USD.)

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Chú Nguyễn Đình Dũng (MS: 020027), năm nay 50 tuổi. Chú vay 2.478.000 VND về mua lợn chăn nuôi. Ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chú còn trồng hoa màu, con chú bán hàng ở chợ. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chú là 110.000 VND/ ngày. Chú đã tham gia được 1 chu kỳ vay vốn và đã hoàn trả xong.

  • Chị Nghiêm Thị Viên (MS: 020029), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi gà, lợn.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Bang (MS: 020030), vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 020061), vay 2.006.000 VND để nuôi gà thịt.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Huyền (MS: 020062), vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.
  • (Nhóm nay đã được đăng và được cấp ID : 50849 nhưng nhầm số vốn vay. Nay nhóm được đăng lại. Tổng số vốn vay thực tế của nhóm là 10.502.000 VND).

loans.use: Chăn nuôi

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea V. and her husband are fisher who living in Roteang Village, Siem Reap Province. Their income is of $5 per day and care for seven children. Two of their children help him for fishing to generate family’s income. Their main income is fishing and they need to sustain and expanding her business. Because of growing her fishing business, they need a loan of $750 to purchase fishing tools and remainder of loan she will use to fix their boat. Their loan allows them increase income and improving living condition.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools and remainder of loan she will use to fix their boat

loans.name: Emina

texts.en: Emina lives in the town Doboj with her parents. She is not married. Emina works as a TV presenter on a local TV station, and her monthly salary is 600 KM. This is her first loan in the amount of 1200 KM, and she intends to use it to purchase some new accessories for a coffee shop. She is partnering with another girl. Emina wants to improve her offer in order to attract new customers and improve her profit.

loans.use: To buy new accessories

loans.name: Asha's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Asha is 45 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 20, 18, 10 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal and soup seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership, juice sales, charcoal sales, chips, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina has owned a small restaurant in Zanzibar since 2006.  She runs the restaurant daily from 7:00am to 9:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $85.  She is taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania so that she may buy more food to sell at the restuarant and increase her profit.  Amina is married with children, aged 5, 9, 13, 16 and 18.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng C., 52, is a widowed farmer and makes less than one dollar per day. She has five children, two of whom are garment workers. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tractor to plow her farmland. This tractor will be used to hire to the people in the village for extra profit to support the family as well.

loans.use: To purchase tractor.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon H., 48, is married and lives with her twin children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work making rice noodles and selling them at the village market. On average, they make a combined income of about $10 a day.

Mon H. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to operate a new business selling rice. This will allow her to make additional profit to help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Mbeche

texts.en:
Mbeche S. is married, and he has 6 dependants. He received schooling through junior high. His wife is a trader.

Since 2005, Mbeche has been in the business of selling groceries at Atobease in Elmina, including biscuits, canned products, etc. Mbeche uses the income he generates from his business to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. Mbeche is now seeking a loan to purchase more groceries in order to meet the increase in demand by his costumers. With the expected profits from his expanded business, Mbeche plans to invest further in his children's education.

loans.use: To expand his business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista M. L. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es soltero, este Señor tiene 53 años, Don Juan tiene 3 hijos su edades sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 25 años que trabaja por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 23 años que también trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 13 años cursa el 1 grado de primaria, sus aspiraciones son de adquirir otra unidad de taxi para descansar un poco mas y brindar un servicio de calidad a su clientes y garantizar una estabilidad familiar y económica a su hijo menor ya que sus deseos son que sus hijos logren las metas propuestas por ellos mismos por lo que se sentiría muy orgulloso al saber que sus hijos pueden manejar muy bien las dificultades que se le presenten.

La actividad económica a la que Don Juan se dedica es la venta de mercadería y además es taxista, la ubicación de ambos negocios es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Don Juan inicia esta actividad por empezó a desempeñarse como comerciante por lo que dio inicio a un negocio de distribuir sus productos a los diferentes clientes por lo que tuvo luchar mucho para llegar conseguir lo que el quería y al inicio comenzó con pocos productos como: pantalones, camisas y ropa interior y decide que la mejor manera es distribuir los productos a sus amistades y poco a poco fue aumentando en productos y en mercadería y cada una de sus ganancias las conservaba para establecerse con otro negocio como lo es el servicio de taxi ya si obtiene sus 2 negocios con ambos negocios logra sacar adelante a sus hijos con el fin de que estos se preparen para el futuro siendo el servicio de taxi el cual es la mejor fuente de ingresos para su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte además invertir en mercadería ya que sus amistades les han  hecho mucho encargos para la distribución de la mercadería y agradece a las organizaciones amigas y a la Fundación León 2000 por darle la oportunidad de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista M. L., 53, is a single father of three sons. The two oldest are 25 and 23, and they already live and work on their own. The youngest is 13 and attends middle school. Juan hopes to purchase another taxi to give himself some time to rest, to offer a better service to his customers, and to provide a stable family and economic situation for his youngest son. Juan's wishes for his sons is that they reach the goals that have set for themselves, and he feels very proud to know that his sons are able to overcome the obstacles they meet. Juan sells various merchandise, and also owns a taxi. He started 15 year ago selling pants, shirts and underwear to friends and neighbors, and little by little increase the merchandise he offered and the number of customers. He saved part of the profits from the clothing sales to buy a taxi. Both businesses allowed him to support his sons, but the taxi has been the main source of income for his family. The loan Juan is requesting will be used a work capital. He needs to pay for repairs and maintenance for his vehicle and to invest in more clothing items to distribute among customers who have already placed orders. Juan is thankful to Kiva partners and Fundacion Leon 2000 for the opportunity to do better.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose A. est revendeuse de bouillie depuis 6 mois, à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Agée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de et mère de 2 enfants. Avec ce crédit Rose espère acheter des sacs de maïs et de mil pour la préparation de sa nourriture
texts.en:
Rose A. has been selling porridge for six months in Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two. With this loan, Rose hopes to buy sacks of corn and millet for making this food.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and millet for making porridge

loans.name: Madumar

texts.en:
Madumar E. started his livestock business practically from scratch, but thanks to the previous loans he received from MicroInvest he has increased the size of his flock and started producing milk and yarn. He has been engaged in the livestock business for 10 years and now has one cow and 9 rams. He also works as the school's history teacher, but his love of animals brought him to livestock.

Today Madumar is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 TJS for 6 months to buy one more milk cow. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow

loans.name: Hamzali

texts.ru: Хамзали мужчина 45 лет , женат имеет четверых детей. Работает в сельском совете секретарём и помощником председателя сельсовета. Хамзали второй раз решил кредитоваться и увеличить свой скот в кредит. После первого займа у него скот увеличился, а также он отремонтировал свой хлев. Теперь в этот раз Хамзали хочет закупить породистых баранов. которых откормив он будет резать и продавать за хорошую цену, Т.к  таджикский народ любит мясо баранины.
texts.en:
Hamzali is a 45 year old man, he is married and has four children. He works as a secretary for the village council and as an assistant to the chairman of the village council. Hamzali has decided to take out a loan for the second time and to increase his livestock headcount via a loan. After the first loan his livestock count increased and he also repaired his barn. This time, Hamzali would like to purchase lambs that he will raise and then butcher and sell at a good price, since Tajik people love lamb meat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lambs

loans.name: Muzambil

texts.ru: Свой третий займ на КИВА Музамбил собирается и дальше вкладывать в свой бизнес. В ее личной жизни произошли некоторые изменения. Ее муж срочно выехал на заработки в Россию, где ему предложили хорошую высокооплачиваемую работу. Поэтому Музамбил осталась в магазине одна и решила привлечь на работу свою племянницу. Музамбил надеется, что заработок мужа и ее доход от торговли помогут достойно вырастить своих двоих маленьких детей.
texts.en:
Muzambil plans to use her third loan from Kiva to invest into her business. There were some changes in her life. Her husband has left to work in Russia where he was offered a good high paying job. This is why Muzambil was left in the store by herself and decided to attract her niece into the business. Muzambil hopes that her profits from the business and her husband's income will help them to decently raise their small children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Imara Group

texts.en:
Mwasi has been raising broiler chickens and selling eggs in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 7 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $100. She works every day at her business for 13 hours.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more broiler chickens to add her current stock, to have more eggs for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to increase her business.  

Mwasi is 36 years old, married, and has given birth to six children: ages 15, 8, 6, 3 and 1.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hadia, Asha and Jemeu. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chickens, to have more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo T., a 52-year-old father of three children, is married to a housewife and so is the sole income earner of the family. He has been farming for the last 22 years on his piece of land growing wheat, rice, tomato, cucumber and watermelon. Rahmatullo would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield as he needs to be able to meet the financial responsibility of educating his children and maintaining his family. But he lacks the capital. He therefore requests a 4,000 Somoni loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for growing his crops. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Tasleem Riaz Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. 
Another Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store. 
Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. 
Rubina baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike rental business. 
Salma baji wants a loan to buy bangles to sell.

Tasleem baji is the wife of Mr. R. and has lived in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Her husband has been an auto-rickshaw driver (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for the last five years. Tasleem baji is a very active lady who performs all her duties very efficiently and takes care of her family. She is applying for a loan to fix her husband’s auto-rickshaw, because its engine has a problem of seizing up and needs repair right away.
 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dramane Dembélé est âgé de 34 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, dès son jeune âge il s’intéressa  aux activités génératrices de revenus. Pendant 10 ans il faisait les travaux journaliers auprès des commerçants notamment le transport de leurs marchandises avec un pousse pousse au marché et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’apprendre la vente d’articles divers de boutique auprès de son oncle.  Depuis maintenant 4 ans il exerce cette activité et est très sollicité. 
Afin de renforcer de son commerce, Monsieur Dramane Dembélé décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il est son premier prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour  acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Dramane Dembélé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane Dembélé, age 34, is the father of four. He lives with this wife and children in the Faraba district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school, he got interested at an early age in income-generating work. For ten years, he used to work daily with merchants, especially in merchandise transport by cart at the marketplace and in the different district of Bougouni, though he was unsuccessful. So he decided to learn from his uncle how to sell various shop goods. For four years now, he has been working at this business and is in high demand. To bolster his business, he decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy various goods for his shop. He stocks up in Bamako (capital of Mali). His customers are composed of local people. With this loan, he plans to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that he envisions using to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for his shop

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga E. is 48, married and the father of four. His family lives
in a 'ger" district on the plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of the
Mongolian central provinces. His three youngest children are university
students and the eldest one is unemployed. Battulga has been running a horse
saddle making and sales business for the last three years.  Battulga purchases
wood, silver and iron as raw materials from the local market. The main body
of the saddle is made of wood, the steple is made of iron, and silver is used
to make a decoration. His spouse Gantuya, 42, helps his business always.
Since he makes quality saddles, they sell quickly. During the last
three years of hard work, his working capital has been increasing from
200,000 tugrugs to 800.000 tugrugs. He says  "For now I'm selling saddles to
local herders only. I'm thinking of finding more buyers, therefore planning to deliver saddles to
Ulaanbaatar, the capital city or neighbor provinces." With this loan, he will be purchasing saddle
wood.


About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his business

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: La asociación "San Gabriel" esta formada por catorce mujeres, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace trece años, se reúnen quincenalmente en el centro focal Villa tejada, actualmente su presidenta es Jeannette T., ella afirma que a lo largo de los años han formado un grupo de amigas que se apoyan cuando lo necesitan. Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, Norah por ejemplo vende joyas, otras elaboran y venden comida en  pensiones y puestos, también se dedican a la  venta de mandiles, muebles y comestibles. La asociación san Gabriel desea aumentar  sus ingresos, ya que la mayoría de sus hijos están en la universidad,para este objetivo necesitan comprar mercadería o insumos para invertir en sus negocios, tienen la seguridad de obtener mayores ventas y por ende mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The San Gabriel Association is a group of 14 women who have been working together with Pro Mujer for the past 13 years. They meet every two weeks in the Villa Tejada community center. Their current president is Jeannette T., who affirms that the members have formed friendships over the years and support one another when needed.

Different types of businesses are represented in this group. For example, Norah sells jewelry. Others prepare and sell food from boarding houses and vending stalls. Some members sell aprons, furniture and groceries. The San Gabriel Association desires to increase their earnings since most of their children attend university. For this reason, they need to buy more goods and supplies to invest into their businesses so that they can increase their sales and generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Leonor Mauricio

texts.pt:
Leonor Mauricio M. nasceu na cidade de maputo, viúva, de 34 anos de idade e mãe de 1 filho menor de idade escolar. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado de estudar após a separação dos seus progenitores, tendo ficado com a mãe sem capacidade financeira para costear as despesas escolares. Para alem da filha, sustenta sua mãe com mais 2 irmãos que ainda estão sob sua responsabilidade.

Mudou se de maputo para Matola-rio (limite entre distrito de Boane e cidade da Matola)
Casou se quando tinha 18 anos, ano em que aprendeu a fazer negócios para como forma de incrementar o ingresso familiar. Actualmente é dona do negocio que exerce a mais de 12 anos de experiência. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade (arroz, açúcar e outros). Para alem dos resultados do negocio, conta uma pensão, por ser viúva, no valor de 2.230,00MT com os qual sustenta a família e iniciou a construção de uma casa de alvenaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção da sua casa de alvenaria.
Obteve informações sobre a instituição graças as suas vizinhas e amigas que são também clientes.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a construção da sua casa para depois comprar mobiliário.
texts.en:
Leonor Mauricio M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is a widow, 34 years old, and has a young daughter who is in school. She was in school until sixth grade, when she had to leave her studies because her parents separated and her mother was no longer able to pay for her schooling. In addition to her daughter, she supports her mother and two siblings who are still under her care. , viúva, de 34 anos de idade e mãe de 1 filho menor de idade escolar. She moved from Maputo to Matola-Rio, on the border between the district of Boane and the city of Matola. She got married when she was 18 years old, the same year she learned to run a business as a way of increasing her family's income. She has owned a business for more than 12 years selling staple goods such as rice and sugar. In addition to her income from the business, she has a widow's pension of 2230 meticals a month, which helps support her family and pay for the construction of a brick house. She's never had loans with other institutions and this is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 10,000 meticals to buy construction materials for the house. She heard about the organization through her friends and neighbors who are also clients. She intends to pay off the loan on time and in full so she can request additional loans in order to finish building her house and buy furniture for it.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Akkajja-Omunaku Rehema Musiogi Group

texts.en:
Rehema M. is forty-five years old and married. She has five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of three dependents who are in school. 

Rehema sells produce, such as matooke (bananas). She has been in this business for five years. She will use her loan to purchase more produce to sell. She is a hard-working businesswoman who is willing to improve her business and prosper. She dreams about building a house.

loans.use: To purchase produce, such as bananas (matooke), to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie L. is from the village of Cabunga-an Clarin. She is 32 years old. Elsie is married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and save for future use. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Komlan Bila

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est lancée depuis 1999 dans le commerce de tubercules, en particulier des ignames. Elle exerce cette activité dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé ; elle a pris cette décision parce que son mari a eu sa retraite et ses revenus n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers et scolaires de leurs 04 enfants. La plupart de ses clients apprécient la qualité de ses ignames qui sont bien constituées pour le fufu. Elle vend ses ignames devant sa maison et s’approvisionne à Bassar, une ville située à plusieurs kilomètres de Lomé, et qui dispose de meilleures ignames. Elle voudrait disposer d’un nouveau stock, mais aussi se lancer dans la vente de maïs ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des ignames et 10 sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de paniers d'ignames

loans.name: Darou Mboumbaye 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous venons solliciter auprès de votre haute bienveillance un renouvellement de notre prêt réf : 79924 que nous avons soldé même avant échéance. La récolte a été bonne et nous avons bien vendu nos produits. Pour ne pas briser l'élan de notre activité qui est le maraichage, nous voudrions avec ce nouveau prêt, agrandir notre stock en semence et préparer la 2e saison de plantation de pépinières en oignon. Nous ne cesserons jamais de remercier Kiva de nous avoir permis de faire notre activité que nous maitrisons bien et qui nous permet de nous écarter de toute pesanteur sociale.
texts.en:
We kindly request a renewal of our loan ref: 79924 which we repaid even before the due date. The harvest was good and our products well sold. In order not to break the enthusiasm of our business in market gardening, we would like to, with this loan, increase our stock of seeds and to prepare the onion nurseries for planting in the second season. We will always thank Kiva having allowed us to do our business that we master well and which enable us to pull away from all weight of tradition.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for market gardening

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ma. Isabel D. es casada y con hijos en edad escolar, ella y su marido tienen su negocio propio establecido desde hace 2 años, de nombre “Abarrotes Aiko” y tiene ya su propia clientela ya que los buscan por la calidad de sus productos, porque encuentran siempre lo que buscan y la atención al cliente, y para seguir surtiendo algunos productos solicitados por sus clientes están tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is married with school-age children. Her and her husband have their own business, which they established two years ago and called "Abarrotes Aiko." They have their own customers who go to their grocery store for the quality of their products and because they always find what they are looking for. She is requesting this loan so that she can continue to keep the store stocked with the products that her customers want.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora CRESENCIA JERÓNIMO I., tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. La  socia presenta estudios hasta 6to de Secundaria, tiene 5 hijos y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
CRESENCIA se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: talcos, cremas, colonias, labiales, etc. y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles invirtió en la compra de mas productos de belleza como labiales, cremas, talcos, colonias, perfumes, etc. 
Con este crédito de 200.00 nuevos soles comprará labiales, colonias, cremas, talcos, etc. para estar  abastecida en campaña  navideña.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donde vender sus productos con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Cresencia Jeronimó I. is 50 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Little Seeds of Creativity). Cresencia completed her studies through the 6th year of secondary school. She has 5 children who are all independent.

Cresencia sells beauty products such as talcum powders, crèmes, colognes, lipsticks, and other items. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase more beauty products such as lipsticks, crèmes, talcum powders, colognes, perfumes, etc.

With this new loan of 200 soles, she will purchase lipsticks, colognes, crèmes, talcum powders, and other products for the Christmas season. She dreams of renting a stand at a shopping center where she can sell her products more frequently and easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Samer has been working as a car electrician for over a year. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region, and now Samer is respected because he has proven to be a trustworthy electrician who does good work. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and equipment so he can continue to build his business. This is the first time that Samer has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by selling spare car parts.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Melania De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Melania M. en el departamento de Masaya siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de comida y en esta ocasión en el mes de Diciembre se está dedicando legalmente aprobada por las autoridades a la venta de pólvora vendida exclusivamente a personas adultas y con mucha responsabilidad ya que en este mes muchas personas celebran la Navidad y el fin de Año y para esto muchos hacen uso de la pólvora entre las que se encuentran candelas de colores, volcanes, luces de colores, entre otros.

El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de la pólvora para surtir su establecimiento y así obtener los ingresos para llevarlos a su hogar ya que ella es viuda y tiene un hijo a su cargo al que debe de brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Melania M. has always sold food in the Masaya department. On this occasion in the month of December, she has been legally approved by the authorities to sell fireworks. She sells them exclusively to very responsible adults. Many people celebrate Christmas and New Year’s this month. Many use fireworks such as colored candles, volcanoes, and colored lights, among others. The loan she is asking for is to buy fireworks to stock her establishment. This way she will get earnings to take to her household. She is a widow, and she is raising one child. She needs to provide him with the necessary conditions for his development.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
Maria is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is member of a communal bank in Cusco consisting of 20 members.  The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s daughters” in Spanish).  Maria is married and lives with her husband and three sons in Cusco.  Her two oldest sons are university students. 

Maria owns and runs a general goods store in the city of Cusco.  She sells rice, oil, sugar, flour, some fruits and vegetables, snacks, beverages and beer.  She makes the most money selling soft drinks and beer as these have relatively higher profit margins, and she sells a lot of both.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her store and also to help pay for her sons’ education.

Maria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: C9454 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Gratien is 37 years old, married with 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old.  Gratien is the president of a group called dufatanye.  Gratien and his group operates the business of selling a variety of goods including second hand clothes, shoes etc in the Gicumbi, a region of Byumba situated in the northern province of Rwanda.  The business hours are from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

After 6 years of experience in the business, Gratien and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing additional various sizes of shoes and clothes to satisfy their customers.  With this loan, as it will allow them to increase their original investment,  they hope that their sales will be increased as well as the profits.  Through the progress of the business Gratien and his team have a hope for the future.

loans.use: A variety of additional clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 45-year-old married lady with three children. She raises chickens for sale at her place in Githurai. She has been in this business five years. Besides poultry farming, Purity wants to open a tailoring shop so that she can boost her income for the family’s well being. She already has the sewing machines, so all she needs is the materials and a place to set up the shop.

Purity was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. This is her fourth loan and she has had no previous loans from other micro-finance institutions. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed, and in addition she also plans to stock the tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed, and to open a tailoring shop

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im M. is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Phum Thom village in Kandal province. She is the mother of three children who all are students in the local school. Mrs. Im M. stays at home and cares for her children. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Khov, is a chef in a restaurant earning a small salary to support his family. 

With her husband's work place far from the house, Mrs. Im M. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for husband's transportation. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married with seven children. Two of her children finished school and the rest are still schooling. She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Fatuma takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Fatuma owns a grocery store in Naguru where she sells samosas, pancakes, donuts, fried groundnuts, sugar, soap and bread. She sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. She works six days a week. Besides this grocery shop, she also owns a popcorn machine.  Fatuma receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years. She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 17th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy bags of sugar, bread, ground nuts, milk and cooking oil. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a supermarket. She joined MCDT because it was near her home.

loans.use: To buy more bread, sugar, groundnuts and popcorn

loans.name: Honest, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
In business, first impressions mean everything. That is one adage that never slips N. Florence’s mind. In her three years doing business, her commitment, friendly nature, and hard work have brought her dividends in her tailoring business in Ibanda town.

This is the fascinating story of a young single go-getter business lady. Her business, since its inception, has steadily been bringing her profits to the tune of 70,000 shillings weekly. With this loan she is gleefully upbeat that her business will gain further ground as she intends to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines in attempt to expand business

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Progressive” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Gibril S. K. (left) is the leader of this group. The 58-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have seven children. Gibril has been a businessman for over 20 years. He sells toothpaste, batteries and bars of soap. With his share of this loan, Gibril will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, batteries and bars of soap

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es soltera, tiene 1 hijos por la cual trabaja, Agripina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa variada, muchos de los cuales son pedidos de sus clientes, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades viaja a Lima.
Agripina integra el Banco Comunal Violeta y necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de blusas, pantalones.
Agripina sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Agripina is single and has one child, for whom she works. Agripina travels to the Ayacucho jungle, where she sells various clothes, many of which are requested by her clients. She buys her products in the city of Ayacucho and whenever she travels to Lima. Agripina is a member of the Violeta (Violet) Community Bank, and she needs a loan for 2000 soles, which she will invest to buy blouses and pants. Agripina dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es: Aniceto, se caracteriza por ser un hombre laborioso, tiene 55 años, casado con Donata de 54 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos ya independientes. Está pareja vive en su vivienda propia. La siembra de papa, representa gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron las técnicas agrícolas para ser un buen productor de tubérculos como lo es ahora. Cuando es temporada de cosecha, su esposa lo ayuda. Generalmente se encarga de cuidar sus animales, como: carneros, vacas, toros, cerdos y asnos, actividad que lo realiza desde que se casaron, además el venderlos les ha salvado de crisis económica. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es cosechar papas y seleccionarlos por tamaños, sin embargo le molesta que los clientes le engañen en el precio, tanto trabajo sin ser reconocido económicamente. En adelante continuará sembrando, pero en mayor cantidad, además cultivará variedades de tubérculos, como la nativa y de colores que son la que tiene más demanda en el mercado. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal y por tal se siente orgulloso de pertenecer a un grupo muy unido y dispuesto a salir adelante, por ello vienen ahorrando de manera organizada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes, para mejorar la producción de sus tubérculos.
texts.en:
Aniceto, 55, is characterized by being a hard-worker. He’s married to Donata, 54, and they have three children who are all now independent. This couple lives in their own home and most of their life is dedicated to potato farming. He learned farming skills when he was very young from his parents who taught him how to be a good tuber farmer. During harvest time his wife helps him. Generally, she tends to their animals like: sheep, cows, bulls, pigs and asses, an activity she’s been in since they got married. Selling animals has sheltered them from the economic crisis. What he enjoys the most about farming is harvesting potatoes and sorting them by size. What annoys him are customers that try to cheat him on the price, so much work for so little economic reward. He will continue planting but in larger amounts. In addition, he will grow a variety of tubers like the native one and the colored ones that are in highest demand in the market. This is his 4th loan with MFP and because he’s familiar with the work methodology of his communal group he feels proud to be part of a unified group that’s willing to get ahead and save in an organized fashion. He will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of fertilizer to improve his tuber production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V. is from the village of Tuburan in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old and married with 5 adult children. To make a living, Teresita buys and sells bananas in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Melvien

texts.en:
Melvien E. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old, single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melvien owns a business selling home products especially cosmetics. Melvien has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melvien joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melvien from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella P. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Bella is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a business selling banana products in the local community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Bella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 55 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hijo adolescente. Hace más de 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, verduras y condimentos en general,  situado en el primer ambiente de su casa,  y sus clientes son las amas de casa de su barrio, que gustan de la buena atención que les brinda. Su bodega es la más concurrida de su zona, por ello procura abastecerse de pollo, carnes, verduras y frutas frescas, productos perecibles para el consumo diario. Esta feliz  por le negocio que realiza; ya que es muy tranquilo y entretenido, de paso cuida el bienestar de su familia y su hogar. En adelante espera ampliar  y diversificar su negocio, por eso desea tener una librería ya que nadie en su zona vende este rubro. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy, además se siente a gusto de trabajar con sus compañeras de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos, de ese modo podrá abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia is the 55-year-old mother of a very happy family. She lives in her own home, with her husband and their teenage son. Since over 7 years ago, she has sold household goods, vegetables and general groceries from the front room of her house. Her customers are the housewives from her neighbourhood, who appreciate the attentive service she offers them. Her store is the busiest in the area, so she stocks up with plenty of chicken, meat, vegetables and fresh fruit - perishable every day products. Lucia is happy with the business she has built: it is calm and enjoyable to work there, and at the same time she can take care of her home and her family's wellbeing. Going forward, she hopes to grow and diversify her business - for instance she would like to have a bookshop, because no-one in her area is in that line of business. This is Lucia's 15th loan with [field partner] MFP, and she promises to make all her repayments on time as she has been doing up to now. She also looks forward to working with her companions in the communal bank. She will invest the loan she is seeking in buying products so that she can supply her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Katy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katy;  La socia tiene 30 años de edad;  ella es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en San Jerónimo; La socia  es comerciante, ella vende carne en el mercado vino canchón; La socia tiene un stand en la sección carnes rojas, ella vende carne fresca en su stand, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor del camal carne de vaca. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne de vaca al por mayor. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old, married, and lives in San Jerónimo with her two children. Katy is a merchant who sells meat at the Vino Canchón Market. She has a vending stall in the red meats section where she sells fresh beef. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beef in bulk directly from the slaughterhouse.

Katy appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beef in bulk

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina T. is a 33-year-old charcoal dealer in Jomvu, Mombasa. Penina is married to William who also supports the family with his income. They are blessed with four children. Peninah has been in this business for the last four years and she is doing great. 

This is Penina’s first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business and use the anticipated profit to open a green grocery.

She hopes to be successful in both her businesses and expand more.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
It was after she got apprentice training at a local institution that 38-year-old K. Oliver nurtured the idea of starting her now four-and-a-half-year-old tailoring business. She combines this business with second hand clothing sales, all in Napier market in Jinja. Oliver’s group is called Tweyambe Women’s group. 

She is happily married with three kids. Before she even thought of beginning these businesses she was more into milk selling, given that she had a cow at home. It’s a business she still operates though at a lower level. On a weekly basis her business generates her about $40. 

With her portion of this loan Oliver says she is going to purchase a new sewing machine and also buy more second hand clothing for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of a new sewing machine and also the purchase of more second hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a father of four sons and three daughters. He started a small store, selling and fixing computers. Jamal has very good experience in this field, which he has been working in for years.

Jamal wants to improve his store and increase the number of his clients. He took a $1,000 loan from FATEN to purchase the repair tools he needs.  The store is the only source of income for Jamal's family. 

Jamal appears here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase computer repair tools

loans.name: Argen

texts.en:
Argen B. is from the village of Malinao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 21 years old. Argen is married and has two young infants. To make a living, Argen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods and beverages in the local community. Argen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Argen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Argen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Argen is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Argen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a married, 32-year-old woman living in a historic city of Pakistan known as Lahore. She lives with her family in their three-room house, where she moved after her marriage ten years ago. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a nearby school and are receiving their education. Her husband’s name is E. A. and he works in a hospital. Shazia explains that she had to stop going to school after the 10th grade due to her family's poor finances, but she knows and understands the importance of a good education. She wants her children to complete their education and, therefore, she works very hard.

To earn a living, Shazia is a beauty expert. Specifically, she provides beauty salon services to her clients, which include bridal makeup work and makeup for other parties. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy beauty-related items such as makeup kits, face packs, and creams in bulk quantity so that she can provide better services to her clients. She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her business and that she will be able to realize greater profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional beauty products in bulk

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en la ciudad D. Lambayeque, una zona D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. verduras en un puesto D. venta ubicado en el mercado modelo D. la ciudad. Ella ofrece sus productos diariamente y los adquiere en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio y al buen trato que brinda, ella cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles.

Julia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más verduras D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Julia es una mujer amable y con muchas ganas D. superación, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto
texts.en:
Julia is a 58-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and children in the city of Lambayeque, a commercial area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells vegetables from a stand located in the central market of the city. She offers her products daily and obtains them from the wholesale market in Chiclayo. Due to the good customer service she has provided for so long, she has created a loyal customer base. 

Julia wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more vegetables in order to satisfy current customer demand, so with Edpyme Alternativa she has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to achieve her goal. 

Julia is a nice woman who is eager to overcome problems and those who know her have a lot of respect for her.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in order to satisfy business demand

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
Minkailu is 36 years old and married, with 4 children ages 18, 13, 11 and 4. In 2000, Minkailu established his cosmetics and household items business because he wanted to take care of his family. 

Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, Minkailu earns about Le 1,467,800 every month. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to purchase new products. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 293,560. In the future, Minkailu plans to expand his business, build a house and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics and household items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Minaog. She is 53 years old, married and has ten adult children. Elizabeth operates a family member's business in the services sector, primarily tailoring for the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was invested in expanding her business. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for her tailoring. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for tailoring

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.en:
Burulbu T. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. She is 57 and married to a security guard. Together they have raised four sons and a daughter, and all the children are working.  

Burulbu is engaged in cattle breeding. Selling milk, she earns 2,400 KGS per month. With money from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future Burulbu wants to see all her children married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 28-year-old hardworking father of two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his children alone, and his dream is to educate them up to the university level. For a year he has been providing motorcycle transport and the business has helped him provide the basics for his family. His hardship is limited funds, and his dream is to own a motorcycle and stop working for others. Peter intends to use this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una de nuestras pequenas empresarias, que ha reforzado su negocio con varios prestamos que ha tomado, en la actualidad esta recibiendo su 4 prestamos, despues de haber realizado sus pagos correctamente y haberlos invertido todos en su negocio, el cual inicio con una poca cantidad que puedo ahorrar hace unos 8 años aproximados, y luego decidio tomar su primer prestamo y formar su colmado. Los colmados en Republica Dominicana, son pequenas tiendas de alimentos y comestibles, que se establecen en los barrios o comunidades para que personas puedan comprar su alimentos.

Maria tiene 3 hijos y es una señora casa, pasa su día, atendiendo su negocio y cuidando de su familia. Piensa utilizar este prestamo para la compra de cosmeticos y productos miscelaneos para una mostrador que coloco y asi poder proveer a sus vecinos de estas mercancias.

Sus sueños es poder tener un negocio estable y sostenible. Le agradece a todos por su apoyo en su nombre y de su grupo. Gracias.
texts.en:
Maria is one of our small businesswomen who has strengthened her business through several loans that she has taken out with us.  She is currently receiving her fourth loan, having paid back her previous loans correctly and invested them all in her business.  She started her business with a small amount of money that she had saved up approximately 8 years ago.  She decided to request her first loan to set up her 'colmado'.  In the Dominican Republic, 'colmados' are small neighborhood or community stores that sell food products so that locals can buy their food there.

Maria is married and has 3 children.  She spends her days serving in her business and looking after her family.  She is planning to use this loan to buy cosmetics and miscellaneous products for a counter that she has set up so that she can supply her neighbors with these products too.

Maria's dream is to have a stable and sustainable business.  She would like to thank everybody for their support both on her own behalf and also on behalf of her group.  Thank you.

loans.use: To buy food products and other products

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four members who live in Kansaom Khlaeng village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mr. Sophea O. is the group leader, selected by the other members. He is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Srey Sor Choeun, does housework. This couple supports two children who are both too young to work or study. At present, he has a problem because he does not have enough water. To improve this situation, he is applying for a loan to dig a pool to collect water for use in the dry season.

loans.use: To dig a pool to collect water for use in the dry season

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en casa propia en Morropon, una ciudad en el departamento de Piura, a más de 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 4 años, Elena tiene un Bar – Picantería, un establecimiento donde vende comida, piqueos y bebidas como cerveza, chicha y gaseosas. El negocio se encuentra en su propio domicilio. Elena es muy conocida en la región y cuenta con una clientela establecida.

Desea ampliar su negocio con su crédito y planea comprar útiles escolares para vendérselos a sus clientes durante la campaña escolar. Con esta inversión, Elena puede lograr mayores ganancias y mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia. Para realizar sus metas, Elena ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Elena es muy trabajadora y posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Ha tenido otros préstamos y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Elena is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in their own home in Morropon, a city in Piura department, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

For 4 years, Elena has run a bar - restaurant.  In her establishment she sells meals, snacks and drinks such as beer, 'chicha' (a traditional corn-based drink) and soda.  Her business is located in her home.  Elena is very well known in the region and she has an established customer base.

Elena would like to use her loan to expand her business.  She also plans to buy school supplies to sell to her customers during the back-to-school season.  With this investment, Elena will be able to achieve better profits and improve her family's quality of life.  In order to achieve her goals, Elena is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Elena is very hard working and has good personal references and work references from her community.  She has had previous loans and made her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy and sell school supplies

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores M. R. tiene 40 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar ganado.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores M. R. is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda canton of the Bolivar province.  She has 5 children.

The members of the V.R.C Women's Group Mushuc Nan are in the Guanto Cruz community, Guanujo parish and belong to the Guaranda canton.  This group of 22 members works in farming, growing mulberries and corn, raising livestock and dairy cattle and making cheeses.

Maria works in farming, raising mulberries and corn, and raising livestock.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her products in the market of Guaranda.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies, livestock and animal feed.  The loan will help her to financially meet her responsibilities and overcome the challenges such as plagues, illnesses and climate changes.  Her dream is to buy livestock.

She likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and small animals and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Segundo Faustino

texts.es:
Segundo  tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y  tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Residen en el distrito de Motupe, localidad que se caracterizada por su fe y su gente emprendedora.  Se ubica a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la  cría de ganado vacuno lechero y además obtiene otros ingresos por el servicio de transporte (mototaxi) ; esta actividad la realiza desde hace 05 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Segundo desea realizar algunas mejoras a su mototaxi que es su herramienta de trabajo. Asimismo desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Segundo is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children who are his dependents. He lives in the Motupe District, a place that is known for its faith and enterprising people. It is located an hour and a half from Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. 
He raises deer, vacuña, milk cows and he also has a transportation service (a motortaxi). He has been doing this activity for the past five years, so he knows his business well. He has established customers from his area. Segundo would like to make some improvements to his motortaxi, which is the tool for his work. Also he would like to buy some tools that he will use to keep his motortaxi in good condition and thereby continue to offer good service to his customers. With the help of his loan, he will increase his earnings and make some improvements to his house. This is why he finds himself asking for this loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Diana Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana Álvarez es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el sector del Crea en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos para visitar, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones

La Señora. Diana tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 7 años de edad, sus tres hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.
 
Doña Diana se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años, vende su mercadería en su casa de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo, la mayoría de su clientela son sus amigos y conocidos.

En la banca comunal se encuentra hace 6 años, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra mercadería como: camisetas, blusas, pantalones, ropa de niños, etc. para ampliar mucho más su negocio.

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana Álvarez is a member of the communal bank El Crédito. She lives in the Crea section of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and has various tourist sites to visit. Its gastronomy attracts the palates of locals and foreigners. Its people maintain the culture and traditions. 

Diana is 33-years-old. She's married and has 3 children of 12, 11, and 7-years-old. Her three children study in a small school in the city. Her husband is currently out of the country. They don't have their own home and are renting.

Diana sells all types of clothes for a living. She's been doing this for 3 years. She sells her merchandise from her house 7 days a week and without a fixed schedule. The majority of her customers are friends and acquaintances.

She's been with the communal bank for 6 years. She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise such as: t-shirts, blouses, pants, children's clothes, etc. in order to expand her business. 

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: buy t-shirts, blouses, pants, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel es chofer. El crédito lo requiere para la reparación de su vehiculo ya que tuvo un accidente de transito y necesita nuevos frenos y arreglar la dirección y trabajo en una puerta; el vehiculo  es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener los gastos de su familia. Vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona de San Pedro; es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel is a driver.  He is in need of a loan to repair his automobile since he had a traffic accident.  The vehicle requires new brakes and repairs to the steering column and one of the doors.  His transport service is his main source of income and covers household expenses.

He lives in rental property in the San Pedro area, is married and has a son.  This is his first loan through IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Martha Andreina

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, cuna de grandes atletas y escritores, cuenta con una variada gastronomía, su gente es calida y amable.

Doña Martha tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
